loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown-up children from Duero, Bohol. She is a food vendor who sells home-cooked foods to the people in her area.

Anastacia is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients, such as flour, sugar, milk, and margarine, for her cooking venture. This will allow her to cook, sell, and earn more
.
In the future, Anastacia dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 32 years old and married with one child who is four years old. Samuel is known for selling local drinks. He has two years of experience and works from 7 a.m until 7 p.m every day except Sunday. 

Samuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell. With this loan, he will hopefully earn more profits. This will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and to earn enough to pay his child's school fees.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La señora Ines es una persona con valores muy acentuados por sus padres, la honradez, la humildad, el respeto y el trabajo son cualidades que la definen muy bien, siendo un ejemplo para sus 5 hijos.

El credito solicitado a Fodemi es para la compra de productos, frutas y verduras, ya que la señora Ines viaja hacia lugares alejados de la ciudad a vender y a distribur a pequeñas tiendas de las comunidades. un trabajo de sacrificio pero que lo hace con mucho amor, sabiendo que cada dia puede llevar alimento a su casa.

El sueño que Doña Ines tiene es comprarse una camion grande donde pueda ir a vender sus productos, y no solo frutas y verduras sino diferentes productos de consumo masivo, ella esta segura que con trabajo lo va a lograr, y con estos ingresos darles la educacion a sus 4 hijos que todavia dependen de ella.
texts.en:
Sra. Ines is a person who has values, such as honesty, humility, respect, and hard work that were emphasized by her parents. These qualities have shaped who she is and have allowed her to set an example for her five children.

She is requesting a loan from FODEMI so that she can buy products, such as fruits and vegetables. Sra. Ines travels to distant places away from the city to sell and distribute her products to small stores in these communities. Her work requires great sacrifice, yet she performs her duties with great care since she knows that she will be able put food on the table each day.

Doña Ines dreams of buying a large truck that she can use when selling her products. Not only does she sell fruits and vegetables, but she also offers different products that are consumed in mass quantities. She is confident in the work she has achieved and will use her earnings to pay for the education of the four children who are still dependent on her.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a 64-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown-up children from Duero, Bohol. She is a rice vendor. She buys newly harvested rice from the farm and sells it to the market. 

Aurelia is asking for a loan to buy more rice and sacks for storage. This will allow her to buy more rice to sell in the market.

In the future, Aurelia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more rice and sacks for storage.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a 37-year-old farmer in Kitale, Kenya where she lives with her husband and her five children, only one of whom is still in school. Sidi has been farming for the past fifteen years, producing maize, milk, and vegetables, which she sells at the local market. Unreliable workers are her major challenge in farming.

Sidi is requesting a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This will give her more milk and, thus, more income to help her educate her children and improve her family's standard of living.

Sidi appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's efficiency in processing loans.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia operates a store in Elimina, Ghana. For several years, she has been selling frozen meat, chicken, and fish. Cecilia is married and has six children who are in school. She uses her income to help her husband feed and clothe their children and to pay their school fees.  

Cecilia will use her loan to purchase more frozen meat, chicken, and fish to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Cecilia will buy a bigger deep freezer for her business.

loans.use: purchase more frozen meat, chicken, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Chepkirui

texts.en:
Chepkirui is 32 years old. She and her husband, Kasura, are blessed with two children whom she supports. For three years, Chepkirui has been a tea farmer in Narok, and her monthly income is 25,000 KES. 

Chepkirui has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD. It will allow her to buy farm supplies for better crop yields and land cultivation. The anticipated profits will be used to support her business. In the future, she hopes for a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en: Felixberta is a 58-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for several years now. Felixberta is asking for a loan to buy more feed for her pigs. With this, she will be able to raise healthy pigs. In the future, Felixberta hopes to improve her business to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine, a 30-year-old married mother of a four-year-old child, has been selling sorghum for two years now. She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. everyday, with two people to help her.

Vestine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy large quantities of sorghum to sell. With this loan, she will earn more profits which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and pay her child's school fees and medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa forma parte del Banco Comunal “Los Luceros” pertenecientes a la comuna de Padre las Casas, ubicada en la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de almacén, desde hace 9 años. Comenta que trabaja todos los días, junto con su hija, ofrece abarrotes, frutas y mercadería surtida a su clientela. Habilitó un lugar de su casa para poner su almacén y estar más segura y ceca de su hogar.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en diferentes supermercados y ferias donde encuentra verduras y frutas para abastecer su negocio a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito compra una heladera y mercadería como arroz, tallarines, aceites, sal, mantequilla, entre otros.
Una de las metas de Elisa es continuar con su negocio, poder surtirlo aun más, para tener más clientela y así generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Elisa vive junto a su hija quien le ayuda con las ventas del negocio. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es poder agrandar su negocio y tener más clientela, ofrecer otro tipo de mercadería y a nivel personal tener buena salud para seguir atendiendo su negocio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
Elisa is part of Los Luceros Communal Bank in the Padre Las Casas community in the city of Temuco.  She has made a living with a grocery store for nine years.  She says she works every day, along with her daughter.  She sells her customers groceries, fruit, and assorted merchandise.  She fixed up a place in her house to put in her store and be safer and close to her home.  She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs in various supermarkets and street fairs where she finds vegetables and fruits to stock her business at a low cost, so it's economically advantageous.

With the loan she'll buy a refrigerator and rice, pasta, oil, salt, butter, and other merchandise.

One of Elisa's goals is to continue with her business, to be able to stock it even more so she'll have more customers and generate greater income for her household and have a better quality of life.

Elisa lives with her daughter, who helps her with the sales in her business.  Her dream for work is to be able to expand her business and have more customers and to offer other types of merchandise.  On a personal level, she wants to have good health to continue taking care of her business.

She's very happy about and grateful for the opportunity from Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business.  She says the training sessions have been fundamental for her business and for her personal development because she has learned to better organize and distribute her income and investments.

Padre Las Casas is a community in the south of Chile near the city of Temuco in the Araucanía region.  It was named in honor of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas who was a defender of the indigenous people during the conquest.  There's a large Mapuche population in this community, and its economy is based on agro-industry and commercial services.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and rice, pasta, oil, salt, butter, and other merchandise

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba, administra una tienda, vive en compañía de su esposo y dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la fuerza armada, por su parte Alba administra una tienda de sus ganancias ayuda a mantener cubiertos los gastos del hogar, este negocio tiene ocho meses de existir, poco a poco ha ido surtiéndolo, su ventaja es que la competencia es mínima.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de más productos para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes, comprando aceite, azúcar, harina, pan, arroz, boquitas, detergentes, que le ayudaran a mejorar sus ingresos.
Los sueños de Alba es tener una tienda más grande, para el fortalecimiento del negocio, mejorando su atención al cliente.
texts.en:
Alba manages a store. She lives with her husband, who is in the armed forces, and their two children. With the earnings from her store, Alba is able to maintain the household expenses. Her business has been in existence for eight months and she has been able to stock it gradually over time. Her main advantage is that the level of competition is minimal.

Alba is requesting a loan so that she can buy more products to satisfy the needs of her customers. She will buy oil, sugar, flour, bread, rice, snack foods, and detergents to help improve her earnings.

Alba dreams of having a larger store, strengthening her business, and improving service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, flour, bread, rice, snack foods, and detergents.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 55-year-old business lady. She is married to Philemon and they are blessed with three children. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET LTD staff member. Mary will use the loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop and improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is twenty-six years old and married with two children, ages three and six years. She purchases and sells various goods such as soap, lotions, sugar and rice. She has been in this business for two years, and she currently employs one person to help her.

Clementine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as soap, lotions, sugar and rice to resell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as soap, lotions, sugar and rice to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of two children aged 8 and 14. She earns a living through her sari-sari store (variety store). Josephine aims to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. However, with a loan from CEVI, she will be able to to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, snack food and other items to sell in her store. This will allow her to cater to more buyers in her store. In the future, Josephine aims to make her business a success; and to make it sustainable. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to resell in her store such as canned goods, noodles and snack food.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is involved in agriculture. Together with her family, she keeps livestock, including four cows, fifteen lambs, two pigs, fifteen little pigs and thirty-five chickens. With the requested amount, Rita plans to increase the number of livestock with one cow, one calf and fifteen more lambs. The loan is very important for this family as agriculture is their sole source of financial income. Expanding the business will give Rita an opportunity to earn more income and cover her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a calf and fifteen lambs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married and has three children. She is 35 years old, and all of her children are in school. Lorna is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, such as perfumes, body lotions and other personal products.

Lorna has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, such as perfumes, body lotions and other personal products.

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es:
Myriam forma parte del Banco Comunal “Los Luceros” pertenecientes a  la comuna de Padre las casas, ubicada en la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica a la venta de animales, desde hace 6 años. Comenta que trabaja en su campo, criando y vendiendo animales como gallinas, cerdos, corderos y pollos,  trabaja todos los días y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, vende sus animales en ferias y algunas veces a sus vecinos de confianza.
La mercadería que va necesitando en cuanto a animales los compra en ferias que se especializan en vender animales, en remates a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará pollos, cerdos y chancado ( El chancado es un proceso mecánico de aplastamiento de los granos de cereales para transformarlos en hojuelas para que sean aptos para el suministro animal).
Una de las metas de Myriam es seguir con el rubro y a la vez aprovechar el campo que posee para cultivar y cuidar sus árboles frutales, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Myriam vive junto su pareja. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es cuidar su campo y cultivar verduras  para producir más ventas.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía. Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
Myriam forms part of the Communal Bank "Los Luceros" (The Bright Stars) in the Padres Las Casas county in the Temuco commune. She has dedicated herself to the sale of animals for the past six years. She says she works in the field, raising and selling animals like hens, pigs, lambs, and chicken. She works every day and makes her schedule according to her availability. She sells her animals at fairs and sometimes to neighbors she knows well.

She will soon need the animals which she buys at fairs that specialize in animal sales. She buys them in auctions at low costs, therefore it is economically convenient. She will use this loan to to buy chicken, pigs, and chancado (processed, flattened grains that comes in sheets, making them apt for animal supplies)

One of Myriam's goals is to continue in her field and take advantage of the field which she has to cultivate and care for her fruit trees. This is how she opts for a better quality of life. 

Myriam lives together with her partner. Her dreams at in regard to laor are to care for the field and cultivate vegetables to produce more sales. She is so content and grateful for the opportunities which Fondo Esperanza has provided her that she has allowed them to invest in her company. Furthermore, she feels very comfortable with the company of the other entrepreneurs in the Communal Bank group. They share different activities and interests which have served them as hobbies.

In respect to the training she has received when they get together, she has learned to better administer her business. Padre Las Cases is a county in the south of Chile, near the city of Temuco, in the Araucanía region. Its name honors the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas, who defended indigenous people during the American conquest. It stands out for the large Mapuche population in the county. Its economy is based in the agricultural industry and in commercial services.

loans.use: to buy chicken, pigs, and chancado (processed, flattened grains that comes in sheets, making them apt for animal supplies)

loans.name: Yvy Barbara

texts.es: La Sra.  Yvy tiene 34 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 12 años, ella se dedica a la venta de de variedad de ropa de temporada y en esta ocasión ella vende variedad de chompas, ella tiene un puesto fijo en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la zona de Pampahasi donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Yvy va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de  chompas  por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio y también que se acerca la época de de fin de año y esta época es de mucha demanda, la Sra. Yvy va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa, la Sra. Yvy es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Yvy, 34, has a 12-year-old son.  She makes a living selling a variety of seasonal clothing, and now she's selling sweaters.  She has a fixed spot in one of the busiest markets in the Pampahasi area where she sells her products.

This loan is Yvy's first sequence with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy a variety of sweaters wholesale to offer her customers more variety and increase her profits.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving in her business.  Also, the end of the year is coming and there's a lot of demand this time of year.

Yvy's going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of clothing.  Yvy's a very hardworking person.  She's happy for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sweaters wholesale

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
Benicia es la presidenta de este grupo llamado Porvenir, el cual está trabajando en la ciudad del San Lorenzo. Benicia es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que está saliendo adelante por medio de su trabajo, y de esa forma ayuda a su familia.
Ella se dedica a la costura y también a las ventas varias. Benicia como presidenta trata siempre de poder apoyar a sus amigas del grupo, y asi animarlas a seguir trabajando y salir adelante con el trabajo de cada una. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder comprar telas e hilos para su taller de costura.
Todas las miembros estan muy contentas por la ayuda que estan recibiendo, ya que sus familias también se ven beneficiadas con ellas.
texts.en:
Benicia is the president of the group called “Porvenir” (Future). This group works in the city of San Lorenzo. Benicia is a hardworking and enterprising individual who is able to move forward because of her business. As a result, she is able to help her family.

Benicia is a seamstress and also sells different items. As president, Benicia always tries to help her friends in the group. She is excited about continuing to work and move forward with the other members. Benicia is requesting a loan so that she can buy fabrics and thread for her sewing workshop.

All of the members are very pleased with the assistance they have received. As a result, their families will also benefit from their efforts.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two children, ages 8 and 7. She earns a living through her store. She sells various goods to the people in her place.

Maricel is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store, such as snack food, canned goods, soda and beverages, toiletries and other items. With this, she can sell more and gain more.

Maricel hopes of expanding her business in the future and to continue supporting her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store, such as snack food, canned goods, soda and beverages, toiletries and other items.

loans.name: Milaflor

texts.en:
Milaflor is a 34-year-old married woman from Duero, Bohol and the mother of three children. She runs an upholstery shop in her home. She has been in this business for more than six years.
Milaflor is asking for a loan to buy supplies, such as foam, leatherette, thread, etc. for her upholstery venture. With this loan, she will be able to serve more clients in her shop, thus allowing her to increase her earnings.
Milaflor wants to expand her business, and she saves money so that she can support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her upholstery business, such as foam, leatherette and thread.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is 43 years old, married, and has three children between 3 and 18 years of age. He sells lemonade and other local drinks. He currently employs three people to help him, and he has 20 years of experience in this work. 

Antoine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various more drinks for resale. If there are profits, he will be able to save money for his future, to pay school fees for his children, and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy lemonade and other local drinks for resale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 43 years old, married, and has five children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Helen has a fishing business in the Philippines. Helen has requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Helen has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma forma parte del Banco Comunal “Los Luceros” perteneciente a la comuna de Padre las Casas, ubicada en la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica en vender comida rápida, desde hace 5 años. Se desempeña en sus funciones de lunes a domingo desde las 11ºº hasta las 00ºº horas de la noche, tiene bastante clientela donde ofrece churrascos, completos, papas fritas, helados, bebidas, algunas veces trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijas. Adapto un espacio en su casa para la venta de comida rápida.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando la compra en carnicerías, diferentes supermercados, y en las ferias encuentra papas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará papas y harina.
Una de las metas de Norma es tener  la posibilidad de tener un local más grande para colocar sus maquinas con más espacio y atender de mejor manera a su clientela.
Norma vive junto a sus cuatro hijas y seis nietas. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su negocio más grande y vender otras provisiones, y a nivel familiar darle lo mejor a sus nietas e hijas para que tengan un buen pasar por la vida y una buena educación para sus nietas en el futuro.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le abrió una puerta laboral y le permitirá invertir en su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía. Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
Forma forms part of the Communal Bank "Los Luceros" (The Shining Stats) belonging to the Padre Las Casas county in the Temuco commune. She has dedicated herself to selling fast food for the past five years. She performs her work Monday to Sunday from 11 AM to 12 AM at night. She has a lot of clients to whom she offers barbecued meat, full meals, french friends, ice cream, and drinks. Sometimes she works with the help of her daughter. She adapted a space in her house to sell the fast food.

The merchandise and ingredients she needs are used at various butcher shops, supermarkets, and at fairs where she finds potatoes at a low cost, which is economically convenient. With this loan she will buy potatoes and flour.

One of Norma's goals is to have the possibility of obtaining a larger location with more space to put her machines and better attend to her clients.

Norma lives together with her four daughters and six granddaughters. Her dreams in regard to her work are to have a bigger business and to sell other supplies. At a familial level, she wants to provide the best for her six granddaughters and her daughters so that they have a good experience in life and a good education for their future granddaughters.

She is so content and grateful for the opportunities which Fondo Esperanza has provided her that she has allowed them to invest in her company. Furthermore, she is grateful for her personal development there because she has learned to organized and distribute her income and investments better.

Padre Las Cases is a county in the south of Chile, near the city of Temuco, in the Araucanía region. Its name honors the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas, who defended indigenous people during the American conquest. It stands out for the large Mapuche population in the county. Its economy is based in the agricultural industry and in commercial services.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and flour.

loans.name: Guido Berto

texts.es: Guido de 42 años de edad es un hombre dedicado a su negocio de preparación y venta de jugo de frutas naturales, empanadas y otros productos fritos, además de hamburguesas y perros calientes, actividad que desarrolla con el fin de generar bienestar a su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y su    hija en las edad  de 2 años.  Su negocio inició desde hace 7 años, desde que llegó desplazado de otra ciudad y se dedicó a trabajar para otros, pero un día decidió empezar a vender jugos de naranja y le fue muy bien. Así fue a este producto,  le fue agregando variedades de comidas rápidas. En su negocio trabaja todos los días, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 12 del medio día, pero su capital de trabajo le resulta insuficiente para atender a su demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una carpa para protegerse del sol y de la lluvia y darle un toque de elegancia a su negocio, además de brindarle un ambiente mucho mas confortable a su clientela y tambien para comprar naranjas para hacer jugos. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local propio y darle  estudio de muy buena calidad a su  hija, para que en un futuro sea  muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Guido, 42, is a man who is dedicated to his business making and selling natural fruit juices, meat pies, and other fried products as well as hamburgers and hot dogs.  He does this work to generate well-being for his family, which includes his spouse and his 2-year-old daughter.

He started his business seven years ago, when he arrived here from another city and made a living working for other people.  One day he decided to sell orange juice, however, and it went very well for him.  So he started with that product and added different fast foods.  He works every day in his business from 5 in the morning until 12 noon, but his working capital is not enough to satisfy his demand.

This is why he's applying for a Kiva loan, his second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it he'll buy a tent to protect himself from the sun and the rain as well as to give his business a touch of elegance and a more comfortable atmosphere for his customers.  He's also going to buy oranges to make juice.

His long-term goals are to have his own place and to give his daughter a good-quality education so she'll be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy a tent and oranges

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos  sigue con el mismo oficio el de técnico electricista el aprendió el oficio de su padre al igual que sus dos hijos desarrolla la misma actividad  hace mas de treinta años, Carlos sigue trabajando con una empresa constructora en el centro de la ciudad, cuenta que le fue muy bien con elanterior credito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de material, en esta ocacion solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas y tambien para seguir comprando material eléctrico como ser cables de toda medida y enchufes, ya que esto le sera de gran utilidad en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos continues with the same job as an electrician, a trade he learned from his father and has done for more than 30 years.  His two sons also carry out the same work.  Carlos continues working for a construction company in the center of town.  He says it went very well for him with the previous loan because he used it to buy supplies.

This time he's requesting the loan to buy tools and to continue buying electrical supplies such as cables of all sizes and sockets.  These will be very useful to him in his work.

loans.use: to buy tools and electrical supplies

loans.name: Shirley Margoth

texts.es:
Shirley Margoth tiene 31 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Shirley Margoth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Las compras lo hace en la ciudad de ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, urea, fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría a mejorar los sembrríos. El sueño es arreglar la casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas el cogollero y la lancha.

En el tiempo libre le gusta bailar y limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Shirley Margoth is 31 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Luchando por Una Misma Causa” (Fighting for a Same Cause) are from the neighborhood of La Primavera in the canton of Ventanas. All of the members of this Communal Bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Shirley Margoth is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. Her purchases are made in the city of Ventanas. She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, supplies, urea, and fertilizers for her crops. With the support of this loan, she will be able to improve her plantings. Shirley’s dream is to repair her house. The challenges she faces include pests, such as army worms and fungi.

In her free time, Shirley likes to dance and clean her house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farming supplies, urea, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is aged 46. She is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and four children who are all schooling. She has been in farming for the past seven years, producing milk and poultry products, which she sells at the local market in her area. She runs a retail shop as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a 52,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow, which will bring her more income from selling the milk that will help her in uplifting her livelihood and paying for her children's school fees.

The high costs of feeds and inadequate capital are her major challenges in farming.

Beatrice is very grateful to Juhudi kilimo for the support.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is 44 years old. She lives in Borjomi District with her mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Irina requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of low income and her family's poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is Irina's monthly income. She works as a shop assistant. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo's estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor income category. 

Irina requested a loan from Credo to restart a family business, which had recently been stopped because of financial problems. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages a provision for business start-ups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Irina will purchase the shop where she works as an assistant. The current owner decided to sell the shop and move to a new residence. After Irina officially registers the shop, she will continue working there. Owning the shop will increase the income of Irina's family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of Irina's family.

loans.use: to buy a shop.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 26 years old. She earns her income through farming. She grows coffee, bananas and sweet potatoes. She keeps cows, goats and pigs. She also has a small commodities shop.

Deborah looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

Deborah's biggest dream is to create a school for orphans in her village.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Kemah

texts.en:
Kemah lives in New Kru Town. She is 33 years old, married and has two children aged 13 and 18 that are in school and live at home. She is a high school graduate, and for the past nine years she has been running a shop where she sells wood for building. She started this business with a little income from her savings account and learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She says that she enjoys her business because it has made her proud, and she really enjoys the interaction with her customers. A problem that she is  facing is that the cost of transporting the wood to her shop is very high. 

Kemah is requesting a loan to purchase more wood for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa earns a living by selling bargain or garage sale items to the people in her place in Duero, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 12 years now.

Rosa is asking for a loan to buy more bargain clothes for stock to sell.

In the future, Rosa has hopes of expanding her business and saving money for the reinvestment in the same business. Moreover, she wants to save money so that she can support her husband in supporting their children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more bargain clothes to sell.

loans.name: Wilhelmin

texts.en:
Wilhelmin is 45 years old and married with three children.

Wilhelmin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Wilhelmin has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Wilhelmin aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 39-year-old businessman. He is married to Magdalene, a business lady. They are blessed with three children. He has been running a retail shop for the past 10 years with the monthly income of KES (Kenyan shillings) 10,000, which he uses to support his family.  

He is applying for his third loan term from KADET LTD. after repaying the previous loans successfully. Francis will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil for sale.  

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 21 años, es soltero y apostó por ayudar a su familia desde temprana edad, en la situación difícil que se hallaban, por lo que solo terminó sus estudios de la escuela primaria, por lo cual muchos de sus sueños se vieron frustrados como por ejemplo el de ser un futbolista profesional. Sin embargo Luis estima que la recompensa de ver a su familia con una vida estable ha compensado el vacío de esos sueños no cumplidos. Luis vive con su madre Cruz de 59 años quien se dedica a quehaceres domésticos en su hogar y también con su hermana Susana que es costurera y tiene dos hijos; Dayana y Jhon que se encuentran estudiando. Juntos viven en Quito en el sur de la ciudad.  Hasta hace pocos el sector sur de la ciudad de Quito, no era tomado en cuenta dentro de los sectores económicos fuertes de la capital de la República del Ecuador, ahora este sector es considerado una fuerza de la economía de la ciudad. En este lugar se encuentran familias emprendedoras que han luchado para sobresalir. Entre nativos y migrantes de otras ciudades y países, ha sido el punto de encuentro de habitantes de varias provincias, y está reconstruido con extensas calles. Chillogallo, en donde reside Luis, es un sector con una alta actividad comercial que es cada vez más fortalecida y que aporta en gran manera al crecimiento económico de la ciudad. Se destaca en esta zona los parques con amplias zonas verdes en los cuales se dan cita las familias los fines de semana. Hay gran accesibilidad a todo tipo de servicios y sus habitantes son emprendedores que aprovechan cada oportunidad que se presenta con establecimiento de nuevos negocios.
Luis hace 2 años  con la experiencia y consejo de su tía, decidió establecer un negocio de comercio de frutas, verduras y legumbres a brigadas militares quienes compran al por mayor para abastecer en los cuarteles de formación militar de la ciudad. Dedica 7 horas a esta actividad y recibe ayuda de su prima que también tiene experiencia en esta actividad. Ahora Luis desea comprar más surtido de sus productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y así hacer que sus ventas se incrementen y poder retomar sus estudios y con la experiencia que tiene un día llegar a constituir una empresa y además también tener la oportunidad de un día demostrar su capacidad como jugador de fútbol. Para este fin, Luis ha solicitado un préstamo en Fundación Alternativa para comprar nuevos productos. El considera que es una nueva oportunidad para salir adelante y además piensa aprovechar al máximo este crédito y la asesoría que le brindan allí como herramientas para una buena administración de su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis, 21, is single and pledged to help his family from a very young age because of the difficult situation in which they found themselves.  This is why he only finished elementary school.  As a result, many of his dreams were frustrated, such as being a professional soccer player.  Nevertheless, Luis values that seeing his family with a stable life has repaid the emptiness of his unrealized dreams.

Luis lives with his mother, Cruz, 59, who devotes herself to the household, and with his sister Susana, who's a seamstress and has two children, Dayana and Jhon, who are students.  Together they live in Quito in the southern part of the city.  Until a few years ago the southern sector of the city of Quito was not considered one of the stronger economic sectors of the capital of the Republic of Ecuador.  Now this area is considered a force in the city's economy.  Here there are enterprising families who have struggled to get ahead.

Between the natives and migrants from other cities and countries, it has been a point of encounter of residents of several provinces and is built with wide streets.  Cillogallo, where Luis lives, is an area of high commercial activity that is strengthened more all the time and contributes to the city's economic growth.  This area stands out for its parks with expansive green areas where families go on the weekend.  There's access to all types of services, and the residents are enterprising people who make the most of every opportunity to set up new businesses.

Two years ago, with his experience and the advice of his aunt, Luis decided to set up a business selling fruits, vegetables, and legumes to military troops who buy in bulk to stock the military barracks in the city.  He devotes seven hours to this job and has the help of his cousin, who also has experience in this work.

Now Luis wants to buy more assorted products to satisfy customer demand and increase his sales, so he can take up his studies again.  With his experience, he hopes to one day set up a company and also to have the opportunity to demonstrate his abilities as a soccer player.

To this end Luis has requested a loan from Fundación Alternativa to buy new products.  He sees it as a new opportunity to get ahead.  He also plans to make the most of this loan and the advice they give him as tools for managing his business well.

loans.use: to buy assorted fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María, solicita un préstamo porque necesita dinero para invertir en este periodo de temporada de mayor demanda, comprando productos de belleza como tintes, cremas, shampoo, tratamientos de belleza.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio, ya que tuvo más disponibilidad en los productos que ofrece y su condición en la familia se mantiene.
texts.en:
María is requesting a loan because she needs money to invest for this period of high demand. She will buy products such as dyes, crèmes, shampoo, and beauty treatments.

María says that her previous loan helped to strengthen her business. She had more available products to offer and was able to maintain her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy dyes, crèmes, shampoo, and beauty treatments.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 34 years old, married and blessed with three children that she supports. She has been a wheat farmer in Narok for the past five years. Her monthly income is KES (Kenyan shillings) 35,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase farm inputs and to prepare the land for planting.

She intends to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business. Her future dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Freeman

texts.en:
Freeman is 43 years old and lives in the New Kru area. He and his wife live together, and they have five children, ages 4, 12, 14, 15 and 17, that are all in school.

For five years now, Freeman has been running a medicine store and is providing services to his community. He started this business with a little money from his friends that he used to establish a business selling drugs on a table.

He’s requesting a loan to purchase more drugs (paracetamol, folic acid, blood tonic, cough syrup, etc.). He plans to improve his drugstore to a clinic in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs (paracetamol, folic acid, blood tonic, cough syrup, etc.).

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a 28-year-old gentleman who supports his two siblings. He has been a tomato farmer in Narok for the last three years, getting a monthly income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD., and he intends to buy farm inputs for better yields.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His future dream is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 46 years old and is married with five children. Seraphine sells second-hand clothing for babies. Her business is well-known and well-organized. She has eight years of experience in this business. 

Seraphine has requested her second loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more second-hand clothing for babies, which she will sell. With any profit, Seraphine will be able to save for her future and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothing for babies.

loans.name: Akhmed

texts.en:
Akhmed is 48 years old. He lives in the small village of Marneuli district with his wife. Akhmed is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns a greenhouse, where he sows cucumbers and tomatoes. The harvested products are sold locally in an open market at a good price. 

Akhmed is a very hardworking man and has a rich experience in his business. Akhmed requested a loan for purchasing wood for the greenhouse. Aftter purchasing the wood, the greenhouse will be heated properly. Akhmed will be able to produce more vegetables and thus increase the sale of them. It will increase the income of the family, and they will improve their living conditions. Akhmed awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase wood for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Tuesday

texts.en: Tuesday, 32, stopped his education in the 9th grade, got married, and now lives in New Kru town with his four children, aged 2 to 13. Three  of them  attend school. Tuesday has a shop that he has been operating  for the past four  years, where he sells  alcoholic drinks like beer, stout, & gin, as well as milk, tissue, batteries,  and many other items.  He first got into business by selling  mineral water, and started with 35,000 Liberian Dollars. He likes this business because it keeps him busy, and his daily sales have increased. He has requested a loan to purchase more alcoholic drinks, batteries, and tissue for the shop. His future plan is to expand his business. With the profits generated, he will buy more goods to improve the business and repay his loan.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks, batteries, and tissue for his shop.

loans.name: Annie

texts.es:
Annie, de 39 años, es una mujer muy valiente y luchadora, es madre de dos hijos de 18 y 9 años quienes son fruto de su convivencia con su pareja, ella tiene una casa propia en donde comparte todos los días el gusto de criar a sus hijos y trabajar mucho para brindarles lo mejor, además de ellos también vive ahí un joven que les ayuda en el trabajo que realizan a diario. El negocio de Annie consiste principalmente en la venta de prendas de vestir de todas las marcas, modelos, tamaños y colores. Tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas en el que atiende un joven que ella ha contratado. Renueva su mercadería de manera quincenal o mensual comprando al por mayor en otra ciudad, su punto de ventas está ubicado en una avenida muy concurrida de la ciudad. Desde que se inició en éste negocio ha trabajado con la ayuda de otra persona, empezó hace 2 años y ha visto que es una actividad muy rentable porque le genera buenos ingresos que le ayudan a solventar los gastos de su familia. Paralelamente tiene un tópico de atención sanitaria que ha establecido hace 4 años y en el que atiende poniendo en práctica los conocimientos que ha adquirido en sus estudios de enfermería. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a su familia en el momento que sea necesario, además todas sus ventas son al contado y eso no le genera problemas. Espera seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora y poco a poco implementar su local de ventas de ropa y además adquirir nuevos accesorios para su tópico. Este es el préstamo número 4 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado 3500 soles, comprará una gran lote de mercadería conformada por polos, pantalones y blusas, además comprará una par de vitrinas de exhibición para mostrar mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Annie, 39, is very brave, hardworking woman who is the mother of two children who are 18 and 9 years old and the result of her relationship with her spouse.  She owns a house where she shares the joy every day of raising her children and working hard to give them the best.  In addition to them, a young man who helps with the daily work lives there with them too.  Annie’s business consists primarily in selling clothes of all brands, style, sizes and colors.  She has a small sales stand that the young man she hired works at.  She renews her merchandise bi-weekly or monthly buying it at wholesale in a different city.  Her sales point is located in a very busy avenue in the city.  Since starting the business she’s always worked with help from another person.  She started two years ago and has seen that it’s a very profitable activity because it generates good income that helps her cover family expenses.

In addition, she also has a first-aid station that she opened four years ago putting into practice the skills she’s acquired in her nursing courses.  What she likes about her activity is that it lets her tend to her family whenever necessary; in addition, all her sales are cash which means no problems are generated.  She hopes to continue working like she’s done to date and gradually furnish her clothing sales locale and acquire new furnishing for her first-aid station.

This is MFP loan #4 and she’s very grateful for the credit opportunity she’s being granted and for the financial back-up she needs to continue forward.  She commits to make her monthly payments punctually and to continue working with much responsibility along with her fellow communal bank members.  She will use the requested 3,500 soles to buy a lot of merchandise consisting of shirts, pants and blouses and she will also buy a pair of display cases to better show her wares.

loans.use: to buy clothes and a pair of display cases.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eder

texts.es: Eder reparó su carro de perros calientes, compró un horno,  harina salsas y carnes en mayor volumen y se siente muy satisfecho. Su credikiva lo benefició porque ahora sus herramientas están en mejores condiciones y su capital de trabajo aumentó, su negocio ha progresado porque ahora participa en eventos de mayor envergadura y sus productos rotan más prontamente. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: Me siento muy feliz, les deseo que siempre tengan la puertas abiertas, para que personas como yo, crezcamos mas espiritualmente y económicamente. La nueva inversión ala que ahora está aplicando con credikiva,  será para comprar insumos, como harina, queso, jamón, salsas, carne y champiñones, pues se acerca la época navideña y los clientes tienen más dinero para comprar, de esta manera sus ventas se incrementan y debe tener suficiente capital de trabajo para invertir, porque justamente en esto radica el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Eder repaired his hot-dog cart, bought an oven, flour, sauces and meats in larger amounts and feels very satisfied.  His Kiva loan was of use because now his tools are in better condition and his working capital increased; his business has progressed because he now participates in greater events and his products rotate more quickly.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following:  I feel very happy.  I hope you will always keep the door open so that people like me can grow spiritually and economically.  

He will use the new Kiva loan he’s requesting to buy ingredients like flour, cheese, ham, sauces, meat and mushrooms because the Christmas season is approaching and customers have more money to spend and his sales will grow so he must have enough working capital to invest because this is precisely what his Kiva loan’s success depends on.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, cheese, ham, sauces, meat and mushrooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Senia Mercedes

texts.es:
Senia tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de San Nicolás, Santa Bárbara junto a su madre e hijos.
Ella tiene 16 años de experiencia en la elaboración de variedad de pan casero, como ser: quesadillas, rosquillas, galletas, tortas, etc. la producción que saca la vende en su comunidad a pulperías y personas particulares. Este negocio ha sido su fuente de ingresos para la manutención familiar, el cual lo ha mantenido activo mediante varios prestamos, ha sido cliente por 14 ciclos con el actual. Este préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la materia prima como harina, azúcar, huevos, manteca, margarina, leche, levadura y otros insumos que necesita para la elaboración de pan. Con los préstamos ella ha mantenido el nivel de ventas y la producción, así mismo a su clientela. Su meta es seguir trabajando en su negocio para obtener ingresos y darles la educación necesaria a sus hijos.
texts.en: Senia, 39, is a single mother; she has six children and lives in a village in the municipality of San Nicolás, Santa Bárbara with her mother and children.   She has 16 years’ experience making home-made bread: cheese pound cake, doughnuts, cookies, cakes, etc.  What she makes she sells in her community to grocery stores and to individuals.  This business has been her source of income for family support and she’s kept it going by means of several loans.  She’s been a client for 14 cycles including the present one.  This loan request is for 10,000 Lempiras that she will use to buy raw materials like flour, sugar, eggs, shortening, margarine, milk, yeast and other ingredients needed to make bread.  She’s used the loans to maintain her sales and production levels as well as to retain her customers.  Her goal is to continue working in her business to earn income and to provide her children with the necessary schooling.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, shortening, cheese, sugar, margarine, milk, yeast and other ingredients.

loans.name: Santos Eduardo

texts.es:
Santos, es ganadero, tiene casa propia en la que vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, él se dedica a la compra y venta de ganadería, desde hace 3 años esta realizando el negocio.
Santos, se decidió por un  préstamo, para invertir en la siembra de granos básicos y ganado para comercializar, adquiriendo 5 sacos de abono y tambien ganado de repasto, este  préstamo le permitirá a Santos realizar su labor agrícola y ganadera. 
La aspiración de él  es que a través de los préstamos pueda mejorar las condiciones económicas de la familia, asegurándoles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Santos is a rancher. He owns his home and lives with his wife and three children. Santos buys and sells cattle and has been in business for three years. He decided to request a loan so that he can invest in the planting of basic grains and cattle that he can sell. Santos will acquire five sacks of compost and also cattle for grazing. This loan will allow Santos to continue his work as a farmer and rancher.

His aspiration with these loans is to improve his family’s financial condition, thereby securing a better future for them.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of compost and cattle for grazing.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras que lleva el nombre de Las Luchadoras  tuvo sus  inicios en agosto del 2011  hoy cuenta con 12 integrantes se encuentran en el 5to. ciclo del programa. En este comité hay mucha solidaridad, ayuda mutua,  y por sobre todo la responsabilidad.
Una de las historias que se destaca es el de la señora  Felicita, madre soltera de 2 hijos mayores, tejedora desde hace más de 40 años, actualmente vive sola y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de formar parte del grupo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de hilos, bastidores, y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
This group of enterprising women is named “Las Luchadoras” (The Fighters). The group started in August 2011 and now has 12 members who are in their fifth loan cycle. This committee demonstrates great solidarity, a spirit of responsibility, and most of all, responsibility.

One story that stands out is that of Sra. Felicita. She is a single mother of two grown children. Felicita has been knitting for more than 40 years. She currently lives alone, so she is grateful for the opportunity she has received as part of this group.

Felicita is requesting a loan in order to buy thread, embroidery frames, and other supplies so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy thread, embroidery frames, and other supplies.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a 26-year-old farmer in Kitale county in Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past two years, producing milk, horticultural crops and poultry products which he sells at the local market. He runs a butchery as an additional source of income. Diseases, unpredictable weather conditions and high cost of production are his major challenges in farming. Fredrick is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry, from which he will earn extra income by reselling the birds. This will raise his living standards and help him save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Ismari De Jesus

texts.es: Ismari de 48 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir para caballeros Especialmente. Ella inició con su esposo, fabricando uniformes desde hace 17 años y poco a poco después de su separación, se enfocó en la ropa masculina, siendo sus principales productos las camisas, los pantalones y los suéteres; así su negocio fue creciendo en maquinarias e infraestructura, que le  permitieron darle un mejor acabado a la prenda y como su clientela empezó a incrementarse, la llevó a ubicar  un almacén para comercializar sus propios diseños. Hoy quiere seguir creciendo, pues tiene mucha clientela que le vende a crédito y de contado y ella trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde, con el fin de responderles oportunamente y generar mayor bienestar cada día que pasa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará telas, hilos, correderas y botones en mayor volumen, para responder a la demanda del fin de año, que es todas las veces superior a la de las otras épocas del año, por eso   debe estar preparada para ello y así es como su credikiva tendrá mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Ismari, 48, works making clothes especially for men.  She started out with her husband manufacturing uniforms 17 years ago and gradually after her separation focused on making men’s clothes.  Her main products are shirts, pants and sweaters.  Her business grew both in machinery and infrastructure that led to her being able to make still finer clothes and because her clientele started to grow, she opened a store to sell her own designs.  Today, she continues to grow because she has a large clientele she sells to on credit and for cash.  She works from 8am until 6pm aiming at filling their orders promptly and generate greater wellbeing with every day that goes by.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her second financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy fabric, thread, zippers and buttons in larger amounts to meet end-of-year demand which is always greater than in other times of the year and she must be prepared for it; this is why her Kiva loan will be very successful.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers and buttons in larger amounts.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña María tiene 44 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. ella anteriormente se dedicaba a realizar trabajo de jornal en corte de café, pero hace un año que se ha dedicado solamente a elaborar y vender ricos tamales hechos de masa de maíz rellenos de carne, arroz, papas, aceitunas, chicharos otras legumbres, envueltos en hojas de banano. Es un tamal que tiene mucha demanda, en el sector donde vive ya tiene su clientela. doña María se ha decidido por este préstamo para tener lo necesario para trabajar, el cual es por 7,000 Lempiras y va comprar los materiales e insumos para la elaboración de tamales como harina de maíz, leña, hojas de banano, carne, condimentos, arroz, legumbres etc. En un futuro a ella le gustaría tener una pulpería para generar otros ingresos.
texts.en:
María, 44, is married and has three children.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  She used to work as a field hand picking coffee but a year ago decided to just work making and selling delicious tamales made of corn dough filled with meat, rice, potatoes, olives, peas and other vegetables wrapped in banana leaves.  This is a highly sought-after tamale in the sector where she lives and she has an established clientele.  

María has decided on a loan in order to have what she needs to work on hand.  It’s for 7,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy supplies and ingredients like corn flour, firewood, banana leaves, meat, condiments, rice, vegetables, etc. to make tamales.  In future, she’d like to have a grocery store to generate other income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and firewood to make tamales.

loans.name: Ines Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Inés  sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de cosméticos y  productos de belleza ella entrega a distintos lugares oficinas y domicilios donde le hacen pedidos,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior credito que lo utilizo en la compra de camisas y chompas y en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de perfumes y cosméticos, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo y asi de esta manera mejorra la calidad d evida de su familia.
texts.en: Inés continues with the same activity selling cosmetics and beauty products at various places like offices and homes where orders are placed.  This loan is her third sequence in the institution and she relates that she did very well with the previous loan that she used to buy shirts and sweaters.  On this occasion, she requests the loan to buy perfume and cosmetics the reason being to increase working capital to be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics at wholesale.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité La Esperanza se formó con la unión de 16 señoras, vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, donde todas las miembros están luchando por salir adelante e ir creciendo en las actividades que haces, para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es Dalia, ella vende carbón desde hace un tiempo, y se ha hecho ya de muy buena clientela. Ella al igual que sus compañeras desea poder ayudar a su familia, y es por ellos que luchan. Todas son muy sacrificadas y se esfuerzan al máximo.
Solicita Dalia de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón, para poder tener una buena cantidad y así seguir vendiendo y cumpliendo con los pedidos que siempre tiene.
texts.en:
The committee named “La Esperanza” (The Hope) is a group of 16 women, all of whom are neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All of the members strive to move forward and grow in their business activities so that they can help their families.

One of the members is Dalia, who has been selling charcoal for some time. She has already built up a good clientele. Just like her fellow group members, Dalia wants to help her family and fights on their behalf. All of the members have made many sacrifices and strive to do their best.

Dalia is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of charcoal. This will enable her to have a large quantity so that she can continue selling and fulfilling her existing orders.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past two years, Scovia has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Scovia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Scovia hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children up to university and also buy a plot of land. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Shamima

texts.en:
Shamima is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past two years, Shamima has been working hard to manage her production business, which sells dry food. 

To help expand her business, Shamima has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dry food such as beans and maize flour to sell, and will help Shamima to generate greater profits and buy food for her family and other basic needs. Shamima hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a big retail shop. 

Shamima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more dry food such as beans and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 35 years old and a mother with four children. She lives in Mpeketoni, Lamu. For the past seven years, Millicent has earned a living by selling fish and she earns 6,000 KES each month. She was introduced to KADET LTD by an organization credit officer.

Millicent is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy additional fish stock to sell to her customers. She will use the profits from her loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her business. In the future, Millicent hopes to continue her business and possibly own a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: to buy additional fish stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Manantial - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento MANANTIAL – 26 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes cinco mujeres y tres varones, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Celestina tiene 56 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 21 y 28 años,  La Sra. Celestina,  se dedica a la venta de variedad de dulces y golosinas en la feria de su zona,  este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Celestina va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de dulces para surtir su negocio como un mostrador para la exhibición de sus productos y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Celestina va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Celestina  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
MANANTIAL - 26 group has eight members - five are women and three are men. The group president is Celestina who is 56 years old and has two children who are 21 and 28. Celestina sells candy at the local fair. This loan will be the fifth that she has received from the institution. 

Celestina will use this loan to buy a variety of candies to stock up her business, as well as a counter to display her products. In this way she will be able to offer her customers more variety. 

She is requesting this loan to continue improving her business, and Celestina is going to use the profits she makes to buy more products and therefore increase her income. She would like to have her own store and be able to offer better customer service. 

Celestina is a very hard-working person, and she feels happy about the opportunity that her and the members of the group are being given because many of them support their families on their own.

loans.use: to buy candies at wholesale and a display counter to exhibit her products.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 28 años, es una mujer joven, amable y carismática, es soltera y madre de dos hijos de 4 años y 1 año de edad respectivamente, vive en la casa de sus padres a lado de sus menores hijos y su pareja, ella como toda madre quiere lo mejor para sus hijos es por eso que diariamente se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante.
El trabajo principal de Carmen consiste en la venta de diversos productos regionales. Dependiendo de la temporada ofrece a la venta, plátano, yuca, limones, cocona y otros alimentos de origen animales como pescado seco y carnes de animales silvestres como venado, tortugas, majas y gallinas de chacra. Tiene un puesto de ventas ubicado en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad y en el trabaja por las mañanas, mientras que por las tardes o en días lluviosos trabaja en su casa en donde tiene instalado una andamio de exhibición de productos. Realiza ésta actividad hace 15 años, lo hace con mayor énfasis cuando en la ciudad se celebra alguna festividad o acontecimiento importante; afortunadamente su trabajo le genera buenos ingresos económicos que le dan tranquilidad emocional. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener contacto con las personas, le da vitalidad y mucha energía estar en constante actividad física y sobre todo se siente feliz porque puede generar sus propios ingresos económicos para continuar solventado sus gastos. Este es el crédito numero 3 con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera continuar trabajando con su banco comunal por el compañerismo y la solidaridad que muestran entre ellos cada uno de sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de plátano, yuca y otros productos regionales para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Carmen, 28, is a young, kind, charismatic, single woman and mother of two children who are 1 and 4 years old respectively.  She lives in her parents’ house with her minor children and her spouse.  Like all mothers, she wants the best for her children which is why she strives daily to get ahead.  Carmen’s main work is selling various regional products.  

Depending on the season, she sells bananas, manioc, lemons, ‘cocona’ [a tropical fruit] and other foods of animal origin like dried fish and wild animal meats like deer, turtle, crab and field chickens.  She has a stand at a very busy market in the city and she works there mornings.  In the afternoon and on rainy days she works at home where she has shelving installed to display her products.  She’s been doing this work for 15 years and she does it with even more emphasis on days when the city is celebrating some festivity or important event.  Fortunately, her work generates good income and gives her peace of mind.  What she likes about her work is that she can have contact with people; it gives her energy and vitality to be in constant physical activity and above all she feels happy because she can generate her own income to continue meeting her expenses.

This is MFP loan #3 and she’s grateful to the people who are providing the financing she needs in order to make her plans reality.  On the other hand, she commits to make her payments punctually and hopes to continue working with her communal bank because of the fellowship and mutual support each and every one of the members has.  She will use the requested 1,200 soles to buy larger amounts of bananas, manioc and other regional products to continue working.

loans.use: to buy bananas, manioc and other regional products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
Harriet is 20 years old and is single with one child. She lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells tomatoes, fresh fruit, and cooked food. She is a member of a loan group comprised of four hardworking women.

Harriet is requesting a 500,000 UGX to stock more fresh food and cooking ingredients. She will use the profits from her loan to generate greater profits and pay her medical bills. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business and have a hotel. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and is a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more fresh food and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 64 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last twelve years, she has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly profit of KES 17,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and is applying for her fourth loan of KES. 40,000 to buy seeds, some fertilizer and other farm inputs needed for her business. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her farming activities. 

Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds, some fertilizer and other farm inputs needed for her business.

loans.name: Janety

texts.en:
Janety is 53 years old and is married with four children. One of her children is still in school. For the past 19 years, Janety has been a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya. She produces maize, beans, milk, and horticultural crops that she sells at her local market. Janety is also employed and earns a salary. Her major business challenges include fluctuating prices and unreliable rains.

Janety is requesting a 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She will sell the milk to get extra income which will help her improve her family's living standards and provide financial stability.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lucy's Group

texts.en:
Lucy's group is composed of three hardworking women. Lucy is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Lucy has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Lucy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cartons of clothes for resale, and will help Lucy to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Lucy hopes that in the future she will be able to build a big commercial house of her own. 

Lucy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: Isabel de 58 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de masa, agua de maíz o chicha y a la preparación de bollos o amasijos de maíz envueltos en hijas de la misma planta y amarrados con pitas. Ella vive en el municipio de Soledad, con su cónyuge  y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 28 a 31 años.
