Isabel desde hace 4 años inició su negocio, aprovechando que su vecino que había tenido esa misma actividad, se mudó y dejó la clientela sin respuesta a su necesidad de consumo; así fue como aprovechando esta coyuntura,   decidió dedicarse a esta actividad, con la que le fue muy bien y en la que ha logrado su crecimiento.  Sus principales clientes son las tiendas del barrio y de otros sectores, así como las amas de casa y vecinas, que conocen la calidad con la cual trabaja los productos derivados del delicioso maíz natural. Sus ventas las realiza al por mayor y de contado y al detal;  Isabel sueña con expandirse y se prepara día a día para poder lograrlo, pero su capital de trabajo, ante este sueño de prosperidad le resulta insuficiente, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará maíz y pitas en mayor volumen. Con su credikiva iniciará el camino para experimentar en otros mercados y aumentar sus posibilidades productivas, con las que piensa salir adelante al lado de su familia.
texts.en: Isabel, 58, works making dough, corn water or ‘chicha’ and making bread rolls or dough items from corn and wrapped in corn leaves tied with twine.  She lives in the municipality of Soledad with her spouse and has three children whose ages range between 28 and 31.  Isabel started her business four years ago taking advantage of the fact that her neighbor was in the same kind of business and moved away leaving his customer base's needs unmet. She took advantage of this juncture and decided to go into this activity and has done very well with it and has managed to grow.  Her main customers are stores in her neighborhood and in other sectors as well as housewives and neighbors who are aware of the quality way she works with products derived from delicious, natural corn.  She sells at wholesale and retail.  Isabel dreams with expanding and is preparing day to day to accomplish it but her working capital is insufficient to reach this dream of prosperity which is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy corn and twine in larger amounts.  With her Kiva loan she will start off on the road to try new markets and increase productive possibilities that she hopes will lead to her moving forward with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and twine in larger volume.

loans.name: Fabian Enrique

texts.es: Fabian se dedica a la venta de frutas  desde hace 9 años, negocio con el cual genera el sustento para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, conformado por su esposa y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 3 a 7 años. Su emprendimiento nace por tradición familiar, pues esta actividad la había estado observando desde la edad de 9 años, cuando ayudaba a su familia en la venta de frutas. Por eso al terminar su estudio de bachiller, se dedicó a ello con el apoyo de su padre, quien le prestó el primer capital, con el cual  empezó a generar ingresos.  En su negocio vende bananos, mandarinas, pomelos, manzanas, peras y en general las frutas que están en cosecha. El vende a crédito y de contado de lunes a sábados, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde porque tiene clientes fijos.  Ellos son empleados de empresas cercanas a su negocio y propietarios de almacenes, pues su punto de ventas está ubicado en un corredor comercial, donde hay muchos comerciantes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante le cual comprará en mayor volumen, uvas, principalmente pues se acerca el fin de año y las tradiciones indican que ellas generan prosperidad a las familias para el siguiente años,  si en la mesa en la noche buena no faltan. Esta es la razón por la cual su credikiva lo dirige a esta inversión, potencializando así su éxito,  especialmente al comprar de contado y en cantidades mayores, a las que usualmente lo hace, porque   ya tiene asegurada la venta con sus clientes que ya esperan sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Fabian has been selling fruit for nine years, a business with which he earns support to meet household needs.  His household consists of his wife and three children aged between 3 and 7 years.  His business arose from family tradition since he’s watched this activity since he was nine-years-old helping his family sell fruit.  This is why when he completed high-school he went into it with his father’s support who lent him his initial capital to start earning income.  He sells bananas, mandarins, grapefruit, apples, pears and in general seasonal fruit.  He sells on credit and for cash from Monday through Saturday from 9 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon because he has regular customers.  They are employees in nearby firms and store owners since his sales point is located in a commercial corridor where there are many merchants.

He’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo by means of which he will buy in large volumes mainly grapes because the end of the year is approaching and tradition holds that they generate family prosperity for the following year so they must not be absent from the New Year’s Eve table.  This is why he’s earmarking his Kiva loan for this purpose thus insuring success, especially by paying cash and buying larger amounts than usual since his sales are guaranteed because his customers are waiting for their orders.

loans.use: to buy grapes.

loans.name: Mitra

texts.en:
Mitra is married and lives in a minority community in the southern-part of Kosovo. She has four children between the ages of two and eleven years old. Currently two of them go to school. 

Mitra owns agricultural land. She works in an agricultural business based on family tradition. Mitra is a hardworking woman and she works a lot to earn a living. She has always worked by planting and growing wheat and corn which she sells. This business is the main source of income for her famlily. 

Mitra is in need of loan to pay for new tractor. The loan will help her in continuing to be able to work the land and to reduce costs. Mitra hopes in the future to secure a better education for her children. She is very thankful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to pay for a new tractor.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 40 years old and married with four children. For the past 20 years, she has earned a living selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. Ruth earns a monthly profit 8,000 KES. She was introduced to KADET LTD by an organization credit officer.

Ruth is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and farm inputs. This will be her fourth loan. Ruth will use the profits from her loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as to expand her farming activities. Her future goal is to expand into mixed farming to increase her income and help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jessi

texts.es:
Jessi, de 33 años, es una mujer amable y buena, convive desde hace algunos años con Marcial y junto a él tiene 3 hijos de 15, 8 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, ellos son su motor y motivo para superarse día a día, tiene su casa propia sin embargo por ciertos motivos ahora vive temporalmente en la casa de su suegra. Trabajan arduamente para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia. 
El trabajo de Jessi consiste en la venta de productos regionales, entre los productos que vende encontramos: plátano, yuca, cocona, hojas de “bijao”, limones y otros. Cada producto lo vende en mayor cantidad dependiendo de su temporada de producción ya que alguno de ellos puede escasear en ciertos meses o en caso contrario pueden abundar. Tiene un puesto de ventas en uno de los principales mercados de la ciudad y debido a esa concurrencia de la población logra vender mucho durante el día. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad desde hace 4 años y desde que empezó lo ha hecho sola. 
Le gusta mucho su forma de trabajo ya que se siente libre e independiente, además gana muy bien y eso le permite estar mas tranquila aun, su meta principal es expandir su negocio y empezar a vender sus productos al por mayor enviando a otras ciudades ya que afirma que de esa forma sus ingresos económicos aumentarán considerablemente. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a continuar pagando puntualmente sus cuotas tal como le programen, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de plátano y yuca, ya que en esta temporada hay gran demanda de ambos productos.
texts.en:
Jessi is 33 years old, and is a good kind woman who has lived with Marcial for several years. They have three children who are 15, 8, and 2 years old. Her family is what motivates her to better herself every day. She has her own house, but at the moment she is living temporarily with her mother-in-law. She works hard to obtain a better quality of life for all her family.

Jessi works selling regional products including bananas, cassavas, coconas, bijao leaves, and limes. How much she sells of each product depends on what is in season, as some of the products are more difficult to get in certain months and, on the other hand, sometimes she has an abundance of a particular product. She has a stall in one of the main markets in the city, and because so many people pass by, she sells a lot during the day. She has been doing this work for four years, and she has always done it on her own.

She really likes her work because she feels free and independent, and she also makes good money which makes her feel at ease. Her main goal is to expand her business and start to sell her products at wholesale by sending them to other cities. She is sure that this will increase her income considerably. This is her third loan with MFP and she is very happy with the financial support she is receiving because it makes her confident that her business is going to grow. She pledges to continue making her repayments on time and as agreed. She is delighted to be a member of her communal bank because everyone is responsible and supportive.

With the requested amount of 1500 soles, she will buy a larger quantity of bananas and cassavas, because there is a high demand for these products at this time of year.

loans.use: to buy bananas and cassavas to sell at the market.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lais

texts.es:
Lais, de 21 años, es una joven emprendedora, buena, amable y muy responsable, aun es soltera pero tiene un hijo de tan solo 7 meses de nacido, vive en casa de su madre, ella es un apoyo muy importante en su familia ya que siempre está en constante aporte a la solvencia de su hogar y esto permite que tengan mejores ingresos económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Nuestra amiga Lais se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada. Ofrece a la diversos productos como prendas de vestir, zapatos,  accesorios femeninos y otros. Ella misma se encarga de vender sus artículos a sus vecinos, familiares y amigos, ya sea en su casa o visitando a sus clientes. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad ya por 3 años y lo hace sola. Al principio Lais tuvo muchos obstáculos como el factor económico y la falta de ayuda de otra persona para movilizar su mercadería de un lugar a otro, pero poco a poco fue encontrando la manera correcta de desarrollar su labor y ahora trabaja cómodamente. Como toda joven tiene muchas metas y objetivos, es por eso que quiere conseguir un puesto de ventas en donde ofrezca mayor variedad de prendas de vestir en esta temporada navideña. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito financiero que le brinda la seguridad para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará mercaderías conformada por prendas de vestir y zapatos para continuar vendiendo entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lais, twenty-one, is a good, enterprising, friendly, and very responsible young woman.  Although she's single, she has a child who is just seven-months-old.  She lives in her mother's house and is a significant source of support to the family, providing continual contribution to the solvency of the home so they can have a higher income and better quality of life. 

Our friend Lais earns her living selling a variety of merchandise.  She offers a range of products like clothing, shoes, women's accessories, etc.  She sells the merchandise herself, to neighbors, friends, and family either from home or by visiting clients.  She's been in the business, working by herself, for three years now.  At first she faced a lot of obstacles, like finances and lack of help from anyone to move merchandise from one place to another, but, little by little she figured out how to get things done, and now works in comfort.  Like every young person she has goals and objectives; she wants to have a locale where she can offer a wider variety of clothing for the Christmas holidays.  This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she is grateful to those who provide her the opportunity to have access to credit because it gives her the security to keep going with the business.  With the 1200 soles Lais will buy merchandise, including clothing and shoes so she can continue selling to her clients.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carla Alejandra

texts.es: La Señorita Carla vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de kupini. Ella se dedica a vender calzados de cholitas, los cuales son realizados en el taller de su madre Genoveva. Carla también trabaja en el taller, pero ella compra estos calzados a su madre y los vende en la feria 16 de julio de la cuidad de El Alto, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior credito que lo utilizo en la compra de calzados por mayor, ahora solicita el credito para la compra de una computadora de ultima generacion que lo utilizara para sus realizar sus trabajos y para sus estudios.
texts.en: Señorita Carla lives in her parents' house in the Kupini area.  She makes a living selling traditional "cholitas" shoes, which she makes in the shop that belongs to her mother, Genoveva.  Carla also works in the shop, but she buys the shoes from her mom and sells them in the July 16th fair in the city of El Alto.  She says that it went well with the previous loan that she used to buy the shoes at wholesale.  Now she asks for the loan to purchase a latest generation computer that she will use to carry out her work and her studies.

loans.use: to buy a latest generation computer.

loans.name: David Omar

texts.es:
David, necesita un préstamo para crecer y aumentar la capacidad del negocio, ya que quiere reparar la consola  de videojuegos, que es la que le ayuda a probar la nitidez de las películas y juegos que vende, adelantandole a los clientes un detaller de lo que estan comprando.
Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a comprar productos para mantener surtido el negocio de CD Y DVD, con juegos para niños y otra mercadería, sus circunstancias han mejorado.
texts.en:
David needs a loan so that he can grow and increase his business capacity. He wants to repair a video game console, which helps him to test the clarity of the movies and video games that he sells. In addition, his customers can see the details of what they are buying in advance.

David says that his previous loan helped him to buy products, such as CDs and DVDs, to maintain the inventory in his business. He also bought children's games and other merchandise. As a result, his circumstances improved.

loans.use: to repair a video game console.

loans.name: Jean Damour

texts.en:
Jean D'amour is 36 years old and married with three children aged between three and 11. For the past year, he has sold chickens and he currently employs four people to help him. 

Jean D'amour is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via the Vision Finance Company to purchase more chickens to sell. He plans to use the profits generated with his loan to provide for his family's basic needs and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Doña Jesús tiene 43 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos, ellos residen en la comunidad de El Carbonal, de la ciudad de Bonito Oriental, Colon. Ella comenzó su negocio desde hace dos años con la venta de cosméticos, lo inicio por una amiga que le ayudaba a vender y fue así como aprendió del negocio, doña Jesús sale todos los días a vender sus productos a las diferentes localidades de su comunidad lo hace junto con su hija mayor. El préstamo que doña Jesús solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos, cremas y shampoo. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá surtir más su negocio y de este modo ofrecerá más productos a sus clientes. Su meta es poder ser una distribuidora de cosméticos al por mayor y  tener su propio local. Es el primer financiamiento que solicita doña Jesús en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Doña Jesús is 43 years old, a single mother of three children, and they live in the community of El Carbonal in the city of Bonito Oriental, Colon.  She began her business two years ago by selling cosmetics, which was started by a friend whom she helped make sales, and this was how she learned the business.  Doña Jesús goes out every day to sell her products in different places in her community, and she does so with her oldest daughter.  

The loan that Doña Jesús asks for will be invested in purchasing cosmetics, creams, and shampoos.  With the support from the loan she will be able to stock up her business and in this way offer more products to her customers.  Her goal is to be able to be a distributer of wholesale cosmetics and have her own shop.  It is the first financing that Doña Jesús has asked for from FAMA and she hopes to be able to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: La Hermandad Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el grupo La Hermandad

Elidema es uno de los miembros del grupo, ella es casada y tiene 03 hijos de los cuales 02 ya terminaron la universidad. Ella es comerciante y se dedica a la compra y venta de plantas medicinales, su esposo trabaja en un hotel y fue quien le dio la idea de empezar este negocio, en la actualidad Elidema reparte plantas medicinales a varios hoteles y baños saunas, este trabajo lo realiza 03 veces por semana, los días restantes  se a su dedica a  vender productos de belleza, gracias a su trabajo ella puede  ayudar a su familia sobre todo a su último hijo que aun está en la escuela, con su préstamo actual lo invertirá en la compra de plantas medicinales por mayor cantidad y asi poder abastecer a sus clientes, en el futuro desea agrandar su negocio buscando más clientes.
Elidema es la persona que viste polo rojo

¡Elidema agradece su apoyo!
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú!  This is the La Hermandad group.

Elidema is one of the group's members.  She's married and has three children, two of whom have finished college.  She is a businesswoman who makes her living as a medicinal plant vendor.  Her husband works in a hotel and was the one who give her the idea to start the business.  At present Elidema distributes medicinal plants to various hotels and bath houses three times per week.  The other days she sells beauty products.  Thanks to her work, she is able to help her family, in particular her youngest child, who is still in school.  She'll invest her current loan in the bulk purchase of medicinal plants so she can supply her clients.  In the future she would like to grow the business by bringing in more clients.

In the photo above, Elidema is the one in the red polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy medicinal plants.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La Sra.  Yolanda  tiene 55 años, tiene dos  hijos de las edades de 18 y 35 años, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa en esta ocasión ella vende variedad de gorras y chamarras, ella tiene un puesto fijo en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la zona 16 de Julio donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su sexta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Yolanda va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de  gorras y chamarras  por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio y también que se acerca la época de de fin de año y esta época es de mucha demanda, la Sra. Yolanda va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de gorras.
texts.en:
Señora Yolanda is 55 years old, has two children of the ages 18 and 35, and makes a living selling a variety of clothing.  At the moment she sells a variety of hats and jackets.  She has a permanent stall in one of the most well-known markets in the area of July 16 where she offers her products.  

This loan is her sixth loan cycle with the institution.  Señora Yolanda is going to use the loan to buy a variety of wholesale hats and jackets, and in this way offer a variety of clothing to her customers to increase her earnings.  Her reason for asking for the loan is to continue improving her business, and also since the end of the year is approaching and this time has great demand Señora Yolanda is going to use the benefits to continue buying a variety of hats.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing (jackets and hats).

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталья продает походные сумки, кашельки, женские сумки, ремни, барсетки. Наталья - порядочная и пунктуальная. Она уже пользовалась бизнес кредитами и всегда вовремя делала выплаты, без опозданий. Как и в прошлый раз, Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки ремней и кашельков. Приближаются праздники и Наталья ожидает оживление торговли. Поэтому хочет увеличить свой товарный запас.
texts.en: Natalia sells travel bags, purses, women's bags, belts and small briefcases. She is honest and punctual.  She has already taken business loans, and has always repaid them on time.   Like last time, Natalia is requesting a loan to buy belts and wallets.  With the holidays fast approaching, Natalya is expecting business to pick up, and this is why she would like to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and buy belts and purses.

loans.name: Mulloabdullo

texts.ru: Очень умный студент из Таджикистана нуждается вашей поддержки. Его зовут Муллабдулло. Ему 20 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Экономическое положение его семьи очень тяжелые и поэтому 2 года он был трудовым мигрантом в Российской Федерации. Заработав немного денег, он вернулся на родину и потратил заработанные деньги для нужды семьи. Муллоабдулло в миграции было очень трудно справляться без высшего образования, и поэтому он в этом году поступил в Горно-металлургический Университет. Данное время он является успешным студентом 1 курса и должен оплатить за учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, вместе ему поможем стать хорошим специалистом будущим.
texts.en: A very bright student from Tajikistan needs your support. His name is Mulloabdullo, he is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents. The economic situation of his family is very tough so 2 years ago, he went to Russia as a migrant worker. When he had earned a little money, he returned home and used his savings to pay for his family's necessities. Mulloabdullo had a difficult time as a migrant worker because he does not have a post-secondary education. This is why he entered the University of Mining and Metallurgy this year, where he is currently a successful first-year student. He now has to pay his tuition, and is seeking a loan for this purpose. Mulloabdullo is waiting for your kind assistance. Let's work together to help him become a skilled future specialist.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида жительница города Вахдат. Ей 33 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Муж Саиды находится в Российской Федерации. Саида предоставляет услугу у себя дома. Она занимается шитьем платьев и матрасов. Этим видом деятельности Саида занимается три года. Она берет кредит для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Saida lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her husband is currently in the Russian Federation.  Saida works from home, sewing clothes and mattresses.  She has been involved in this activity for the past three years.  She is taking a loan to buy some fabric.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.ru: Мехрангез продолжает свою деятельность. В этот раз она берет кредит для покупки необходимых тканей и материалов. Мехрангез хочет сшить платья с вышивками для продажи, чтобы ввести что-то новое.
texts.en: Mehrangez continues to work at her business. This time she is seeking a loan to buy needed fabrics and supplies. Mehrangez wants to sew dresses with embroidery so she can introduce a new product to sell.

loans.use: to buy necessary fabrics and supplies

loans.name: Blerta

texts.en:
Blerta is twenty-six years old and married.  She is a mother of two boys ages two and five years old.  Blerta's family lives in very bad conditions in a minority community of Kosovo.  She is a house-wife and her husband performs at weddings during the summer, however in this season he doesn’t work. 
They also receive social pension which is a very small amount.  Despite the poor conditions that her family lives in, Blerta is always smiling and in a good mood.  Now she is requesting a loan in order to improve the living conditions for her family members.  She hopes in the future to find a job and have financial security and offer a better education for her children.  She is very grateful to all KIVA lenders!

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Alwa Group

texts.en: This group, which is called Alwa, consists of two ladies and two men who live in Taiz, Yemen.  Noria is 26-year-old and is a housewife who loves her small home.  She started building her home by saving a small amount of money and her success has motivated her to expand it.  She applied for a youth loan of 30000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies.  She dreams of owning a big house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's group is comprised of two hard working women.  Rose is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fortportal region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children and one of them is currently in school.  For the past three years, Rose has been working hard to manage her small market stall, which sells fresh food like matooke. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more fresh food such us matooke, sweet potatoes and cassava for resale.  It will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay for her medical bills.  Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food such us matooke, sweet potatoes and cassava for resale.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío, de 27 años, es una mujer joven, amable y muy buena, actualmente no tiene ninguna relación sentimental pero tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad a quienes cría con mucho amor y brindándoles toda la atención que necesitan, vive en la casa de sus padres y junto se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. El trabajo de Rocío consiste en la venta de cosméticos, entre los productos que vende tiene polvos de cara, lápiz labial, perfumes, colonias, shampoo, talcos y otros artículos para el cuidado de la piel y del cuerpo. Lleva realizando este negocio hace más de 5 años y vende principalmente entre sus amigos y familiares bajo el sistema de entrega crediticia, posteriormente realiza la cobranza. Afirma que trabaja sola ya que así sus ganancias se incrementan. Por otra parte, durante las mañanas trabaja como secretaria en una institución pública, eso le permite también ofrecer sus productos entre sus compañeras de labor. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su tiempo para estar a lado de su familia, le va muy bien ya que sus ganancias superan a su inversión inicial, más adelante espera establecer una tienda en donde ofrezca sus productos con mayor comodidad además de otros accesorios y prendas femeninas. Este es el préstamo número 4 con MFP, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo, se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que son muy solidarios y responsables. 
Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará una gran cantidad de productos de cuidado personal como perfumes, colonias, shampoo, talcos y otros, además invertirá en la compra de zapatos, carteras y otros accesorios para damas con lo cual espera incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
27-year-old Rocio is a kind and very good woman.  At the moment she does not have a romantic relationship but she has two children who are 9 and 11 years old, whom she has raised with much love and gives them all the attention they need.  She lives in her parents' home and together they work hard daily to get ahead in life.  The work that Rocio does is selling cosmetics; among the products she sells are face powders, lipstick, perfume, cologne, shampoo, talcum powder, and other items for skin and body care.  She has done this job for more than five years and sells mainly to her friends and family members through a system of credit delivery, later making the collection.  She says she works alone because this way her earnings increase.  On the other hand, in the mornings she works as a secretary in a public institution which allows her to also offer her products to her work friends.

What she likes most about her job is that it allows her to have time with her family, and it is going well because her earnings exceed her initial investment.  Later on she hopes to establish her own store where she offers her products with more comfort in addition to other accessories and feminine garments.  This is her fourth loan with MFP; she thanks those people who have offered her the loan that she needs to increase her working capital and she promises to make her repayments on time.  She is happy to belong to her communal bank because they are mutually supportive and responsible.  With the requested amount of 3000 soles she will buy a large quantity of personal care products like perfumes, colognes, shampoo, talcum powder, and others, in addition to investing in the purchase of shoes, wallets, and other accessories for women with which she hopes to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cologne, shampoo, talcum powder, shoes and wallets.

loans.name: Chamangul

texts.ru:
Чамангул жительница города Вахдат. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Муж Чамангул находится за рубежом. Сама Чамангул зарабатывает путем разведения телят и коз. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Чамангул разводит скот у себя дома, как и многие жители города.
Чамангул берет кредит для закупа коз.
texts.en: Chamangul lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 29 years old, married, and the mother of one child.  Her husband currently lives abroad.  Chamangul makes a living raising calves and goats.  She has been involved in this activity for the past three years.  Like many residents of her city, she raises her livestock at home.  She is taking a loan to buy goats.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Emomali

texts.ru:
Эмомали проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 39 лет. Он разведен. У него один ребенок. Эмомали работает таксистом. Он предоставляет услугу по маршруту Вахдат-Душанбе. В этой области Эмомали год. Раньше он занимался частным извозом по городу Вахдат. 
Эмомали берет кредит для обновления салона автомобиля и ремонта дома.
texts.en: Emomali lives in Vahdat. He is 39 years old, divorced, and has 1 child. He works as a taxi driver, and provides service between Vahdat and Dushanbe. He has been doing this for a year. Previously, he worked as a private cab driver in Vahdat. Emomali is seeking a loan to update the interior of his car, and to renovate his house.

loans.use: to update the interior of his car and renovate his house

loans.name: Havasmo

texts.ru: Хавасмо проживает в районе Пяндж. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Хавасмо портниха. Она шьет национальные платья. Хавасмо берет заказы на дому. Таким образом она зарабатывает. Шитьем Хавасмо занимается три года. Она берет кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки, чтобы продолжить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Havasmo lives in the Pyandj region.  She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of six children.  She makes a living working as a dressmaker and sewing traditional Tajik clothing.  She takes orders and works from home.   Havasmo has been involved in sewing for three years.  She is taking a loan to purchase a new sewing machine, which will help her to continue her activity.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fortportal region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  For the past two years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her small market stall, which sells fresh food like matooke. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more fresh food such us matooke, sweet potetoes and cassava for resale, and will help Gorret to generate greater profits and to pay for her families medical bills. Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to build a bigger house of her own. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food such us matooke, sweet potatoes and cassava for resale.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group is comprised of two hard working women.  Irene is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fortportal region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  For the past year, Irene has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells flour, sugar, soap, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more commodities like sodas, sugar, splash juice and cooking oil for resale.  The loan will help Irene to generate greater profits and pay for her families medical bills.  Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to go back to school since she didn’t get a chance to complete her studies. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more commodities like sodas, sugar, splash juice and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Doston

texts.ru: Достон житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 23 года. Он холост. Достон живет с родителями. Он занимается ремонтом автомобилей. В этой области Достон имеет четырехлетний стаж. Он берет кредит для приобретения необходимых запасных частей автомашин, чтобы расширить свою деятельность и улучшить качество работы.
texts.en: Doston is a resident of the Rumy district.  He is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents.  He is involved in auto repair and has been working in this field for four years.  He is taking a loan to purchase essential auto spare parts, which will help him to expand his business and improve the quality of his work.

loans.use: to purchase essential auto spare parts.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 23 years old, married and has two children. She used her previous loan to buy beads, wires and threads for her necklace-making business, an enterprise she has been operating for five years. A very hardworking and friendly woman, Eunice quickly repaid the loan.

While she hopes to open up other crafting businesses, she is now requesting a loan of 63,585.00 KES to buy a cow so that she can start dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start dairy farming.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty's group is comprised of three hard working women.  Betty is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fortportal region of Uganda.  For the past three years, Betty has been working hard to manage her small clothing business.

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and take care of herself and her family.  Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger salon. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo works hard to support his family. He is married and has a traveling sales business in the Philippines selling spices.

Rodrigo requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell, like onions, garlic, cooking oil, etc..

Rodrigo has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Rodrigo would like to save enough money so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spices to sell, like onions, garlic, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en: Liana is 47 years old.  She lives in the small village of Bolnisi district with her husband and three children.  Her son works as a firemen in their village and earns a monthly income.  The family runs an agricultural business as well.  In particular, they have three milking cows and a calf.  They sell milk locally in an open market at a good price.  Besides this, they have 0.6 hectare of land, where they grow maize.  Liana rents two hectares of land, where the family sows hay and then sells it locally among the villagers.  Each member of the family works to ensure a good harvest.  Liana requested a loan to purchase a stock of clothing.  She buys clothing from the wholesalers and then sells them in her village.  After purchasing the stock, she will be able to sell more clothes.  It will increase the income of their family and with increased income, they will improve their living conditions.  Liana awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale in the village.

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Regina's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Regina is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Regina has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells flour, sugar, soap, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Regina has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more commodities such as sodas, sugar, splash juice, and cooking oil for resale and will help Regina to generate greater profits and buy food and new clothes for her family. Regina hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Regina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more commodities such as sodas, sugar, splash juice, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Rehab

texts.en:
Rahab a 27-year-old lady, is married, and has two children who are all in school. She owns a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in business for three years and also earns an income from selling shoes. She was previously involved in selling clothes.She has learned how to save since she became a client of Faulu Kenya. 

She wishes to expand her business and also increase her profits. She needs a loan of 10,935 KES to buy a blender for making fresh juice.

loans.use: to buy a blender for making fresh juice

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius who is now 48 years old, used his previous loan to buy clothes for resale. His business did well and he was able to repay his loan on time. He is very industrious and hardworking as he has to support his family. 

He wishes to put up a bookstore in the future and be a main distributor of books and stationery within his town. He requires a loan of 42,727.50 KES to buy stationery and textbooks.

loans.use: to buy stationery and textbooks

loans.name: Gjuzide

texts.en:
Gjuzide is 51 years old and living in a vulnerable community in the southern part of Kosovo. She is married and has one child. She is a housewife and her husband works in construction with a very low salary. 

They live in an old house which has not been renovated in a long time. They tried to save money for renovations but always come up short as something else seems to take priority and requires them to spend the money. Gjuzide is requesting a loan in order to renovate the house including the doors and windows.

The loan will help them to have better conditions which are very important for the health of the child, especially to insulate the house against the cold in the upcoming winter months. Gjuzide hopes to offer a better life for her child. Gjyzide and her family want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to renovate the house's doors and windows

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Florence has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells flour, sugar, soap, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more commodities such as sodas, sugar, splash juice, and cooking oil for resale and will help Florence to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child and other basic needs for the family. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to to see her children graduate. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more commodities such as sodas, sugar, splash juice, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Maheswar

texts.en:
Maheswar is a 32-year-old physically challenged person living with his family in a small village in Odisha, India. His family consists of his wife; his one daughter, age 15; and one son, age 8. His wife is a homemaker and his children are continuing their schooling. He is the only earning person in his family. To support his family, he started a variety shop in the market which is two kilometres from his home. Whatever he earns from this activity is used for consumption purposes and is not sufficient for them to live happily and afford all necessities of life.

Maheswar sells packaged items like biscuits, cakes, wafers, chocolates, betel, etc., in his shop. He goes to the market to purchase the items for his shop very frequently. But, due to lack of funds, he is not able to meet the growing demand of his customers and compete with his competitors.

Maheswar has requested a loan of 30,000 Indian rupees (INR) to purchase stock of what he sells in bulk and purchase snacks like varieties of chocolates, wafers and bakery items for his shop. He needs to meet the market demands and compete with his competitors. He hopes to enlarge his business and construct a concrete house for his family.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing chocolates, wafers and bakery items for his shop.

loans.name: Apsaladin

texts.en: Apsaladin is 59 years old. He lives in the small village of Marneuli with his wife. He is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns a greenhouse, where he sows cucumbers and tomatoes. The harvested products are sold locally in an open market at a good price. Apsaladin is a very hard-working man and has a wealth of experience in his business. He has requested a loan for purchasing wood for the greenhouse. After purchasing the wood, the greenhouse will be heated properly. Apsaladin will be able to produce more vegetables and thus increase his sales. This will increase the income of the family and improve their living conditions. Apsaladin awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his greenhouse

loans.name: Piri

texts.en: Piri is 46 years old. He lives in the small village of Bolnisi with his wife. He is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has 2 calves and a 0.3 hectare plot of land where he grows potatoes, cucumbers and peppers. The harvested products are sold locally at a good price. Piri works hard to ensure a good harvest. He has requested a loan for purchasing calves. After purchasing these calves, he will expand his livestock. He will raise them and sell beef to the villagers. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will improve their living conditions. Piri awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is 46 years old and lives in the small village of Bolnisi. She lives with her parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. She is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a milk cow and sells milk locally in an open market at a good price. Leila also owns a plot of land, where she grows wheat, potatoes, maize and beans. The harvested products are sold locally to other villagers. Leila has requested a loan for cultivating her land. After the land is cultivated properly, she will be sure of a good harvest. The harvest will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate her plot of land

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is 55 years old, married and a mother of three children.  She sells milk and porridge in Mpeketoni, Lamu for a living where she earns a monthly income of about KES 12,000.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more milk from farmers.  In return, due to her sales, she will raise her status and the living standards of her family.  In doing so, she will be able to help educate her children. 

Lidia intends to continue growing her business and own a well established retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more milk from farmers.

loans.name: C3532 Abakunzi Group

texts.en:
Jeanne is 24 years old and is married.  She is the president of a group called "C3532 ABAKUNZI" in the local language.  She is the third person from right side in the photo.  This business is well known in the local industry of selling second hand clothing.  The hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 5.30 p.m. every day except on weekends.  She currently employs eight people and she has four years of experience in this business. 

Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more second hand clothing for resale.  With this expansion, Jeanne hopes to earn more profits.  This will allow her to start saving for her future, pay school fees for her children, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 24 years old, married, and has one child. He owns a motorbike that he uses to provide transportation services within his area, and he has been in business for three years. He is very hard-working, and since he joined Faulu Kenya he has become very independent and has increased his profits.
 
He wishes to own a taxi for transportation services, and also to expand his business, in the future. He requires a loan of 42,727.50 KES to purchase a license for his motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a license for his motorbike

loans.name: Kshirabdhi Tanaya

texts.en: Kshirabdhi Tanaya is a 30-year-old divorced woman living with her parents and a son, who is 4 years old. After her divorce with her husband, she came back to her paternal house and started living with her parents, but she felt like a burden on her parents as her father already has the responsibility of other family members. She planned to help her father financially and started out as a small entrepreneur. She makes badi (a traditional local food item prepared from lentils, spices, salt, pepper, etc.) She takes orders from her customers and they pick up these products from her house. She has been doing this activity manually. She earns 4,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from this activity, which is not sufficient for her family. Now, since she wants to grow her business, she requires a grinder and lentils and spices in bulk amounts. Kshirabdhi Tanaya says, “I can earn up to 6,000 INR per month after adding a grinder and raw materials for my business.” She has requested a loan of 25,000 INR for purchasing a mixer grinder and raw materials like lentils, spices, pepper, salt, etc., for her business. She wants to help her father and send her son to a good school.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a mixer grinder and raw materials like lentils, spices, pepper, salt, etc., for her badi business.

loans.name: Mikali

texts.en:
Mikali is a 38-year-old lady, is married and has two children, who are both in school. She has been selling fruits for four years and is also very hard-working. She has learned how to manage her business properly, with the help of Faulu Kenya.

She hopes to own a big grocery store, where she can operate her business and increase her profits, in the future. Now, she needs a loan of 20,857.50 KES to buy bananas, oranges, avocados and watermelons.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, avocados and watermelons

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 22 years old. She is married and has no children. In 2008, she established her stationery shop. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW.

She is using her current loan to buy stationery goods for her business. 

Sabina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family, in the future. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy stationery and related goods.

loans.name: La  Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
Italo  es uno de los miembros del grupo La Buena Amistad

Italo es soltero tiene 45 años, actualmente es el presidente del grupo y el único varón, son muchos años que participan juntos. Ítalo se dedica a la venta de pan, oficio que desempeña todos los días por las mañanas; repartiendo pan a sus caseras de diferentes zonas de su ciudad, con sus ahorros a logrado abrir otro negocio de venta de gas domestico, para ese fin se compro un puesto en el mercado de su zona, desde donde realiza la venta y el reparto de gas, sus clientes son los mismos comerciantes del mercado, amas de casa y restaurantes del lugar. Ítalo se siente feliz porque gracias a sus préstamos ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo que le permite prosperar, con el dinero de su actual préstamo comprara más balones para su negocio, su mayor sueño en la vida es comprarse una casa propia y convertirse en un comerciante exitoso.
Italo agradece a todos los inversionistas que lo apoyan tanto a él como a su grupo comunal.

La Sra. que viste polo color morado aparece como invitada.
texts.en:
Italo is one of the members of the group, La Buena Amistad 

Italo is single and is 45 years old. Nowadays, he is the president of the group and the only male. They have participated together many years. Italo sells bread, a trade which he carries out every day in the mornings, distributing homemade bread to different areas of the city. With his savings, he has managed to open another business selling butane for household use. For this reason, he bought a stand in the market in his area from which he makes his sales and distribution of the butane.. His customers are the same market traders, housekeepers, and local restaurants. Italo feels happy because thanks to the loans, he has managed to increase his working capital that allows him to prosper. With the money from his current loan, he will purchase more butane tanks for his business. His greatest dream in life is to buy himself his own house and to turn into a successful trader. Italo is grateful to all the investors who support he and his communal group so much. 

The lady who is seen in the purple polo shirt appears as a guest.

loans.use: to purchase tanks of butane

loans.name: Kamalamani

texts.en:
Kamalamani is a 29-year-old divorced lady who lives in her parental house with her mother, younger brother and her daughter, age 8 years old. Three years back, her husband divorced her and then she came to her parental house. She does not want to be a burden on her family, so she started to sell rice in the village. Every day, the daily laborers are buying rice from her. In this way, she earns 3,500 Indian rupees (INR) per month. She has two years of experience in this business. This income is not enough for her family’s cash flow. She wants to grow her business and to purchase rice in bulk.

Kamalamani has requested a loan of 20,000 INR for purchasing rice in bulk so that she can grow her business and fulfill her customers' demands. She hopes to provide better education and study materials to her daughter and take good care of her parents. She can live a happy life with her family members and fulfill her family members' requirements.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing rice in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 35 years old, married, and has five children, who are all in school. She has been in business for five years and also earns an income by farming. She is very hard-working, and with the help of Faulu Kenya her business has grown tremendously, and she has been able to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to own a big business one day. Now she requires a loan of 53,156.25 KES to buy potatoes, tomatoes and onions to resell.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Al-Ahsan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ahsan. It consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen.

Susan is a 28-year-old single woman who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She is requesting a youth loan of 50,000 YER for home improvements. She would like to buy furniture for her bedroom. She hopes in the future to buy furniture for the rest of her house to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her bedroom.

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.en: Members of this group are very grateful to their Kiva lenders for the loans they have received. With the help of their just-repaid Kiva loan, these women were able to increase their business inventories. This led to an increase in sales and profit, and their living conditions improved a bit as a result of the improvements in their respective businesses. Having finished repaying that loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each member of the group. With this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales, and further improve their living conditions. Featured leader Adama is going to use her share of this loan to buy shoes, school bags, and womens’ clothing at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, school bags, and womens’ clothing at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 49 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, es soltera desde hace muchos años pero tiene 4 hijos a quienes crió sola y con mucho esfuerzo, vive en su casa propia junto a su ultima hija de 15 años ya que los demás son independientes, sin embargo le brindan siempre el apoyo necesario para solventar los gastos de su hogar. La ocupación principal de nuestra amiga Rosa consiste en la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, aceites y algunos productos regionales como plátanos y verduras. Tiene una pequeña bodega que ha establecido en su casa y desde ahí atiende todos los días desde muy temprano. Todo lo que ofrece al público lo renueva a diario comprando en el mercado de la ciudad al por mayor, selecciona las verduras mas frescas y saludables. Trabaja sola la mayor parte del tiempo, pero ocasionalmente su hija la ayuda cuando ella tiene que realizar algunas diligencias fuera de casa. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 1 año y le agrada la comodidad y la tranquilidad con la que puede generar sus ingresos en su propia casa. 

Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque con los dividendos que obtiene de las ventas de sus productos puede solventar los gastos académicos de su hija y además puede cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, mas adelante espera extender su bodega para que pueda ofrecer más artículos y sus ganancias se incrementen. Este es el préstamo número 4 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mas productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, fideos, verduras y otros.
texts.en:
49 year old Rosa is a good woman. She is kind and hardworking. She has been single for many years, but she has 4 children who she raised alone and with much strength. She lives in her own house with her youngest daughter of 15 years, since the others are independents. However, they always offer the necessary support to afford the household expenses. The primary occupation of our friend Rosa consists in the sale of groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, oils, and some regional products such as plantains and vegetables. She has a small shop which she has established in her house, and from there is open every day from early on. All that she offers to the public she renews daily, purchasing wholesale in the city marketplace. She selects the freshest and healthiest vegetables.  She works alone the majority of the time, but occasionally her daughter helps her when she has to do some errands outside of home. She has done this work for about a year and she likes the convenience and ease with which she is able to generate income in her own home.

She really likes what she does because the dividends that she obtains from the sale of her products, she is able to afford the academic expenses of her daughter and can also cover the basic necessities of her household. Later, she hopes to expand her small shop so that she is able to offer more items and her earnings will grow. This is her 4th loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the loan opportunity that they offer to her, and for the financial backing that she needs to get ahead. She promises to pay her monthly payments punctually, and to continue working with great responsibility together with the members of her communal bank. 

With the requested loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase more staple products, such as rice, sugar, eggs, milk, noodles, vegetables, and others.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, eggs, milk, noodles, vegetables, and others.

loans.name: Believe In God Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Believe In God II” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to ask for a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each group member in order to invest in their respective businesses.

Abdul is the leader of this group. Abdul is 36 years old. He is married to a trader and has two children attending primary schools. Abdul sells cosmetics and has been doing business for six years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a large quantity of cosmetics to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of cosmetics to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Meet Dominic: he runs a business in the mining town of Luanshya in the Copperbelt province of Zambia. He needs a Kiva loan. This is his story . . .

My name is Dominic. I am married, and I have two daughters. I grew up here in the small town of Luanshya, where I run my business of sending and receiving money. I also sell groceries.

When I first started, I used to sell a lot of different types of sweets in a makeshift stand locally known as a kantemba. I worked very hard, and it took me seven years to build my own shop in a proper building. However, things did not get any better because I did not have a lot of stock, and there was nothing to entice customers to my shop. In 2009, I started to run mobile money transfers through Zoona. My business improved because even though I did not have a lot of stock in my shop, people would come in to ask about money transfers. This gave me the foot traffic that I needed.

Now that many people have come to know my shop, the money that I have in my business is not enough to satisfy my customers. I am appealing to the Kiva lenders to help me out with this loan so that I can add it to my working capital and have the freedom to serve customers who want to send and receive money at all times.

loans.use: add to his capital so he can serve more people who want to send and receive money.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells second hand clothes in Benyadze, near Elmina, which she has done for three years. She is married and has eight dependents. She uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility bills. Abena needs this loan to purchase more secondhand clothes for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Abena will acquire a shop for selling her secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Shamila

texts.es:
Shamila, de 28 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 8, 5 y 3 años de edad, tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de sus menores hijos y su conviviente, ella trabaja mucho para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Shamila consiste en la venta de comida, el principal platillo que ofrece a su clientela es el “caldo de gallina”. Tiene un local en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad que colinda con el puerto pesquero y otras entidades públicas lo cual le permite tener gran cantidad de clientes que van en busca de los deliciosos y sustanciosos caldos como solo ella sabe preparar. Realiza esta actividad más de 2 años y le va muy bien. Por otra parte tiene un mototaxi que compró con ayuda de su conviviente y eso le genera un ingreso económico adicional. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite tener tiempo disponible por las tardes y estar tranquila en su casa a lado de sus hijos, además siente que le va muy bien ya que genera ingresos económicos por partida doble para su hogar, espera mas adelante tener un negocio en su casa relacionada al sector técnico vehicular para que trabaje junto a su cónyuge. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
El monto solicitado 1000 soles, lo utilizará para comprar algunos ingredientes e insumos como carne de gallina, fideos, papás, huevos, condimentos y otros, además comprará algunas ollas y utensilios que necesita para seguir realizando su trabajo.
texts.en:
28 year old Shamila is a good woman. She is kind and very responsible. She is married to her partner with whom she has three children of 8, 5, and 3 years of age. She has her own house, where she lives together with her 3 young children and her spouse. She works a lot to be able to offer a greater quality of life to her family. Shamila's work consists of food sales. The main dish that she offers her customers is "chicken soup" She has a stand in a busy street in the city that is adjacent to the fishing port and other public entities,  which permits her to have a great number of customers that go in search of the delicious and hearty soups, as only she knows how to prepare. She has done this work more than 2 years and it is going very well. Moreover, she has a mototaxi which she bought with the help of her spouse, and that generates an additional economic income. She really likes what she does since it allows her to have time available in the evenings and to be quiet in her house with her children. Additionally she feels that it is going very well since she generates economic income doubly for her household. She hopes later to have a business in her house related to the technical vehicular sector so that she can work together with her spouse. 

This is her 4th loan with MFP. It is for this that she is grateful to all the people who have made her loans possible to continue doing her work with the greatest results. Furthermore, she promises one more time to make the payments of her dues punctually, as she has in previous loans that she had. Additionally, she is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people. 

The requested loan of 1000 soles will be used to purchase some ingredients and supplies, such as chicken meat, noodles, potatoes, eggs, condiments, and others. Otherwise she will purchase some pots and utensils that she needs to continue doing her work.

loans.use: to purchase chicken meat, noodles, potatoes, eggs, condiments, and others, as well as pots and utensils.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 24 years old and a business man who owns a cyber cafe.  He has been in business for three years.  He is a very responsible and hardworking gentleman.  Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, Eric has learned how to save his money.  This has helped him to invest more in his business.
He wishes to grow and expand his business and for this reason, he requests a loan of 53,156.25 KES to buy furniture and a back-up power supply.

loans.use: to buy furniture and to buy power back-up.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a food vender. She cooks plain rice and vegetable stew for sale. She has done this for three years. She lives together with her husband and two children at Benyadze near Cape Coast. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Nana will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, fish and other ingredients to prepare her food to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, fish and other ingredients to prepare her food to sell

loans.name: Akosoua

texts.en: Akosoua produces kenkey for sale at Benyadze near Elmiina. She has been selling kenkey for some years. She is a single parent with four children. As a single parent Akosoua uses her income to pay for the school fees and the general upkeep of her children. She needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Akosoua wish to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres al Poder”  en el Séptimo Ciclo  con 17   integrantes, cada una de las miembros tiene su propio trabajo, pero también ayuda a sus demás compañeras para poder fomentar la unión, y que todas sigan luchando por sus sueños.
Una de estas 17 mujeres es María, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo. Maria cuenta que su negocio está creciendo gracias al trabajo que ella está haciendo y gracias a la ayuda de su grupo. Tiene mayores ventas los fines de semanas, y se está preparando para estas fiestas, ya que quiere poder tener bien surtido su negocio, y es por eso que solicita del crédito, `para la compra de gaseosas, vinos, whiskys, cervezas y demás, y así poder tener un gran stock.
Ellas agradecen por la ayuda que reciben, pues sus familias también están siendo beneficiadas y están saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Mujeres al Poder Communal Bank is in its seventh cycle with 17 members.  Each one of them has her own job but also helps her other colleagues to promote unity and to continue fighting for their dreams.

María is one of these 17 women.  She makes a living selling all types of beverages.  María says her business is growing thanks to the work she's doing and to the help of her bank.  She has bigger sales on the weekend, and she's getting ready for the coming holidays because she wants to be able to have her business well stocked.

This is why she's requesting the loan to buy soda, wine, whisky, beer, and other beverages, so she can have a large supply.

They're grateful for the help they receive because their families also are being benefitted and are getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy soda, wine, whisky, beer, and other beverages

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace who is now 33 years old, used her previous loan to buy a motorbike.  Her business did very well and she successfully repaid her loan.  She has learned how to save money through the help of Faulu Kenya.  She is also a tailor and designs dresses, shorts, coats and bed sheets.
She hopes to purchase a car, land and also have a fleet of motor bikes.  Grace requires a loan of 84,442.50 to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 32 years old and a business lady who operates a grocery store.  She is married and has been in business for over five years.  She is very hardworking.  Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has increased her profits.  Sarah gives thanks to Faulu Kenya for training her on business management skills.  She hopes to someday expand her business and therefore requires a loan of 42,727.50 KES to buy tomatoes, sweet potatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, sweet potatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en: Minu is 42 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 20 and 15.  In 2000, she established her pickle making business.  Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy food materials for her business.   In the future, Minu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food materials for her pickle making business.

loans.name: Go Befo Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Go Befo” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs, who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000 Leones (for each person) in order to invest in their businesses. This is the third loan that this group of entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva lenders through SMT. With the help of the previous Kiva lenders' loan, they were able to increase their business inventories, make better profits and improve their living conditions. Having completed repayment of their last loan successfully, two members out of the five in the group would like to get a new loan, in order to further improve their businesses.  

Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group. Kadiatu is 40 years old. She is married and has five children, who are attending secondary schools. Kadiatu sells cooked rice with delicious sauce, and has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying cooking ingredients, like uncooked rice, palm-oil (the country's most popular cooking oil), tomatoes, onions, and ground nuts, in bulk. With these bulk items at hand, she will stop buying them at retail prices and will be able to cook a larger quantity of rice and sauce for sale.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her prepared food business, like uncooked rice and palm-oil, in bulk.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a fish monger. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries them for sale. Ekua has been selling fried fish for 8 years now. She is married with 6  dependents. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children. Ekua will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale. Ekua will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: San Juan 2 Group

texts.es:
San Juan II,  se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que  la presidenta  contacto con la asesora durante otra reunión que esta tenía por la zona.
Edit, la presidenta, se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, ella comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las delicias que hace, pues tiene gran habilidad para las comidas. Su meta es poder tener un local grande donde poder seguir vendiendo sus productos.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, condimentos, aderezos, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas y deleitando a sus clientes.
texts.en:
San Juan II is the name of the excellent group of women formed in the city of Ita, thanks to the president contacting the adviser during another meeting the adviser had in the area.  
Edit, the president, sells fast food. She comments that she has a very good clientele that always purchases the delicacies that she makes because she has great expertise in food. Her goal is to be able to have a large shop where she is able to continue selling her products. 
She requests this loan to purchase vegetables, condiments, dressing, and other items to be able to continue making her foods and delighting her customers.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, condiments, dressings, and other items.

loans.name: Maame Efua

texts.en:
Maame Efua cooks banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) for sale. She serves the banku with fish and vegetable sauce in Benyadze near Elmina.  

Maame is married to a farmer and has eight dependents. Maame has done this business for some years now. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish for the banku business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish for the banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) business.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
En el 5to ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras esta el grupo Sagrado Corazón de Jesús, ellas empezaron con el propósito de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio de su trabajo. Nora es parte de este grupo, y se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Nora está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia por medio de su trabajo, y quiere poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a las personas que necesitan de ella. La meta de Nora es poder tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes buena variedad de prendas.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de camisas, remeras, pantalones, blusas y demás prendas para poder surtirse y tener buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: In their 5th cycle of the program of entrepreneurial women, this the group Sagrado Corazón de Jesús. They started in order to help each other through their work. Nora is part of this group and she sells clothing. Nora is getting ahead and helps her family through her work and wants to continue growing and helping the people that need her. Nora's goal is to be able to have a store where she is able to offer her clients a good variety of clothes. She requests the loan to purchase shirts, t-shirts, pants, blouses, and other clothes to be able to stock up and to have a good variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, t-shirts, pants, blouses, and other clothes.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El comité "Los Angeles” está en su tercer ciclo. Este grupo surgió por el contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación. Ellas se ayudan en todo lo que necesitan para salir adelante e ir creciendo en todo lo que hacen.
Alicia, una de las integrantes de este grupo se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de todo tipo. Ella es una muy buena vendedora y gracias a eso está saliendo adelante y le está yendo bien.  Alicia está contenta por formar parte del grupo, ya que les está siendo de mucha ayuda.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar cosméticos y así seguir dando productos de gran calidad a sus clientas.
texts.en:
The communal group "Los Angeles" is in their third cycle. This group emerged because of the contact of one of the members with the foundation. They help in all that they need in order to get ahead and to continue growing in all that they do.
Alicia, one of the members of this group sells cosmetics of all types. She is a very good saleswoman and thanks to that she is getting ahead and is doing well. Alicia is happy to form part of the group since it is of much help to them. 
She requests this loan to be able to purchase cosmetics and therefore continue giving good quality products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Rincon De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité RINCON DE LA ESPERANZA  es un grupo antiguo que tras los años va fortaleciéndose y luchando contra las dificultades que conlleva sacar adelante el grupo son sras muy luchadoras y responsables, trabajadoras incansables.
Crecencia, una de las miembros vende lencería, y cuenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, pues tiene lencerías muy buenas y a muy buen precio. Ella tiene muy buena habilidad para las ventas y así, sumado a su esfuerzo se está abriendo camino. Es una persona con grandes ansias de crecer y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de lencerías, tanto para hombres como para mujeres y así seguir dando buena calidad a sus clientes.
