Asunción, la presidenta, cuenta que vende prendas de variadas clases y marcas, comenta que es un poco difícil, porque hay mucha competencia, pero comenta que lo que importa es diferenciarse y tener buenos productos que es lo que importa a los clientes. Ella esta saliendo adelante y está creciendo, y eso la pone muy feliz.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de remeras, camisas, blusas, jeans, pantalones y demás prendas para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group Damas Unidas (United Women) formed with 17 women who are neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All of the members of the group work to get ahead every day in their work. The women are friends and neighbors in this city and their goal is to be able to help their families and rise out of poverty. 

Asunción is the President of the group and she sells all kinds of garments from a variety of brands. She tells us that it is a little hard because there is a lot of competition but she says that it is important to her to distinguish herself and have good products, which is what is important to clients. She is getting ahead and her business is growing and this makes her very happy.

She is asking for this loan to purchase t-shirts, shirts, blouses, jeans, pants and more garments in order to continue working.

loans.use: purchase t-shirts, shirts, blouses, jeans, pants and more.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. Elvira earns additional income from farming sugar cane.

Elvira is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice to sell in her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Elvira dreams of saving enough to buy more farmland in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and is married with one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Gloria has been farming rice for 20 years and earns additional income from selling rice.

Gloria is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stuffed toys and bed sheets to resell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old and lives in Ospital, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 

Lolita has a general store  that sells variety of products such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others.  She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of Php 49,900 to to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap etc.

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.  In the future, Lolita hopes to have a lot of savings someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap, etc.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 59-year-old hard-working married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is an ambitious man who is involved in a number of activities such as second-hand clothes, a hardware store, motorcycle transport and rentals. He started his businesses so that he could educate his children and secure a future for them. He has a challenge of inadequate capital to exploit the existing market and his dream is to trade in wholesale.

Paul intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials needed in making furniture

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase stock of peanuts and ingredients for making samosas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric raw materials to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of firewood to resell.

loans.name: Carmela Isabel

texts.es:
Carmela es una mujer de 29 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia, Carmela pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Computación e Informática, en sus ratos libres distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carmela trabaja como vendedora en una librería de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Carmela se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Carmela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de productos de belleza, tales como maquillaje, cremas, cosméticos, perfumes, entre otros; de esta manera Carmela podrá iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carmela is a 29 year old, single woman and lives in Chiclayo.  She is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to succeed.  Thanks to her efforts and her family’s support, Carmela was able to study for a career in Computer Information Technology.  In her spare time, she entertains herself watching television and sometimes cooks a delicious “arroz de pato” (duck rice) to share with her family.

By her own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Carmela works as a salesperson in a bookstore in her city.  She begins work early in the morning every day and may work for about ten hours.  Carmela feels comfortable doing her job and believes that it is going well because of her good performance and the kind treatment she provides to her customers.

Carmela is very grateful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to their support, she will be able to purchase beauty products such as make-up, creams, cosmetics, perfume, and other items.  In this way, Carmela will be able to start a small business selling beauty products.  So, she will continue working and striving to get ahead and achieve her great dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for re-sale.

loans.name: Zanja Honda Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ZANJA HONDA está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Verónica tiene 26 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 14 años, todos ellos en edad escolar,   La Sra. Verónica  se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la localidad de ZANJA HONDA de ahí el nombre del grupo,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Verónica va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta   y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Verónica va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Verónica es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank Zanja Honda is made up of eight members, seven women and one man. The President of the bank is Mrs. Verónica who is 26 years old and she has two children who are 5 and 14 years old and of school age. Mrs. Verónica sells a variety of items of basic necessity like groceries, sweets, sodas and a variety of other items from her store in her neighborhood that is located in the town of Zanja Honda, which is where the group gets its name. This is her second loan with the institution and Mrs. Verónica will use it to purchase a variety of groceries to stock her business like rice, beans, flour and sugar. With the larger stock, she will be able to offer a wider variety of products to her customers. She is asking for this loan to improve her business. Mrs. Verónica will use the earnings to continue purchasing products and this will improve her income. Her wish is to have a larger space to be able to offer a better service to her customers. Mrs. Verónica is a hard working person and she is happy for the opportunity that she has been offered because her partners in the group, in many cases, are people that get their families ahead all alone.

loans.use: purchase a variety of groceries to stock their business with rice, beans, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Dariimaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dariimaa is 43 years old and lives with her husband, son and daughter in their own house in Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband works at private company as a driver. Her son, Buyandelger, aged 12, and her daughter, Monhtuya, aged 16, are secondary school students. She has been working at a private oil company as a cashier for the last 6 years. She is planning to purchase an Eco-friendly car to let her husband start a taxi service business for a living. 

Mrs. Dariimaa needs 4,600,000 MNT to purchase an Eco-friendly gas and electric car for her husband to start up a taxi service business. She is a diligent and communicative person.

loans.use: to purchase an Eco-friendly gas and electric car for her husband's new taxi service business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phone load (credit) from GLOBE and SMART to resell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and has four children. She is 53 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.
Evelyn operates a sari-sari general store to earn a living. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP from her work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more stock for her store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.
Evelyn has been a member of PMPC during this year. Evelyn hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Crisby

texts.en:
Crisby is 39 years old and lives in Carmen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has three children but unfortunately is now separated from his wife. Crisby is engaged in cutting and selling lumber, and he earns approximately PHP3,000 each month from his work. He has requested a loan to be used in paying for logs and lumber, and for labor and other expenses involved in cutting lumber for his existing business. 
Crisby joined PMPC just this year. In the future, Crisby hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for logs and lumber, and for labor and other expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more yellow mangoes to resell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy's primary business is farming. She has also sold second-hand clothes as a secondary business for the past twenty years. Her monthly income is KES 14,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Nancy will use the loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and more clothes to sell.

With the anticipated profits from her businesses, Nancy will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to export farm products, to expand her business selling clothes, and to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm and more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a hardworking woman who is very responsible in her daily activities. She is 43 years old and lives alone in the rural area of Tiribe, which is located in the Coast Province. She is a divorcee and is very industrious. 

Chizi sells mats from home and in the market, a business that allows her to meet household expenses, since this is her only source of income. She is taking out a loan to buy more mats to sell. With this process, Chizi will increase her clientele and her sales and thus her income. She also plans to start a goat meat business, to take advantage of the December festive season.

loans.use: to buy more mats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid  con su anterior credikiva compró carnes frías, queso y aumentó el surtido y con ello sus ventas. Desde que recibió su crédito, ha logrado aportar mas recursos a su hogar y con ello han aumentado su bienestar.  En la actualidad está aplicando aun segundo financiamiento con el cual comprará dulcería, carnes frías y queso con los cuales planea impactar a sus clientes en la época navideña, pues son los alimentos que mas comparten las familias en estas fiestas. Con el credikiva también comprará repuestos y pagará la mano de obra pues su congelador requiere mantenimiento preventivo en un segundo nivel. Ella dice a sus financiadores  de Kiva: “Gracias por el apoyo para crecer y así poyar mi familia: “
texts.en: With her previous loan, Ingrid bought cold cuts and cheese. She stocked up and therefore increased her sales. Ever since she obtained her loan, she has been able to bring home increased earnings and thus she has improved her well-being. She's currently applying for her second loan which she'll use to purchase sweets, cold cuts and cheese. She plans to make an impact on her customers during Christmas season, since these types of food are the ones that families most often partake of on the holidays. In addition, with this loan she'll also purchase spare parts and pay for labor, because her freezer is in need of preventive maintenance. She tells her Kiva lenders: "Thank you for giving me support so I can grow and therefore support my family".

loans.use: to purchase sweets, cold cuts and cheese, and also to purchase spare parts and pay for labor in order to do maintenance on her freezer.

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es: Existen mujeres que ven pasar la vida y otras que deciden enfrentar de frente cada situación que se presenta en el camino, este es el caso de María Nelly una mujer de 46 años que debido a su difícil situación económica, busca la forma de consolidar su proyecto de negocio, como medio de sustento, debido a que es una mujer sola. Su mayor anhelo es obtener dinero suficiente para adquirir surtido y generar ingresos que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida, por ello recurre a un crédito que le permita realizar su sueño
texts.en: There are women who watch life pass, and there are others who decide to confront head on every situation in their path. This is the case with Maria Nelly, a woman of 46, who, due to her difficult economic situation,  is looking for a way to strengthen her business project as a means of support, since she is a single woman. Her greatest desire is to obtain sufficient money to acquire stock and generate income that will allow her to have a better quality of life. To do that, she is turning to a loan that will allow her to realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy stock for her cafeteria

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase the materials used in bakery and sweets products

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en: Jinky is a 35-year-old resident of Carangan, Ozamis City. For 3 years, she has provided her 7 children's needs from the little amount of 5,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business as an aid to the income gained from her husband. She became a member of GDMPC in 2009. Jinky has applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 13,500 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Jinky wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is taking out a new loan to expand his existing business. He is very happy now that the previous loan had a great positive impact on his living standards. This new loan will help him to purchase more flour, basic grains, and instant products. This way he is sure to continue increasing sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, basic grains, and instant products.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky, a 25-year old, is a single entrepreneur of Lapasan, Clarin. He is earning from his transport service business. It has been running for almost 5 years now and he earns 7,000 PHP a month. To improve business, he has borrowed the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC - which he has just joined recently - to buy accessories and tyres. Before long, he is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy accessories and tyres.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en:
Valbona is a married mother of four children who range in age from nine to sixteen years old. She lives in central Albania with the rest of her Roma community. Her children go to school unlike the majority of children in their community whose parents don’t send them to school. “This is an accomplishment that I am proud of. I want them to have an education because I know firsthand what it means not having it,” she said.

Valbona has been selling used clothes for the past seven years. “This is a type of activity that doesn’t seem to be slowing soon. Instead it is booming because people have no money to buy new clothes, and, of course, they will buy such used ones,” she said.

Valbona is applying for a loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek to stock up on her inventory of used clothes to resell.

loans.use: to stock up on her inventory of used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She makes a living by providing transportation services. She has been in this business for five years as it allows her to support the needs of her child. She earns an income of PHP8,000 a month from the business. For a 47-year old mother, there’s nothing happier than to see her child succeed in her studies. Without hesitation, Elizabeth has requested a loan PHP21,000 from GDMPC to repair her transport vehicle used in her business. She hopes to give her child with a better education. She joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future she plans to improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in her business.

loans.name: Denia Melissa

texts.es: Denia tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Denia anteriormente trabajaba en la empresa privada y hace dos años inicio su propio negocio de pulpería con sus ahorros, donde vende productos comestibles como pan, manteca, condimentos, dulces, churros, salsinas, azúcar, arroz, jabón, harina, maíz, frijoles etc. además por la noche vende comidas rápidas como pollo frito con tajadas, tacos y baleadas para obtener otros ingresos. Actualmente ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para capitalizarse y surtir el negocio de productos comestibles que hacen falta y poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Su plan es que el negocio siga en crecimiento para poder mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Denia, 24, is a single mother who lives with her son in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  Previously, Denia worked for a private company. Two years ago, she started up her own grocery store business with her savings where she sells grocery products such as: bread, butter, condiments, sweets, chips, spice mixes, sugar, rice, soap, flour, corn, beans, etc.  In the evenings, she also sells fast food such as fried chicken with plantains, tacos and baleadas (wheat tortillas filled with beans and cheese) to get some extra income.  

Denia is now requesting a loan for 10,000 Honduran lempiras to capitalize her business so that she can stock it with the food products she lacks, and also offer a greater variety of products to her customers.  Her plan is to continue to grow her business so that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to stock up her business with staple consumer products such as: corn, beans, rice, butter, flour, bread, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Felis

texts.en:
Felis has been involved in a business of direct selling for seven years. She is 23 years old, single, and lives in a house that she rents.
Felis sells charcoal at a retail store near the place where she lives. She is requesting additional working capital of 30,000 KES, which will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She is doing this as she has many orders and wants to ensure continuous growth of her direct selling business. She is hoping that her sacrifices and wise management will lead her to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam  is a 50-year-old married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 8 years to 26 years. She describes herself to be hard-working. She operates a lorry where she provides transportation services to customers. Her business is located in a high potential business area and her primary customers are the general public such as wholesale owners, pharmacists, etc. 

Mariam describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy lorry spare parts. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will cater for her family financial needs. Previously, Mariam took a loan of Kes 600,000 which she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy lorry spare parts

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary  is a 44 year old married woman. She has 3 children, and describes herself as caring and warm. She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, maize flour, steel wire, etc. Her business is located in what could become an area with many businesses, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. Rosemary will use her KES 31,200 loan to purchase a water tank which will be used by her five family members. She expects to complete installing it two weeks after delivery. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. She managed to pay a previous loan of KES 850,000 successfully. Her business goal is to improve her business  within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is a 4- year-old resident of Gango, Ozamis City. She provides for her 3 children's needs from the little amount of PHP 6,000 she gains monthly from her transportation service business. She has been in this business for 7 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. This year she's become a member of GDMPC, and she has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan at GDMPC micro finance to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: Paulita is from Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Paulita is married and has 4 children. Paulita plants, harvests, and sells corn for their living. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Paulita joined GDMPC. Paulita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Pequeños Empresarios Group

texts.es:
El es Juan, uno de los miembros de la alcancía Pequeños Empresarios
Juan tiene 28 años está casado y tiene un hijo pequeño de 04 años, actualmente vive con su familia en casa de su suegra. Juan tiene una moto taxi y trabaja brindando  transporte público, su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque  le dedica todos los días de la semana, para lograr otros ingresos  está incursionando en la venta de repuestos para motos y entre sus compañeros ya ha logrado captar algunos clientes que le hacen pedidos de diferentes accesorios y repuestos para moto taxi. Juan quiere darle estabilidad a su familia y para eso le gustaría tener un negocio más sólido, con el préstamo que ha solicitado podrá comprar más repuestos para su negocio, en el futuro desea abrir una tienda para dedicarse a este rubro. Juan está agradecido a todos los inversionistas por su préstamo, porque le ayuda a cumplir todos sus sueños.
Juan aparece en la foto vestido con casaca negra es el tercero de la izquierda.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the Pequeños Empresarios (Smallbusiness Owners) group. He is 28 years old, married, and has a 4-year old son. Currently he and his family live with his mother-in-law.
Juan owns a motorbike taxi and offers a taxi service. His work is hard as he works seven days a week. In order to earn more money he has gone into the motorbike spare parts business and has already had orders from his friends for various accessories and parts.

As Juan wishes to provide his family with more stability, he would like to put his business on a more solid footing. With the loan he is seeking he will be able to buy more spares. In the future he wants to open a store selling parts. He is grateful to the donors for this loan because it will help him realize his dreams.

In the photo Juan is wearing a black jacket and is third from the left.

loans.use: Buy spare parts

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en: Sarmila is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child, age 11.  In 2000, she established her business of making religious statutes.  Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW.  Sarmila used her most recent loan to buys raw materials for her business.  In the future, Sarmila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity.  Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills.  Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing.  In Patan, the Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or carved in stone.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume.  This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing their profit margin.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is married with 5 children. Susan is 51 years old and lives in Ciriaco Pastrano, Oroquieta City. To earn a living, Susan buys and sells junk materials as her business. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately 1,500 PHP. Susan has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Susan hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to add capital to her business

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 35 years old, married, and has two children she is sending to school. Her children are in the elementary level of education. Selina manages a clothing business in the market. She usually sells a variety of garments. Selina's priority in life is to uplift their living conditions and give a better life to her family. No matter how hard it is to work, she will strive to make her priority a reality.

She is asking for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy baby dresses, jackets, and casual attire to sell in the market. She hopes to improve her business and earn income to cover their needs.

loans.use: to buy baby dresses, jackets, and casual attire to sell in the market

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en: Mariza is married and has two children. She is 28 years old and resides at Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City, Philippines. Mariza runs a charcoal making business to earn a living, and she's been in this business 5 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to pay for the labor cost in charcoal making. In 2009, Mariza joined GDMPC. In the future, Mariza wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost in charcoal making

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth  tiene 38 años tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, se dedica a la venta de artículos del hogar como frazadas, edredones, ollas y otros a crédito y al contado, ella vive en la zona de Minasa, ella entrega sus productos a crédito de manera mensual y quincenal entregando a domicilios y también visita  mercados donde tiene mucha clientela este préstamo es el primero que ha tomado con la institución, la Sra. Elizabeth va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio, debido a que en fin de año los productos suben y ella desea abastecerse de mercadería, ya que también sus ventas se incrementan, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo por lo cual la cliente se animo a solicitar el crédito, la Sra. Elizabeth enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la venta de artículos varios a crédito se ha incrementado estos últimos años, por lo cual la competencia es su mayor reto y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de ropa nueva, ollas de presión, frazadas, edredones, y otros artículos de fin de año,  su deseo  es quiere terminar de construir su vivienda, ya que actualmente vive en la casa de su padre.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old and has three school-age children. She sells household items such as blankets, quilts, pots among other items on credit and in cash. She lives in the Minasa area. She delivers her goods on credit, monthly and biweekly, to homes as well as markets where she has many customers. This is her first loan that she has taken with the institution. Elizabeth will use this loan to purchase merchandise for her business because products increase at the end of the year and she wants to stock up on merchandise, as her sales also increase.

Her reason for requesting this loan is lack of cash so she was encouraged to apply for the loan. Elizabeth faces challenges in her business which is the sale of various items sold on credit has increased in recent years so competition is her biggest challenge and she will use profits to purchase new clothes, pressure cookers, blankets, quilts and other year-end items. Her wish is to finish building her home as she is now living in her parents’ home.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing merchandise for her business due to year-end sales increase.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Los Olivos Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Patricio es uno de los miembros del grupo solidario los olivos 
El Sr. Patricio tiene 53 años, vive con su esposa y sus 03 hijas. El trabaja brindando servicio de transporte público con una moto taxi, medio de transporte muy usado en el país, fue gracias a su hermano que aprendió a trabajar en este oficio. Patricio empezó alquilando una moto taxi pero al tener que pagar el alquiler, era poco lo que percibía por su trabajo; ahorrando poco a poco logro comprarse su propia moto, ahora que es propietario sus ingresos han mejorado. El trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano hasta muy tarde, con el único fin de sustentar a su familia y darle lo mejor. Patricio ha solicitado su préstamo para reparar su moto y darle mantenimiento para así poder trabajar con tranquilidad, en el futuro le gustaría comprarse otra moto y terminar la construcción de su casa para tranquilidad de su familia.
Patricio aparece en la foto con chaleco color rojo y azul.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!

Patricio is one of the members of the group Solidario Los Olivos.  Mr. Patricio is 53 years old, lives with his wife and three daughters.  

He works providing public taxi services on his motorcycle, a popular means of transportation in this country.  He learned this trade thanks to his brother.  He started by renting a motorcycle, but after paying for the rental there was too little left for him for his job.  Saving little by little, he was able to buy his own motorcycle.  Now that he owns it, his income has improved.  

He works everyday from very early on until very late with the only goal of providing for his family and giving them the best.  

Patricio has asked for a loan to repair his motorcycle and to do maintenance in order to continue his work without worry.  In the future, he would like to buy another motorcycle and finish building his house for his family’s peace of mind.  

Patricio appears in the picture wearing a red and blue vest.

loans.use: to perform repair and maintenance to his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electronic gadgets to expand her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Hasbaatar

texts.en: Hasbaatar is 44 years old. He lives with his wife and two sons in a ger in the Uvs Province of Mongolia. His wife Otgonjargal works at a local secondary school as a guard. His two sons, Enhbat and Enhtuvshin, ages 21 and 17, are both university students. He has been working in the business of recyclable waste purchasing and sales since 2008. He has obtained a lot of experience in recyclable waste purchasing and sales, and now he is planning to open his own business. He is requesting 1,600,000 MNT to purchase recyclable waste from local retailers, which he will then sell to recycle manufacturing companies at a higher price. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase recyclable waste from local retailers to resell to recycle manufacturing companies.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 37 years old, married and has four children. For the last 14 years, she has earned a living by raising livestock. She is very hardworking because she has to support her family and also supply milk to her customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save money. In the future, she hopes to be a dairy farmer and have many cows. She is requesting a loan for 20,857.50 KES to buy animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Rhine Sheila

texts.en: Rhine Sheila is 23 years old, single and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She earns a living by providing transportation services. She went into this line of work almost two years ago and now earns PHP 5,200 a month. To improve her business, Rhine Sheila is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to buy accessories and tires. She joined GDMPC earlier this year and hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy accessories and tires for her transportation business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 31-year-old farmer in Kitale, Kenya, where he lives with his wife and two children who are both in school. He has been farming for the past ten years, producing maize, sugarcane, tomatoes, vegetables, and milk, which he sells at the local market in his area.
He is requesting a 52,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and to insure a dairy cow from which he will sell milk to earn extra income that will help him to improve his living standards and to pay school fees. He hopes to have six dairy cows within the next five years.
Poor road networks and poor prices for produce are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to buy and to insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex, a 37-year-old married father of seven, lives in Masindi, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after his children rests solely with him, and his desire is to see them graduate with degrees as minimum qualifications.

For the past seven years Alex has been operating a bakery producing cakes and bread. His business is located in a rural area, so he enjoys a monopoly of customers, the majority of whom are students and neighbours. His challenge is inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand, while his dreams are a modern bakery and expansion into town centres. Alex intends to use this loan to buy more baking materials.

loans.use: to buy more baking materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 47 years old, married and has two children. She repaid her previous loan successfully because her business did very well. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling maize and fruit. She is very hardworking and also humble, and Faulu Kenya has taught her how to save and  increase her profits. Someday she hopes to own a cereal shop. She is requesting a loan for 21,363.75 KES to buy maize, onions and bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy maize, onions and bananas

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen Elena de 62 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijas en las edades de  43 y 29 años. Ella en un espacio de su vivienda, ubicó una tienda, en la que vende en pequeñas proporciones,  los bienes de consumo diario, a  las familias de la comunidad, de acuerdo a sus capacidades de compra. Su iniciativa de negocio nació en el año 1999, aunque tenia experiencia en tiendas desde el 1972, por eso ella comenzó poco a poco, pero con paso firme; primero compró un enfriador, luego agregó arroz, aceite, azúcar y finalmente carnes, lácteos y refrescos. Hoy en su negocio le va bien, vende diariamente desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y unas veces de contado y otras a crédito, pues tiene una cartera de clientes que ya conoce y les financia sus compras diarias, para que le paguen semanalmente. Sus clientes están ubicados en el barrio donde habita y en sus alrededores, pues ellos saben que en su tienda,  encuentran todo cuanto necesitan; últimamente su clientela ha aumentado y su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para responder a la demanda, porque la rotación es muy rápida y necesita estar haciendo pedidos continuos, que atrasan su tarea de ventas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará   productos lácteos, y embutidos, además de una vitrina para mejorar la presentación en sus instalaciones. Con su credikiva, hará esta inversión y logrará mejorar su surtido e incrementar sus ventas diarias, porque estas se crecen en las navidades y época de fin de año, haciendo que la inversión de un crédito sea muy efectiva.
texts.en: Carmen Elena, who is 62 years old, lives in the town of Soledad with her husband. They have two daughters, ages 43 and 29. She located a store in a space in her home. There she sells products for daily use, in small quantities, to the families of her community, in accordance with her capacity to make purchases. Her business initiative began in the year 1999, even though she had experience in stores since 1972. For this reason she began little by little, but with firm steps. First she bought a refrigerator, then she added rice, oil, sugar, and finally meat, dairy products, and soft drinks. Now her business is going well for her. Every day she sells from 5 in the morning until 9 at night, sometimes for cash and sometimes on credit, since she has a customer base whom she knows, and she finances their daily purchases, because they pay her weekly. Her customers are from the neighborhood where she lives and its surroundings, since they know that in her store they will find everything they need. Recently her customers have increased, and her working capital has become insufficient to meet their demand, because the turnover is very rapid and she constantly needs to be placing orders, which gets her behind in her sales tasks. This is why she is turning to a Kiva loan, with which she will buy milk products and sausages, in addition to a display case to improve the appearance of her business premises. With a Kiva loan, she will make this investment and will succeed in improving her stock and increasing her daily sales, because they grow during the Christmas and New Year's seasons, making the investment of a loan very effective.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, sausages, and also a display case.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 33 years old and a business man. He is married to Stella, who is employed as a secretary in a law firm. They are blessed with two children. James has been selling second-hand cars as a primary business and besides this he also has been selling charcoal for the past three years, with a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. James will use the loan to buy more stock of charcoal for sale. With the anticipated profit from his business, he will buy a piece of land and develop it.

His hopes and dreams are to give his two sons the best education and to buy a large farm.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for a motorcycle repairing business.

loans.name: Ely Louis

texts.en: Ely Louis is 27 years old and single. He lives in the village of Tinacla-an in the municipality of Clarin. Ely Louis operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 3 years, and every month he earns 5,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Ely Louis has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Ely Louis hopes to double his income from this business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is 49 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children. Tessie is engaged in a manicure and pedicure business and earns approximately PHP2,000 each month. She has requested a loan to purchase additional manicure and pedicure sets for her existing business. Tessie has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Tessie hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase additional manicure and pedicure sets.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 28-year-old hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. Three years ago he ventured into the transport business and also rears cattle for a living. With the proceeds, he has been able to buy more land for grazing and increase his herd. 

Prolonged drought is his major challenge, since he does not have alternative water sources other than the wells. He dreams of owning a ranch and buying a bus. 

David is requesting a loan to buy cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy cows for rearing.

loans.name: Sara Sylvia

texts.es: Doña Sara tiene 59 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos y vive en el municipio de Omoa, Cortes junto a su esposo. Ella es una señora muy emprendedora, siempre busca como ayudar al hogar para la manutención de su familia. Anteriormente se dedicaba al lavado de ropa a mano a domicilio, luego comenzó a elaborar pastelitos de maíz rellenos con carne que hasta la vez realiza para vender. Y hace tres años estableció una pequeña pulpería donde vende verduras, frutas, churros, refrescos, dulces, granos básicos, agua en bolsa, pan, condimentos y otros. Doña Sara ha decidido solicitar un préstamo a ODEF por 4,500 Lempiras para comprar más productos como refrescos, pan, churros, verduras y granos básicos. Este préstamo le ayudara a mantener activo su negocio y a incrementar las ventas. Doña Sara tiene todo el deseo de seguir trabajando duro con su negocio para lograr ahorrar para su vejez.
texts.en:
Sara, 59, is married and has five children; she lives in the municipality of Omoa, Cortes, with her husband.  She’s a very enterprising woman who is always looking for ways to help her home and support her family.  She used to work hand washing clothes in homes and then started to make little corn cakes filled with meat to sell.    Three years ago she started a small grocery store where she sells vegetables, fruit, snacks, soft-drinks, candy, basic grains, bags of water, bread, condiments and others.

Sara has decided to ask ODEF for a 4,500 Lempira loan to buy more products like soft-drinks, bread, snacks, vegetables and basic grains.  This loan will help her keep her business active to increase sales.  Sara wants to continue working hard in order to save up for her old-age.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy organic manure to use as mulch for her banana plants.

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Mrs.Tsevelmaa is 49 years old and lives with her husband in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband, Bayarsaihan, 51, helps her to run her business of organic vegetable sales. Her three children are married and have moved out of their parents’ house and live in different provinces. 

Since 2005, she has been renting a rental stall in the local market to manage an organic vegetable sales business. She has built a closer relationship with suppliers and customers. She is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables to sell during winter and spring. 

She is a polite, hardworking and communicative person.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables to sell during winter and spring.

loans.name: Mkalla

texts.en:
Mkalla is a hardworking, enterprising person who wants to move forward day by day for the well-being of his children and his wife. He and his family live in Tiribe in Coast Province.

Mkalla has a grocery store, selling a variety of household items. He will use the loan he has applied for now to buy products for his store such as salt, flour, cooking fat, sugar and rice, as well as soft drinks and snacks.

This is to give good service to the customer, and so that his store will be well known in the area. This investment will help Mkalla to get new customers and a good income, which will help him to support his family's household expenses.

loans.use: to buy products for his store such as salt, flour, cooking fat, sugar and rice, as well as soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Mrs. Juanita is from the town of Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor. She is 44 years old, married and blessed with five school-age children.   

She operates a business, selling food products to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately Php 1,500 a month.  

Juanita has taken out a loan from PMPC in the amount of Php 3,000 to purchase additional ingredients for her food products. She will use the profit to sustain their basic needs and to have more savings for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food products.

loans.name: Manolo

texts.en:
Manolo, 25, is single and from Maningcol, Ozamis City. He offers a private transport service business. It has operated for almost three years now, and he earns PHP 8,500 a month. 

To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC Microcredit to buy accessories and tires. He joined GDMPC Microcredit in 2010.

He’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to buy accessories and tires.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Forty two year old Luvuno is a hardworking person and a responsible mother. She lives with one of her family in her own home. 

Luvuno has a stall where she sells fish. Her business is in the municipal market in her neighborhood, which is a very good strategic spot for any business. Luvuno works from Monday to Sunday, and she has many dedicated customers who prefer her because she is friendly and her prices are fair. 

Luvuno is asking Yehu for a loan to buy more fish to sell. This way she is sure to have increased income.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a thirty-five-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been an artist and has been in service for four years. His love for art inspired him to be in service and his dream is to upgrade his studies as he targets to have an art gallery. Emmanuel's clients are tourists. Limited labour is his challenge.

He hopes to sucessfully educate his family. Emmanuel intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay schoolfees for his children.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is 28 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 2 children. 

Rene has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products; he earns approximately PHP1,500.00 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to purchase groceries and other consumable products for sale and retail.

This year, Rene became a member of PMPC. In the future, Rene hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and other consumable products to resell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 40 years old and lives in Carmen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Margarita has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products;  she earns approximately PHP1,000.00 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase groceries and other consumable products to resell at her existing business.

Margarita has been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year. In the future, Margarita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and other consumable products to resell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old, married and has two children who are both in school. 

She is a tailor who has been in business for three years. She also practices farming to earn a living. She is very responsible and hardworking, as she has to pay school fees for her children and provide quality services to her customers.

She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. She needs a loan of 20,857.50 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the flower garden.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is 60 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one child.  

Raul is engaged in fishing activity and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work.  He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional fishing nets for his existing business. 

Raul became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индире 33 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. По словам матери, старшый сын Индиры учится в 5 классе, он очень серьезный и умный. Дочь и сын скоро пойдут в школу, но они не такие как их брат, они любят баловаться и шуметь.  Индира в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается торговлей продуктами питания. Благодаря упорному труду Индире, ее деятельность позволяет приносить около 20,000 сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Учитывая особую приветливость хозяйки и хороший ассортимент товаров, Индира имеет большое количество посещающих ее магазин клиентов, что потребовало участия всей ее семьи в бизнесе. Кроме магазина у семьи Индиры имеется общественная баня. Что в свою очередь приносить дополнительные 10,000 KGS в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Индира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара оборота в магазине и расширение общественной бани. Доходы от кредита Индира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы в перспективе построить большой дом для своей семьи, сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Indira is 33 years old, married, and has three children. According to the mother, the elder son is studying in the fifth class. He is very serious and clever. Her daughter and second son will soon go to school, but they are not like their brother and they love to play around and make noise. 

As income for the family, Indira engages in the food trade. Thanks to her hard work, Indira's activities can bring in about 20,000 som per month, which covers the basic costs of food and household needs for the family. Given the special friendliness of the shop owner and a good assortment of products, Indira has many customers visiting her store, which requires the participation of her whole family in the business. 

In addition to the store, Indira also has a public bath which in turn generates an additional 10,000 KGS per month. 

In order to further develop her business, Indira appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 90,000 som (KGS) to increase her inventory at the store and the expansion of the bath. Indira will use income from the loan to invest in a further increase in her business and in the long term to build a big house for her family and a barn for livestock.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for sale

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, married, and has two adult and two school-aged children. Saturnina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling home products. She has been engaged in her business for eleven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In July 2009, Saturnina joined PMPC. Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store and to buy coconut shelves to sell.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shelves and additional products for sari-sari store

loans.name: Uzziah

texts.en:
Uzziah is a 37-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling shoes for ten years and works eight hours a day located in the market. He has rentals to generate additional income and began this business to diversify his earnings. 

He hopes to educate his children. However, competition is his challenge. Uzziah is an honest and hardworking man whose dream is to diversify his business to include agriculture. Uzziah intends to use the loan money to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
To support the daily necessities of the family, Chari’s husband is employed in a private company in the city of Mombasa. Chari owns a motorcycle, and she has hired a person to operate it. It is a business that has given her good results. 

Chari believes that patience and hard work are needed in operating a business, but financial support is most important. Now, Chari is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase spare parts for and perform general servicing on the motorcycle taxi. She came up with the business because she wanted to help her husband generate extra income to support their children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for and perform general servicing on the motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria de 48 años, vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su hija de 20 años de edad, con quien sueña ver convertida en una profesional de éxito y es el motor que la impulsa en su día a día. Gregoria genera ingresos que benefician su hogar, a través de un negocio mediante el cual prepara y vende diariamente,  jugos naturales, refrescos, dulcería,  productos fritos y además vende mercancía variada,  como útiles de aseo personal, jabones, cremas, desechables, toallas, manteles etc,. Sus ventas las realiza  de contado, trabajando durante todos los días de la semana y sus clientes son principalmente tenderos y habitantes del barrio donde habita. Aumentar las ventas en esta temporada de fiestas que se acerca, a finales del año, se ha convertido en todo un desafío, porque su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para aumentar el inventario y con ello generar más utilidades, aprovechando la época. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará productos de aseo personal, como cremas dentales,  e insumos, para prepara sancochos y derivados de la harina de trigo, como arepas empanadas etc. Con esta inversión planea aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores utilidades, que las que usualmente obtiene en cualquier otra época del año, pues su mercado son las tiendas y trabajadores y pacientes del hospital cercano, además de sus vecinos del barrio que les gusta los productos que Gregoria  vende y le compran permanentemente.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 48, lives in the south of the city with her partner and her 20-year-old daughter. She hopes to see her daughter become a successful professional and this is what pushed her forward in her day to day life. Gregoria earns money for her household through a business in which she prepares and sells natural juices, soft drinks, candy, and fried foods. She also sells a variety of merchandise, like personal hygiene products, soaps, creams, disposable products, towels, tablecloths, etc. She sells for cash, working every day of the week. Her customers are mainly shopkeepers and residents of the neighborhood where she lives. Increasing her sales in the upcoming holiday season at the end of the year is proving to be a challenge. She doesn't have enough working capital to increase her inventory and earn more income, taking advantage of the season.

This is why she is resorting to a Kiva loan, with which she will buy personal hygiene products, like toothpaste, and ingredients to make sancochos (a traditional stew) and foods made with wheat flour, like arepas and empanadas, etc. With this investment, she plans to expend her sales and make more money than she usually makes at other times during the year. Her markets are the stores, workers, and patients in a nearby hospital. This is in addition to her neighbors, who like the products that Gregoria sells and buy them consistently.

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products like toothpaste, and ingredients to make sancochos and wheat flour products.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ru: Фатима 37 лет, воспитывает троих детей двух девочек и одного сына.Фатима вдова, муж Фатимы скоропостижно скончался. Они начинали свой бизнес с мужем, после его смерти она осталась с детьми одна со всеми житейскими проблемами.Местная администрация выплачивает пособие, так как она мать одиночка, в сумме 3,500 KGS. Несмотря на все проблемы она остается все такой же жизнерадостной и веселой. Она твердо уверена в светлое будущее своей семьи.  Фатима в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи занимается животноводством. Начатое 10 лет назад они с мужем купили 1 корову за 8,000 сом (KGS) на сегодняшний день у неё в хозяйстве  имеется  2 дойные коровы и 1 лошадь. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Фатима обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и 5 голов овец. Доходы Фатима планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйство и хотела бы приобрести мебель для дома.
texts.en:
Fatima is a 37-year-old widow, raising three children, two girls and a son. Fatima's husband died suddenly. They started their own business together, but after his death she was left alone with the children with all of life's problems. The local administration paid benefits for a single mother of 3,500 KGS. 

Despite all the problems, she remains cheerful and upbeat. She firmly believes in the bright future of her family. 

As the main source of the family's income, Fatima engages in raising livestock. Begun ten years ago, she and her husband bought a cow for 8,000 som (KGS) and today on her homestead she has two dairy cows and a horse. Her monthly income from the homestead is about 6,000 som (KGS). 

With the goal of developing her business, Fatima appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow and five sheep. Fatima plans to use the income to further expand her homestead and would like to buy furniture for the home.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and sheep

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is a 46-year-old businesswoman who owns a grocery store. She used her previous loan to buy chickens, and she was successful in repaying her loan as her business did well. She also earns an income by rearing goats and keeping poultry. 

Eddah has learned how to keep records and save her money since she joined Faulu Kenya. Someday she hopes to own a supermarket. She needs a loan of 105,300 KES to buy sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her grocery store.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
This is Minerva, 62, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, a laborer, and she is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Minerva maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer (Minerva), and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than the retail prices in the catalogues, and this difference in the prices makes up the profits that dealers count on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise, like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products her customers have ordered. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Minerva hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams that her youngest child will finish college. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay cash for additional merchandise, like powder, undergarments and lotion, which she will resell to customers on credit.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 53 years old and married. She has four children. She has been in business for 38 years and also earns income through farming and from rental houses that she owns. She is very friendly and hardworking, and thanks to Faulu Kenya she has learned how to save her money and to make new friends.
Someday, she hopes to be the main supplier of groceries within her area and to be able to raise pigs. She requires a loan of 53,156 KES to buy one bag of potatoes, ten crates of tomatoes, and two pigs.

loans.use: to buy one bag of potatoes, ten crates of tomatoes, and two pigs.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is married and has seven children. She is 49 years old and lives in Pobalcion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Lerma buys and resells ready-to-wear clothing to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP for additional capital.

Lerma has been a member of PMPC since this year, 2012. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing resell.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 45-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children, all of whom are able to attend school.

Ismail operates a bar, which is located on a busy street. He started the business seven years ago so as to meet the increasing demands of his family's basic needs. His dream is to own a hotel and to educate his children, despite the business challenge of price fluctuations. Ismail is requesting a loan to buy a pool table for his bar to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a pool table for his bar to attract more customers.

loans.name: Imelida

texts.en: Imelida is requesting a new loan to expand her business. Thanks to her hard work and determination, she has been able to educate her children. She says that she wants to take advantage of the forth-coming festive season and she currently has many orders to fulfill. Imelida is asking for this loan to buy more fabrics, threads, laces, and other materials necessary for her tailoring business.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics, threads, laces, and other materials necessary for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Susana's Group

texts.en:
Susana is 53 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has eight children.

Susana has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase groceries and other consumable products for her existing business.

Susana has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. Susana is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing groceries and other consumable products for her store.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 41 years old, happily married with two kids and presently residing at Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Marlyn runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) and has engaged in this business for eight years. She earns PHP 10,000 every month that supports her family's needs. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store.

Marlyn is a new PMPC member and aims to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 54 years old and married.  She does dairy and crop farming to earn a living. She has been in the business since 1990. She has managed to grow her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. She has expanded her farm and even added dairy cows.

Margaret hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  She has requested a loan of 84,442 KES to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Mischelle

texts.en:
Mischelle is 35 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children.
 
Mischelle is engaged in an eatery business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional meat and ingredients for her existing eatery.
 
Mischelle has become a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Mischelle hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional meat and ingredients

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and lives in Tawi-Tawi, Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Gina has a sari-sari store that sells a variety of products like soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candy, and many other items. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 14,900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy additional inventory for sale.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Gina hopes to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Adtrid

texts.es: Astrid es una mujer de 37 años de edad, que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, ella es madre comunitaria, es decir forma parte de un programa del gobierno colombiano, en el cual asignan niños en la primera infancia para que en su vivienda sean cuidados y alimentados mientras sus padres, que son sus vecinos trabajan. Astrid en esta actividad comunitaria, ha logrado conocer a muchas personas y se han convertido en sus principales clientes de su negocio, de venta de productos de tocador que distribuye a crédito. Este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, hace mas de 14 años, pues ella se dedicaba a la venta de mercancía variada y la enseñó a seleccionar a sus compradores de productos a créditos, a recuperar las cuentas por cobrar y también sus padres le dieron un capital para que trabajara. Así fue como empezó,  y hoy es un negocio que le ofrece ingresos con los que apoya el sustento e su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 6 a 15 años. Su meta es multiplicar sus ventas y esta es uno de sus mayores desafíos, porque no cuenta con el suficiente capital de trabajo, para rápidamente incrementarlas, especialmente en la época de fin de año, en la cual todo lo que ofrece lo vende. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará talcos, colonias, shampoo, cremas y productos capilares, pues su propósito  más importante,  es lograr ampliar su mercado y esto es justamente lo que gradualmente logrará, con créditos bien aplicados a su negocio.
texts.en:
Astrid, 37, lives in the city of Barranquilla.  She’s a communal mother, that is, she participates in a program of the Colombian government by which pre-school age children are assigned to her and to her home so that she can care for them and feed them while their parents who are her neighbors work.  

By means of this community work, Astrid has met many people who have become her main customers in her business selling beauty products on credit.  She learned this business from her mother more than 14 years ago since she worked selling assorted merchandise and taught her how to choose her beauty products credit customers, how to collect her accounts receivable and her parents also gave her initial capital to work with.  This is how she started and today it’s a business that generates income she can support her home consisting of her spouse and three children aged between 6 and 15 with.

Her goal is to multiply her sales and this is one of her greatest challenges because she does not have sufficient working capital to quickly increase them, especially during this end-of-year season when she’s able to sell out everything she stocks.  This is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan to buy talc, cologne, shampoo, creams and hair products because her greatest goal is to expand her market; she will gradually accomplish this with well-applied business loans.

loans.use: to buy talc, cologne, shampoo, creams and hair products.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Зулфия занимается шитьем платьев и занавесок на заказ. Она портниха. В этой области Зулфия уже два года. Она берет кредит для покупки хорошей швейной машинки.
Зулфия жительница района Пяндж. Ей 21 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей.
texts.en:
Zulfiya engages in sewing dresses and curtains to order. She is a seamstress. Zulfiya has two years experience in this area. 

She is taking a loan to buy a good sewing machine. 

Zulfiya is a resident of the Pyandj region. She is 21 years old, married, and has three children.

loans.use: to buy a good sewing machine

loans.name: Khatichamo

texts.ru: Хатичамо проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее 8 детей. Хатичамо живет вместе с мужем и сыном. Ее муж пенсионер, сын занимается своим бизнесом. Сама Хатичамо печет лепешки для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Хатичамо берет кредит с целью создания условий для продвижения своей деятельности и для покупки муки.
texts.en:
Khatichamo lives in the J. Rumy region. She is 41 years old, married, and has eight children. Khatichamo lives with her husband and son. 

Her husband is retired and her son has his own business. For her part, Khatichamo bakes flatbreads for sale. She has been engaged in this work for five years. 

Khatichamo is taking a loan with the goal of creating beneficial conditions for her activities and to buy flour.

loans.use: to create conditions beneficial to her activities and to buy flour

loans.name: Parda

texts.ru: Парда житель города Истаравшан. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Парда занимается животноводством. В этом ему помогает жена и дочь. Он в основном разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. У него дома построен коровник. Парда берет кредит для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en:
Parda is a resident of the town of Istaravshan. He is 49 years old, married, and has two children. 

Parda raises livestock. His wife and daughter help him with this work. He basically raises cattle near their home. His home has a constructed barn. Parda is taking a loan to buy a few head of cattle.

loans.use: to buy a few calves

loans.name: Roman

texts.ru:
Роман торгует на рынке запасными частями для автомобилей и мотоциклов. Предыдущий кредит он использовал для закупки партии запчастей к автомобилям российского производства. 

На этот раз кредит понадобился для закупки партии подшипников и автомобильной оптики (фары, лампы). Эти два вида запчастей являются наиболее ходовыми и требуют постоянного пополнения товара.

Роман торгует уже более 10 лет. У него много постоянных покупателей и низкие цены, что дает ему конкурентное преимущество и успех в бизнесе. Роман женат, имеет одного сына, который также увлекается автомобилями и в свободное время помогает отцу на рынке.
texts.en:
Roman is a market trader of spare parts for cars and motorcycles. He used his previous loan to buy a load of spare parts for cars of Russian make.  

This time the loan is needed to purchase a batch of bearings and automotive optics (lights, lamps). He runs through these two types of parts the most quickly and requires constant replenishment. 

Roman has been trading for more than ten years. He has many regular customers and low prices, which gives him a competitive advantage and business success. 

Roman is married and has one son, who is also interested in cars and in his spare time helps his father in the market.

loans.use: to buy a batch of car parts -- bearings, lights, lamps, etc.

loans.name: Marya

texts.ru: Мария торгует на рынке. Она продает шапки, сумки, кофты, юбки, свитера и другую одежду. Мария - ответственная и пунктуальная. Она уже пользовалась бизнес кредитами и выплачивала все вовремя. Торговое место Марии удачно расположенно, поэтому клиентов много и бизнес идет хорошо. Мария просит предоставить кредит для закупки зимнего ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Mariya is a market retailer. She sells hats, bags, jackets, skirts, sweaters, and other clothing. Mariya is responsible and punctual. She has already used a business loan and repaid it on time. 

Mariya's retail space is well located, so has many customers and the business is going well. 

Mariya asked for a loan to buy an assortment of winter goods.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of winter goods

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is 30-year-old business man who owns a photo and video studio. He is very hardworking and has been in business for five years. He also farms to earn a living. He wishes to expand his business and open up another studio. He requires a loan of KES84,442.50 to buy a printer.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pool table for business purposes.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 64 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. Fe has a store where she sells groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately PHP3,000 each month from her business. She has requested a loan to purchase groceries and other consumable products for resale. Fe has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Fe hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and other consumable products for resale.

loans.name: Lorrilie

texts.en:
Lorrilie is 34 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children.
 
Lorrilie is engaged in operating a barber shop business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional barber chairs, scissors, hair calipers and other tools, for her existing barber shop business.
 
Lorrilie has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years. Lorrilie hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional barber chairs, scissors, hair calipers, and other tools of the trade.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is a 26-year-old man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His main business is to rent his land to cattle keepers for their herds to graze on after paying him some money. He started the business after realizing the overwhelming requests of pastoralists to graze on his land due its good pastures. 

Rogers also grows crops. Unpredictable weather changes and inadequate labour hinders his business. Rogers is requesting for a loan to pay workers to harvest his crops.

loans.use: to pay workers to harvest his crops

loans.name: Fita

texts.en:
Fita is 35 years old and lives in San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children.

Fita is engaged in lumber cutting and sales and she earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to  pay for trees, labor, and other expenses in her lumber-cutting business. 

Fita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for trees, labor, and other expenses in her lumber-cutting business.

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is very clever and hard-working. He is 18 years old. He is not married and lives with parents. 

Naimjon graduated from high school with excellent marks and entered the Technical University of Tajikistan in the technology branch. He is one of the best students in the university and tries to help other students. His friends love him very much and know that Naimjon is truthful with them. Naimjon enjoys reading classical literature in his free time. He also likes to play football with his friends.
