In the future, Naimjon wants to be a good specialist and to work in any organization. He must to pay for his tuition, but his parent’s income is not enough to cover it. He is asking for a loan to pay for his education and you are the only one who can support him. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 32 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children.

Madelyn has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for almost four years. She requested a loan to purchase additional groceries for resale.

Madelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries for resale

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, 42, resident of Tondo, Philippines. She is married to Ralph, a delivery man, and she is a mother. Marivic manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marivic maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products from popular direct-selling brands such as Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalog, and this is how dealers earn a profit and make an income. She also has a Direct Selling business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 45,000. She will be use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise including shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Marivic hopes to have her own house and lot and dreams of giving a better life to her family. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members each week to share stories of her work and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and who has many goals she wants to achieve. She wants to earn herself a more prosperous future, and she will work until she achieves the success she wants so dearly. She is taking out a new loan to expand on her cereal selling business, which has been flourishing thanks for her determination and the previous loan that contributed to this growth. 

Faida's business demand has gone up in the past few weeks and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment. This is why she is applying for another loan with Yehu to buy more cereals to re-sell. She is very happy with the help she has been offered and she assures that she will repay her debt just as she did the previous one. She is confident that she will give her family a full life.

loans.use: To purchase stock of maize, beans, rice, and green peas for her business.

loans.name: Monhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Monhbat is 21 years old and lives with his mother and sister in Ger in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His mother is a pensioner and stays home. His sister works at a private company. He has been working as an assistant for his brother's business of coal and firewood sales since 2008, right after he graduated from his secondary school. 

Now Monhbat is planning to start his own business of coal and firewood sales with his mini-truck which he bought using his salary from his brother's business. He needs additional investment of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase coal and firewood from a coal mine at a cheaper price in order to sell it to Ulaanbaatar customers to higher price. He is hardworking and diligent person.

loans.use: to purchase coal and firewood from a coal mine at a cheaper price in order to sell it to Ulaanbaatar customers to higher price

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Nora is engaged in a meat and chicken vending business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional kilos of meat and dressed chicken for sale or retail. 

Nora has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Nora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional kilos of meat and dressed chicken

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 31-year-old married man who has been working in the wood business for 19 years. In September 2009, he started working in his present factory. 

Mahmoud is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy wood. This is his third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower and he is very happy with this experience. With the requested loan, Mahmoud is going to buy wood necessary to increase his production, especially in order to be able to take a big project for which he was waiting.

Mahmoud hopes to keep on improving and developing his business, to make sure that one day he will be capable of buying his own shop, and to increase his number of working machines.

loans.use: To buy wood necessary to increase his production

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 44 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 

Leonida is engaged in snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional snacks for sale. 

Leonida has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years. In the future, Leonida hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional snacks for sale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 60 years old and married. She has eight children. She presently resides in the village of Cangmohao in the municipality of Siquijor in Siquijor Province.
She has recently engaged in the business of fishing and is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fishing net materials.
In the future, she hopes to expand her business for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a responsible and hardworking mother, well-known for the efforts she puts into providing a better life for her children. She sells clothing door to door, a business she commends for the good results it has given her.

Mary is seeking another loan to purchase a larger amount of fashionable clothing. This will lead to an increase in sales, and the extra money she earns will be of great benefit to her family, the main reason she wishes to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase larger amounts of fashionable clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña María Elena, tiene 55 años de edad, casada, tiene 6 hijos y vive con el esposo y dos de sus hijos en Cuyamel, Cortes. Doña María Elena tiene 12 años de tener su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, vende granos básicos, refrescos, churros, dulces, condimentos, aceite, verduras, pan, etc. además ella ocasionalmente realiza actividades de destazo de reses(vacas) lo que le genera otros ingresos. Su negocio se ha mantenido por la inversión de varios préstamos obtenidos. Actualmente solicita el tercer préstamo que es por la cantidad de 10,000.00 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar granos básicos, refrescos, churros, manteca, lácteos, pan, jabón y otros productos de venta diaria. Ella decidió hacer esta inversión para estar preparada para la época navideña. Su meta es aumentar el inventario y hacer crecer más el negocio y de las ganancias comprar unas vitrinas para colocar venta de achinería.
texts.en:
María Elena, 55, is married and has six children.  She lives with her husband and two of her children in Cuyamel, Cortes.  María Elena has had her own grocery store business for 12 years where she sells basic staple items like basic grains, soft-drinks, snacks, candy, condiments, oil, vegetables, bread, etc.  She also butchers beef occasionally to generate extra income.  She’s kept the business going by investing several loans into it.

She’s currently requesting he third loan for 10,000 Lempiras to buy basic grains, soft-drinks, snacks, lard, dairy products, bread, soap and other items of daily sale.  She decided to make this investment to be ready for the Christmas season.  Her goal is to increase her inventory and make the business grow more and to use some of the profits to buy some display cases to place low-cost novelty items.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Sugei

texts.es: Sugey con su anterior credikiva, compró una fotocopiadora para su negocio de servicio de transporte de cargas. Sus ingresos han aumentado por la adquisición de este equipo y su ingreso ha aumentado debido al surtido que hizo al negocio de mercancías;  los despachos son mayores, por eso dice a los financiadores de Kiva: “ Mis agradecimientos  a todas las personas que me han beneficiado y que siempre continúen apoyándonos para seguir adelante en mi negocio. “ Su nuevo credikiva lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía navideña al por mayor, que vino con descuentos especiales,  para transportarlo a las ciudades de Colombia y aumentar una vez mas sus ganancias, por cuenta de  su credikiva..
texts.en: With her previous loan, Sugey bought a photocopier for her delivery business that increased her income. Her earnings also rose because she increased her inventory and deliveries increased. As a result, she thanks all the Kiva lenders that supported her and hopes they continue helping her grow her business. She will use her next loan to buy wholesale Christmas merchandise at special discounts so that she can deliver to cities in Colombia and, once again thanks to a Kiva loan, increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy wholesale Christmas merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rahimkul

texts.ru: Рахимкул проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 51 год. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Рахимкул вместе с женой занимается скотоводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Скотоводством Рахимкул занимается пять лет. Он берет кредит для закупа телят и коров.
texts.en:
Rahimkul lives in the town of Istaravshan. He is 51 years old, married, and has one child. 

Together with his wife, Rahimkul is engaged in raising livestock. He raises livestock near his home. Rahimkul has been engaged in animal husbandry for five years.

He is taking a loan to buy a calf and a cow.

loans.use: to buy a calf and a cow

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
Зухро более десяти лет занимается скотоводством. В этом ей помогают невестки. Зухро берет кредит для закупа бычков с целью увеличения поголовья крупнорогатого скота. 
Зухро 53 - летняя замужняя женщина. Она проживает в городе Истаравшан. У нее двое сыновей.
texts.en:
Zuhro has been involved in raising cattle for more than ten years. Her daughter-in-law helps her with this work. 

Zuhro is taking a loan to buy cattle with the goal of increasing the number of her livestock. 
 
Zuhro is a 53-year-old, married woman. She lives in the town of Istaravshan. She has two sons.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Kobiljon

texts.ru: Кобилчон проживает в районе Зафаробод, города Истаравшан. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Кобилчон зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области он более пяти лет. Кобилчон берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Kobiljon lives in the Zafarobod region, the town of Istaravshan. He is 39 years old, married, and has three children. 

Kobiljon makes a living by breeding cattle. He has more than five years experience in this area. Kobiljon is taking a loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cows, bulls, and calves

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана торгует в Центральном универмаге на первом этаже. Она продает сумки, ремни, шапки, шарфы, носки, колготы. Свевтлана обходительна, трудолюбива, отзывчива, прдприимчива. Эти и другие качества помогают Светлане быть успешной в бизнесе. На этот раз кредит понадобился для увеличения ассортимента зимнего товара.
texts.en: Svetlana runs a store on the first floor of the downtown shopping center. She sells bags, belts, hats, scarves, socks and stockings. Svetlana is personable, hard-working, kind-hearted and a go-getter. These and other traits help Svetlana be successful in business. She is in need of this loan to expand her selection of winter wear.

loans.use: expand her selection of winter wear.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 44 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.

Fe is engaged in a ready to wear (RTW) clothes dealing business and earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional RTWs for sale. 

Fe has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Fe hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional RTWs (ready to wear clothes)

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья продает фильтры для воды, фильтры «Барьер», сменные картриджи. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту, Наталья отремонтировала свое торговое помещение. Теперь оно выглядит лучше и привлекает больше покупателей. 

Как и в прошлый раз кредит понадобился для закупки сменных картриджей для фильтров. Наталья - клиент порядочный, платит во время без опозданий, всегда торгует, трудолюбива.
texts.en:
Natalya sells water filters, "Barrier" brand filters and replacement filter cartridges. Thanks to a previous loan, Natalya has renovated her salesroom. Now the store looks better and attracts more customers. 

Like last time, this loan is needed to buy replacement filter cartridges. Natalya is a responsible client. She always makes her payments on time, and is always hard at work at the store.

loans.use: закупить сменные картриджи для фильтров

loans.name: Erasmina Mercedes

texts.es: Erasmina compró una máquina industrial y también le alcanzó para comprar materias primas e insumos, como telas,  hilos, correderas botones etc.  Con este crédito mejoró el acabado de sus productos y además aumentó el número de clientes; con sus utilidades pudo   hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda y se siente muy satisfecha. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el  siguiente:  “ Estoy agradecida con todas las personas que nos han ayudado,  a través del aporte que hacen en crédito, para nosotros los pequeños empresarios;  espero que sigan apoyándonos, para progresar en nuestras microempresas. “En la actualidad Erasmina está aplicando aun credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, como telas, hilos, correderas, botones y aplicaciones, para producir ropa elegante en mayor cantidad, mientras ella estará muy contenta,  de que sus clientes puedan estar bien vestidas,  para esperar las festividades mas hermosas y familiares del año.: “La navidad y el año nuevo”
texts.en:
Erasmina bought a commercial sewing machine and raw materials and supplies such as fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons with the previous loan. She was able to improve her finished products and increase her clientele. She used her profits to make improvements to her house and is very satisfied. She thanks all the Kiva lenders who helped her by financing her loan. She says that, on behalf of small entrepreneurs like herself, she hopes that they continue their support so that small businesses can grow.

Now Erasmina is applying for a new loan to buy raw materials and supplies such as fabric, thread, zippers, bottons, and trim to make more elegant clothing. She will be happy to see her clients well dressed for the most beautiful family holidays of the year, Christmas and New Year´s Day.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies such as fabric, thread, zippers, bottons, and trim to make elegant clothing.

loans.name: Juliana Sarahi

texts.es: Juliana,  tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo, hijos y su madre en una colonia del municipio de San Manuel, cortes. Anteriormente trabajo en una empresa de maquila y hace un año quedo sin empleo y de sus ahorros decidió dedicarse a vender mercadería como blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa intima, bolsos, sandalias, y accesorios para damas como bisutería. Las ventas las realiza en su casa y por pedidos. Con el objetivo de incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 7,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar más ropa, sandalias y bisutería. Su sueño es que el negocio crezca cada día y poder ayudar económicamente a su familia. Agradece mucho la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Juliana, age 26, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband, her children, and her mother in a neighborhood in the San Manuel municipality in Cortes.

She used to work in a factory, but one year ago she was left unemployed.  She decided to use her savings and sell merchandise like blouses, skirts, pants, underwear, purses, sandals, and women’s accessories like costume jewelry.  She makes her sales at her house and by orders.

In order to increase sales and her income, she has decided to request a loan for 7,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy more clothes, sandals, and costume jewelry.  Her dream is for her business to grow each day and to be able to help her family financially.  She is very grateful for the opportunity given to her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes, sandals, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her flower garden.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 51, years old, is married with five children. Her family presently resides at Tambisan, Siquijor, Siquijor, in the Philippines. 

She has engaged in this business for five years and earns 5000 PHP every month. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to be used as additional capital for her existing business.

She has been a member of PMPC and has a good credit history. She aims to expand her business in the future with the help and support of this institution.

loans.use: to increase her capital for her clothing business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married with two children. She is 38 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

For two years, Elsie has been selling sari2x products to earn a living. Each month, she earns 30,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP for additional capital.

Elsie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Elsie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional inventory, like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee and other items to sell.

loans.name: Gulbaira

texts.ru: Гульбайра 58 лет, замужем. Гульбайра в качестве основного дохода с 2001 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 100,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Гульбайра в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойная корова с приплодом, 1 теленок, 5 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульбайра обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота – молодняка для откорма. Доходы от кредита Гульбайра планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а также планирует построить сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Gulbaira is 58 years old and married. As her main source of income, Gulbaira has been raising livestock since 2001. She started her business with 100,000 Krygyzstani som (KGS). Thanks to her tireless work, today Gulbaira has 1 dairy cow with offspring, 1 calf, and 5 nanny goats. Her monthly income consists of 15,000 KGS. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulbaira is requesting a loan of 25,000 KGS from Bai Tushum and Partners for the purchase of young livestock to fatten. With the profit from the loan, Gulbaira plans to keep growing her flock of domesticated animals. She also plans to build a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance like an overhaul, a change of tires, or a change of oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice farm.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru: Любовь торгует женской одеждой, свитерами, гольфами, кофтами. Она порядочная и трудолюбивая, всегда на работе, а если не может выйти сама, то торгует ее дочь. У Любви всегда есть большой выбор товара, который привлекает клиентов. Кредит понадобился для расширения зимнего товра. Любовь хочет закупить теплые юбки, гольфы, брюки, свитера.
texts.en:
Lubov sells women's clothes, sweaters, knee socks, and cardigans. She is responsible and hard-working. She is always at work--and if she can't come herself, then she sends her daughter. At Lubov's, there's always a wide selection of goods, which attracts customers. 

A loan is needed to diversify her stock of winter clothes. Lubov wants to buy warm skirts, knee socks, pants, and sweaters.

loans.use: закупить зимние юбки, брюки, свитера

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coconut to resell.

loans.name: Por Una Vida Digna Group

texts.es: Saludos desde ¡Perú!, El grupo “POR UNA VIDA DIGNA” está conformado por cinco socias que son sinónimo de lucha, perseverancia y convicción. La Sra. Benedicta es un claro ejemplo que con la fuerza de voluntad puede conseguir muchas cosas. Ella tiene 62 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad. Benedicta pertenece a una asociación que brinda servicios de venta de alimentos preparados a empresas importantes del Estado, muy aparte ella también brinda un servicio de almuerzos, desayunos y demás. Con el préstamo desea comprar maquinarias para su empresa de alimentos y así poder ser más eficiente en el proceso de elaboración del producto a entregar. El grupo “POR UNA VIDA DIGNA” se siente feliz por saber que personas la pueden a poyar a través de organizaciones como Kiva y Edaprospo. Benedicta comenta: “Estoy feliz y entusiasmada al saber que personas me ayudan. Ella desea tener en un futuro acceso a otras actividades de negocio y poder compartirla con ustedes”. La Sra Benedicta es aquella mujer que tiene las manos sobre la mesa y esta mostrando su bolso que fue elaborado por el grupo como símbolo de su alianza.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru!  “Por Una Vida Digna” (For a Dignified Life) group is comprised of five members who are synonymous with struggle, perseverance and conviction.  Benedicta clearly demonstrates that, with willpower, you can achieve many things.  She is 62 years old and married with three adult children.  Benedicta belongs to an association that sells prepared foods to major State businesses.  Apart from this, she also has a service in which she provides lunches, breakfasts, and other meals.  With the loan, she wishes to purchase machinery for her food business which will enable her to be more efficient in the process of preparing her product for delivery.  The “Por Una Vida Digna” group are happy to learn that people can support her through organizations like Kiva and Edaprospo.  Benedicta says, “I am very happy and excited to learn that people are helping me.  I want to have access to other business activities in the future and be able to share them with you”.  In the photo, Benedicta is the woman that has her hands on the table and is showing her handbag that was created by the group as a symbol of their alliance.

loans.use: to purchase machinery for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize flour and cooking fat for his shop.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 59 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is separated with five children. 

Pablita has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She also operates a side car for hire and raises hogs. She has had this business for six years. 

Pablita requested a loan to be pay the processing fees for her daughter’s passport and other working papers. She will use the remaining amount to purchase additional groceries for sale.

Pablita has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years. In the future, Pablita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay the processing fees for her daughter’s passport.

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.en:
Gulzada is 56 years old; she is married and has 4 children. She is very kind and deliberate, and always tries to find new sources of income. 

In order to provide her children with good living conditions, she wants to organize her own business growing crops and vegetables. She took a course entitled ‘To get ahead’ with a woman's organization, and learned business skills. 

Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman since she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for organizing her new business. 

This loan will help her to organize the new business, and will help her obtain better living conditions.  

She promises to make her payment on time. She awaits your support because you are the only one who can support her.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for her new business growing crops and vegetables.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela de 28 años tiene un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de vestir en su domicilio, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 5 años, motores de su vida y la de su cónyuge. Su experiencia data desde hace 10 años, porque su madre   tenia este taller , desde hace 18 años, por lo cual ella y sus hermanas desde su niñez permanecían entre telas y máquinas de coser y se involucraron en este arte;  hasta el día de hoy Marcela es la que mas se interesó en convertir sus capacidades productivas de su taller,  en un generador de ingresos, para generar bienestar a su hogar. Ella presta el servicio de confección de ropa femenina, masculina, a una clientela que ha construido poco a poco, entre vecinos, empleados de empresas, familiares y referidos y el de maquila, a empresas importantes,  adicionando con éste último otros ingresos,  trabajados unida a su madre quien la asesora aun y a su esposo para que el trabajo común sea más efectivo. Sus ventas las realizan  a crédito con una frecuencia semanal y trabaja en su taller desde las 8 e la mañana,  hasta las 6 de la tarde.   Su meta es ampliar el mercado,  incrementando la producción, especialmente a finales del año,  porque hay mucha mas rotación de dinero y pedidos,  que los que  usualmente tiene en  otros periodos de año. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el que comprará telas, hilos, cierres y broches en mayor volumen y con ellos ganara muchos descuentos, pues los proveedores también están haciendo sus mejores ofertas en esta época,  lo cual beneficia el potencial de éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Marcela, who is 28, makes clothing in a little workshop in her home, where she lives with her husband and their two children, ages 2 and 5, the driving force for her life and that of her husband. Her experience dates from 10 years ago, because her mother had such a workshop for 18 years, and so she and her sisters lived among fabric and sewing machines and became involved in this art since their childhood. To this day, Marcela is the one who became most interested in converting her productive training in her mother's workshop into a generator of income, to create well-being in her household. She provides a service of making clothing for women and men for a customer base she has built little by little among neighbors, business employees, relatives, people referred to her, and assembly work for important businesses, which adds another source of income, as well as work she does with her mother, who still advises her and her husband so that the common work will be more effective. She makes her sales on credit with weekly payments and works in her workshop from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon. Her goal is to expand her market, increasing the production, especially at the end of the year, when there is a lot of turnover of money and orders compared to what she usually has in other times of the year. This is why she is turning to a Kiva loan, with which she will buy fabrics, threads, fasteners, and clasps in larger volumes, and with these she will get many discounts, since the suppliers are also making their best offers during this time, which will benefit the potential for the success of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, fasteners, and clasps in large volume

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es:
Salomón, tiene 36 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una colonia del municipio de el Negrito, Yoro.
Él desde niño aprendió a cultivar arroz junto a su padre, hace 8 años que realiza sus propios cultivos de arroz. Este producto ya sale listo para venderlo al consumidor local y clientes de alrededor. Salomón ha mantenido bien sus cultivos mediante la inversión de varios préstamos, lleva 23 ciclos con el actual. Este préstamo es por 18,000 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de insumos como abonos y pago de mano de obra para la preparación de tierras y para trasplante de cultivo. Con esta inversión espera sacar mejor producción y obtener buenas ganancias para seguir apoyando a sus hijos con la educación y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Salomón, age 36, is married and has four children.  He lives in a neighborhood in the Negrito municipality in Yoro.

When he was a boy he learned to cultivate rice together with his father.  He has been growing his own rice crops for eight years.  This product is now ready to sell to the local consumers and outlying customers.

Salomón has maintained his crops well through the investment of various loans.  This is his 23rd cycle.  He will use this loan for 18,000 lempiras to buy supplies like fertilizers and to pay for labor to prepare the land and to transplant the crop.  With this investment he hopes to get better production and better income so that he can continue supporting his children’s education and improve his house.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers and to pay for labor to prepare the land and to transplant the crop.

loans.name: Deejay

texts.en:
Deejay is 22 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is single with one dependent child. 

Deejay sells nuts and copra and earns approximately 7,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional nuts and copra for his existing business. 

Deejay has been a member of PMPC for just one year. In the future, Deejay hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase nuts and copra.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is married with one child. She is 31 years old and lives in Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

For a year, Luzminda has been selling snack foods to earn a living. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP for additional capital. Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe C12066 Group

texts.en:
Gaspard is 50 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 5 years and 27. He sells rice. Gaspard is a leader of this group, which is called "ABISHYIZEHAMWE C12066" in the local language. In the photo, he's the one raising his hand. He works from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, except on Sunday. Gaspard has eight years of experience in this work. 

Gaspard has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell. If there are profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: to expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is taking out a new loan to improve her business. She is grateful for her previous loan, which provided her with a supply of ingredients to prepare food dishes. With this new investment, she wants to buy more ingredients to prepare a variety of dishes and meet her customers' demands. She plans to buy wheat flour, vegetables, cooking fat and food flavoring, among other things. Her aim is to grow her business into a hotel.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, vegetables, cooking fat, food flavors and other ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Dulce Juanita

texts.es:
Dulce, es una joven de 22 años, soltera de oficio comerciante y estudiante universitaria. Es dueña de una pequeña pulpería la cual  inicio hace tres años con apoyo de su mama. Comenzó vendiendo mercadería en general como ropa, perfumes y cosméticos los vendía de crédito con las ganancias fue ahorrando para después invertirlo en compra de productos para iniciar su pulpería, pues su idea es ser dueña de su propia empresa. Entre sus expectativas a futuro esta comprar una unidad de taxi para obtener otros ingresos y brindar empleo a otras personas.  
Está requiriendo el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, productos de limpieza, productos lácteos, pan, carne, huevos, papel higiénico, etc.
texts.en:
Dulce is a single 22 year old young woman.  She is a merchant and a university student.  She has her own small grocery store, which she started three years ago with her mother’s support.

She started selling general merchandise like clothes, perfume, and cosmetics.  She sold on credit, and she was saving the income to later invest in buying products to start her grocery store.  Her idea was to be the owner of her own business.  One of her hopes for the future is to buy a tax in order to get other income and provide employment for other people.

She needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, cleaning products, dairy products, bread, meat, eggs, and toilet paper, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, cleaning products, dairy products, bread, meat, eggs, and toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Flavia Domitila

texts.es: Doña Flavia, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en un Barrio al norte de San Pedro Sula. Ella trabajo en una empresa maquiladora y con sus ahorros hace 5 años decidió por establecer su propia actividad de negocio y ofrece los servicios de alquiler de mesas, sillas, manteles, arreglos para todo tipo de eventos como bodas, cumpleaños, graduaciones y otros. Desde que inicio se ha promocionado y ahora ya tiene su propia clientela. Esta solicitando un préstamo de 15,000 Lempiras para comprar más mesas para su negocio y cubrir la demanda que tiene para este fin de año. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca, tener variedad de servicios y con la ayuda de los préstamos poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Flavia, age 51, is a single mother.  She lives with her son in a neighborhood north of San Pedro Sula.  She works for an assembly plant.  Five years ago she decided to use her savings to establish her own business activity.

She offers rental services.  She rents out tables, chairs, tablecloths, and arrangements for all type of events like weddings, birthdays, graduations, and others.  Since the beginning it has been promoted, and she now has her own clientele.

She is requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras to buy more tables for her business and to cover the demand she has for the end of this year.  Her dream is that her business grows, that she has a variety of services, and that she is able to get her family ahead with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to buy more tables to rent out for special events.

loans.name: Saira Jackeline

texts.es:
La Señora Saira tiene 27 años de edad,  vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene un hijo reside una comunidad del municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortes.
Saira hace un año decidió establecer su negocio de venta de frutas, vegetales y huevos con el fin de obtener ingresos para apoyar los gastos familiares. Además ella vende comida a través de pedidos que le hacen sus clientes.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de frutas como: naranjas, papayas, sandias, melones, zapote y vegetales pataste, yuca, papas, repollo.
Con el apoyo financiero ella espera aumentar sus ventas y así mejorar su nivel de vida.
Su meta a futuro es lograr la compra de su propia casa.
texts.en:
Saira, 27, is in a common-law marriage and has a child.  She lives in a community in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, in the department of Cortes.

A year ago, Saira decided to start up a business selling fruit, vegetables and eggs with the goal of earning income to support the household expenses.  In addition, she sells food based on advanced orders made by her customers.

At this time, Saira is requesting a loan of 10,000 Honduran lempiras.  She's planning to use the loan to invest in fruit such as: oranges, papayas, watermelons, melons, and sapodilla, and vegetables such as: chayote squash, cassava, potatoes and cabbage.

With this loan, she is hoping to increase her sales and thereby improve her standard of living.

Saira's goal for the future is to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy fruits (oranges, papayas, watermelons, melons, sapodilla), and vegetables (chayote squash, cassava, potatoes and cabbage)

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеде 21 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями на столице, где развитие экономики и культуры происходит ежеминутно. С целью получения экономического образования, в 2008 году, Умеда поступила в Технологический Университет Таджикистана по специальности Мировой экономики. Она студентка 5 курса и очень активно участвует в жизни университета. Она учится отлично и ее однокурсники очень любят ее и ценят ее дружбу, потому что Умеда хороший друг. Будущим у нее много планов и она старается реализовать все планы на реальность. Она хочет работать на международных организациях, так как изучает мировую экономику. Для реализации всех этих планов, она должна окончить университет и получить свой диплом, но ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебу. Отец Умеды работает в организации и является единственным кормильцем в семье, так как  ее мать домохозяйка и не имеет источника дохода. Умеда запрашивает займ на сумму 600 долларов США для оплаты учебы. Она ждет и надеется только на вас. Давайте вместе поможем такой прекрасной и умной девушки оплатить за учебу.
texts.en: Umeda is 21 years old. She is single and lives with his parents in the capital, where the economy and culture are developing rapidly. With the goal of receiving an education in economics, Umeda entered the Tadzikistan Technological University in 2008 with a major in World Economy. She is a fifth year student and is a very active participant in university life. She is an excellent student, and her classmates like her very much and value her friendship, for she is a good friend. She has lots of future plans and is trying to make these plans a reality. She wants to work in international organizations, since she is studying international economics. To realize these plans, she must graduate from the university and receive her degree, but her parents cannot afford to pay for her studies. Umeda's father works for an organization and is the family's only source of income; her mother is a housewife and earns no income. Umeda is applying for a loan of 600 US dollars to pay for her tuition. She is relying and depending solely on you. Let's work together and help such an outstanding, smart young woman play for her studies.

loans.use: To pay for her  tuition

loans.name: Munirkhon

texts.ru: Мунирхону 18 лет. Он очень умный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Мунирхон является студентом 1 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции по специальности финансы и кредит. Он учится отлично и активно участвует во всех мероприятиях университета. Мунирхон является членом футбольной команды. В свободное время он занимается сборкой мебели в мебельном цехе. Родители занимаются купле продажей мужской одежды, но их доход не позволяет им оплатить за учебу сына. Мунирхон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Munirkhon is 18 years old. He is a very smart and hardworking young man. Munirkhon is a first-year student at the Tadzhikistan State University of Commerce, majoring in finance and credit. He is an excellent student and actively participates in all activities of the university. Munirkhon is also a member of the soccer team. In his free time he assembles furniture in a furniture shop. His parents sell men's clothing, but their income does not enable them to pay for their son's studies. Munirkhon is applying for a loan to pay for his tuition at the university. He eagerly awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old; she is separated with eight children, who help her to support the family's needs. She's residing at Tinago, Siquijor.

She has engaged in this business for seven years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. She has requested a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP to be used as additional capital for alamang processing.

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for two years and plans to expand her existing business within this institution.

loans.use: to operate her food processing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, 26, says that she is a happy, hard-working, and entrepreneurial person. She lives with her 4-year-old daughter in Kisauni.

Judith makes and sells garments for a living in a small tailoring workshop. She has loyal customers and can sell everything that she makes. She has orders that she has to fill, and she will use this loan to buy insulated material for making garments. The investment will allow her to meet the demand from her customers and grow her business. The happier her customers are, she says, the better her income and, in turn, her and her daughter's quality of life.

Judith hopes to grow her business and continue providing for her daughter, who is her motivation to work hard.

loans.use: to buy insulated material for making garments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car necessary for moving his tools and requested sanitary ware from one place to another.

loans.name: Marbely

texts.es:
Marbely, una humilde comerciante de 32 años de edad, casada, quien se dedica a atender una pequeña pulpería. Negocio que inicio al ver que su esposo ni ella tenían un trabajo estable debido a la situación económica, además que fue con este negocio que ha venido ayudando a sus hermanas a salir adelante. Después de 4 años emprendió el negocio de las caponeras, la cuales son unas bicicletas con carpas y asientos que se utilizan para transportar a la personas de un lado a otro y son muy populares debido a su bajos precios  en comparación con los taxis. Actualmente venden hielo al por mayor negocio el cual es dirigido por su esposo mientras ella atiende la pulpería y el negocio de la caponera.   
Ella esta necesitando el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, productos lácteos, carnes, enlatados, avenas. Pues son parte de los productos, más demandados  por su clientela. Sus planes futuros ampliar más el negocio de la venta de hielo al por mayor, agregar más productos comestibles para la pulpería y ayudarle a sus hermanas a poner un salón de belleza para que tengan su propia fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Marbely is a 32 year old, humble, businesswoman.  She is married and takes care of a general store.  She began this business at a time when neither she nor her husband had a steady job due to the economic situation.  In addition, this business has enabled her to help her sisters get ahead.  After four years, she started a “caponera” business (“Caponeras” are bicycles with canopies and seats that are used to transport people from one place to another.  They are very popular because of their lower prices compared to taxis).  They also sell wholesale ice cream, a business that is managed by her husband while she takes care of the general store and the “caponera” business.

She needs the loan to purchase basic grains, soda, juice, dairy products, meat, canned goods, and oats because these are the products demanded most by her customers.  In the future, she plans to expand the wholesale ice cream business, add more grocery products to the general store, and help her sisters establish a beauty salon so that they will have their own source of income.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, soda, juice, dairy products, meat, canned goods, and oats.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Sylvia. She is single and has three children, aged 15, 13 and 9 years. She has one additional dependent, a niece who lives with her.

In 2008, Sylvia established her cosmetics business. She began her business to support her husband when he went abroad for further studies. 

Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are visitors to the market. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 850,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in order to buy Le 3,000,000 worth of cosmetics. 

In the future, Sylvia hopes to expand her business and also to access subsequent loans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy Le 3,000,000 worth of cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Víctor Velisario

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 62 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos, reside en una comunidad del municipio  de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortes.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajo asalariado en la empresa privada, la empresa cerró operaciones y con las prestaciones laborales que recibió, Don Víctor decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta y reparación de teléfonos celulares.
En este momento ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en a compra de teléfonos celulares, accesorios y repuestos para la reparación de los mismos.
Él espera que su negocio crezca con el apoyo financiero obtenido, además mejorar la atención de sus clientes disponiendo de variedad de teléfonos para cubrir la demanda  existente.
Su meta es adquirir su propia casa para lograr una estabilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Victor, 62, is married and has 2 children.  He lives in a community in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, in the department of Cortes.

Previously, Victor had a salaried job with a private company.  That company closed its operations, and with the severance pay he received, Victor decided to start up his own business selling and repairing cell phones.

At this time, Victor has requested a loan of 15,000 Honduran lempiras.  He plans to use these funds to buy cellular telephones, accessories and spare parts.  

Victor hopes that his business will grow with this financial support.  Also, he will be able to have better customer service, as he will have a greater variety of cellular phone products available to meet the demand.

Victor's goal is to acquire his own property, so that he provide stability to his family.

loans.use: to buy cell phones, and accessories and parts for cell phones.

loans.name: Ilda Rosa

texts.es: Doña Ilda, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive con dos de ellos en el municipio de Peña Blanca Cortes. Doña Ilda tiene 12 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas como ser: pastelitos rellenos de carne, pupusas,  tortilla de harina, tortillas con quesillo, pollo frito con tajadas, refrescos y otros. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en un local que alquila y allí atiende a su clientela. Ella ya ha obtenido cuatro préstamos con el actual de diferentes montos, este actual es por la cantidad de 28,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como harinas, manteca, sal, condimento, carnes, queso, frijoles y otros insumos. También utilizara un 10% aproximadamente para cancelar una pequeña deuda con una persona particular. La decisión de tomar este crédito es para abastecerse de insumos y cumplir con las exigencias de la clientela. En un futuro tiene pensado ampliar el negocio, ya que el local donde lo tiene es muy pequeño y quiere brindar mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Ilda, 53, is a single mother.  She has 3 children, and lives with 2 of them in the municipality of Peña Blanca Cortes.  Ilda has had a business for 12 years, making and selling fast food such as: empanadas stuffed with meat, pupusas (a thick, stuffed corn tortillla), flour tortillas, tortillas with cheese, fried chicken with plantains, beverages, and other items.  She has set up this business in a rented locale, and this is where she serves her customers.  

Ilda has already received 4 loans in varying amounts.  This one is for the sum of 28,000 Honduran lempiras.  She will invest this sum in the purchase of raw materials such as: flour, butter, salt, condiments, meat, cheese, beans, and other supplies.  In addition, she will use about 10 percent of the loan to pay off a small debt she has with a private individual.  The reason she will take this loan is to stock up on supplies so that she can meet her customers' demand.  In the future, she plans to expand her business, because the place that she has now is very small, and she wants to be able to provide better service.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as: meat, flour, corn flour, condiments, beans, pork, cheese, butter, and other items, and also to pay off a debt she has with a private individual

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cows for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for a cold drink business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase mechanical work tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is still in her tailoring business that has provided her good profits to sustain her. She says that the previous loans have been of great help to her. Charlotte is a very hardworking woman despite her advanced age. She has the urge to move ahead. This new loan will help her expand her business so that she can have good profits. She will buy fabrics to make more clothing to meet her customer demands.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make more clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her freezer, which she uses to preserve perishables in her shop.

loans.name: Alber Enrique

texts.es: Enrique tiene 20 años de edad,  es casado y no tiene hijos, ellos residen en la comunidad de Miraflores, Patuca, Olancho. El inicio su negocio de siembra de café desde hace 6 años, comenzó como cortador de café y poco a poco fue ahorrando para comprar su terreno y poder sembrar su cafetal, el trabaja en conjunto con su familia y su esposa pero cuando es temporada de corte tienen que contratar empleados por lo que su esposa se levanta en la madrugada para hacerles la comida, el horario de trabajo lo realizan a diario y cuando es temporada de corte no tienen hora de salida. El préstamo que Enrique solicita lo necesita para la inversión de compra de fertilizantes para la finca de café y pago de mano de obra. Con la ayuda de este préstamo su vida cambiara en mucho ya que son pocas las instituciones que apoyan a los cafetaleros. Su sueño es tener su finca bien cultivada y su meta es ampliar más su cafetal. Es el primer financiamiento que Enrique recibe de FAMA  y espera cancelar de manera puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Enrique is 20 years old, married without children, and they live in the community of Miraflores, Patuca, Olancho.

He started the business of planting coffee six years ago. He started as a coffee picker and little by little he was saving in order to buy his land and be able to plant his coffee. He works with his family and his wife but when it is cutting season he has to hire employees and so his wife gets up early in the morning to make the food. He works on a daily schedule but during picking season he has no scheduled time to leave. 

The loan that Enrique is seeking is needed in order to invest in the purchase of fertilizer for the coffee plantation and to pay the laborers. With the help of this loan his life will change a lot as there are few institutions that support the coffee growers.

His dream is to have a well cultivated farm and his goal is to expand his coffee plantation further. This is the first loan that Enrique has received from FAMA and he expects to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay laborers

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La Señora Ernestina tiene 42 años de edad,  es casada, tiene 4 hijos reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad del municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortes.
Ernestina hace 4 años decidió establecer su negocio de confección de prendas de vestir, elaboración de cameras y cortinas.
Con el propósitos de cumplir con algunos pedidos de sus clientes, decidió solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad de 8,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, encajes y accesorios para la confección. 
Con el apoyo financiero ella espera aumentar sus ventas en esta temporada navideña.
Su meta a futuro es lograr que sus hijos estudien y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ernestina, 42, is married and has 4 children.  She lives with her family in a community in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, in the department of Cortes.

Four years ago, Ernestina decided to start up a business sewing garments, bedspreads and curtains. 

In order to fulfill some orders she has from customers, she decided to request a loan in the sum of 8,000 Honduran lempiras to invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, lace, and sewing accessories.  

With this financial support, Ernestina hopes to increase her sales during this Christmas season.  Her goal for the future is to get her children an education and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace and sewing accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to be used in making fish balls to sell.

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es:
Héctor  originario de Siuna, actualmente vive en Estelí, tiene 28 años de edad, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 5 y 2 años respectivamente, de oficio comerciante. El inicio con capital propio, dinero que obtuvo de vender banano. Actualmente es dueño de una pulpería, del que es propietario hace más de 1 año, ya que este ha sido su  primer negocio del cual sobrevive a diario con su familia. A  el le gustaría comercializar sus productos  en la misma comarca, ya que se expectativas es incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias.
Héctor solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar,  pollo y ropa. Toda la mercadería  necesaria para surtir su pulpería, el cual estima será de ayuda, pues podrá invertir en su negocio en la compra de producto mas solicitado por los clientes, sus planes futuro es poder ampliar su negocio, para mayor atracción de los clientes, con el objetivo de tener mejores ingresos, su meta próxima es hacerle mejora a su casa para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Héctor is originally from Siuna. Currently he lives in Estelí. He is 28 years old and the father of two children between the ages of 5 and 2 years old, respectively. He is a merchant. He started with his own capital, money he got from selling bananas.

He is currently the owner of a grocery store, and has owned it for more than a year. This has been his first business upon which his family depends on daily. He would like to sell his products in the same area, with the expectation of increasing his sales and to obtain better earnings.

Héctor is asking for a loan in order to buy more products such as rice, beans, sugar, chicken, and clothing. All the merchandise is needed to supply his store, which he thinks will be of help, because he can invest in his business buy buying the product most requested by his customers. His future plan is to be able to expand his business, to attract more customers, with the objective of having better earnings. His next goal is to improve his house in order to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more products such as rice, beans, sugar, chicken and clothing for his grocery store

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana originaria de Estelí,  de 40 años, soltera, madre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 14 y 23 años, de oficio comerciante. Inicio  con capital  propio, dinero que obtuvo de vender  fritanga(comida frita). Actualmente se dedica a una pulpería, hace más de 3 años, el cual saca adelante con el apoyo de su esposo que le ayuda a atender a sus clientes.
Ana solicita el préstamo para comprar  arroz, azúcar, gaseosa y artículos navideños, etc. Ya que ella estima que al comprar estos productos de alta demanda  le ayudaría a incrementar sus ventas y  ampliar su negocio en esta temporada navideña, y asi obtener mejores ganancias en su pulpería, sus planes futuro es hacerle mejora a su casa, para darle una mejor presentación a su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is originally from Estelí. She is 40 years old and the mother of two children between the ages of 14 and 23 years of age. She is a merchant. She began with her own capital, money that she got from selling “fritanga” (fried food). She has had a grocery store for more than three years with which she gets ahead with the support of her husband who helps her serve the customers.

Ana is asking for a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, soft drinks, holiday items, etc. She believes that by buying these products of high demand, it would help her to increase sales and expand her business during this holiday season, and thus to obtain better earnings in her grocery store. 

Her future plan is to make improvements to her home, in order for her business to have a better appearance.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soft drinks and holiday items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used sweaters for her thread (yarn)-making business.

loans.name: Ursila

texts.en:
Ursila is 33 years old and married. She has three children, aged 8, 6, and 4 years old. She buys and sells charcoal, and her business has been in operation for a period of over five years. She earns an income of KES 10,000 monthly.

She is servicing her sixth loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. After repaying the previous loan successfully, she intends to purchase charcoal for resale from the local suppliers.  

The ploughed amount will be used to put up a structure for charcoal storage. She hopes for prosperity in her business and to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bangles for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase animals to trade.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man who has been working in the communication business for five years. He opened his own call shop in 2010 to provide a highly requested service in the region he is living.

Mohamad applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to  change his shop's decoration and start selling mobile phones, accessories and prepaid cards. This step is an excellent step forward to improve, expand and develop his living, social and financial situations.

This is his first time as an Al Majmoua borrower and he is working hard to make sure it will have an excellent impact on his development. He is planning to expand his work to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: to change his shop's decoration and start selling mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: C7550 Duteraninkunga Ii Group

texts.en:
Jeannette is 28 years old and married, with four children aged between 5 and 25 years old. 

She owns an agriculture business selling rice, which is open from 7 a.m until 5 p.m daily, except on Sunday. She has eight years of experience in this work. She is the leader of the group, which is called "C7550 DUTERANINKUNGA II" in the local language. She is raising her hand in the photo.   

Jeannette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell. With the profit, she expects to save money for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes and medicine for exporting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulls for slaughtering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of medicine for exporting.

loans.name: Miradije

texts.en:
Miradije is 28 years old and married. She lives in an ethnic minority community in Kosovo. She is married and has three children between the ages three and five years old. None of them go to school currently. 

As most residents in her community do, she lives under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. The children wake up very early in the morning and go to trash containers looking for food. Miradije’s family always feels cold and gets sick in winter from the cold. They have a serious problem with their home's windows and doors. 

Her house needs a serious renovation so the family can live a healthy and normal life. Miradije has requested a loan to renovate her house and to buy new doors and windows. The loan will improve the health of her family. 

Miradije is very grateful to Kiva lenders for improving her  family's conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To renovate her house to buy doors and windows

loans.name: Glenda Siomara

texts.es:
Glenda, de 40 años de edad, casada, de oficio comerciante, es originaria de la ciudad Chontales pero tiene 24 años de vivir en Managua, tiene tres hijos de los cuales la menor de 16 años esta cursando la secundaria.    
Inicio en el mundo del comercio vendiendo queso  con el tiempo decidió vender oro y plata. Durante ese tiempo trabajo como supervisora de un empresa de textiles al salir del trabajo con la liquidación que le dieron fue que puso su pulpería  comprando galletas, pan , huevo y snacks fueron sus primeros productos . Poco a poco fue surgiendo agregando productos hasta formar su pulpería. En este actividad su esposo y la hija mayor le ayudan se dividen las tareas pues mientras ella atiende a los clientes su esposo realiza las compras y su hija la ayuda arreglar y limpiar los productos. 
Está solicitando el crédito para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, carnes, pollo, huevo. Además quiere invertir en compra de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos pues durante la época navideñas son productos de mucha demanda entre su clientela. Entre sus planes esta trasladar su pulpería a un lugar mas amplio y agregar la venta de ropa, perfumes y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Glenda is 40 years old, married, and is a merchant. She is originally from the city of Chontales but she has been living in Managua for 24 years. She has three children. The youngest is 16 years old and is attending high school.

She entered the world of business by selling cheese and eventually decided to sell gold and silver. During that time she worked as a supervisor of a textile company and left work with the settlement that they gave her and put it into her store buying her first products of cookies, bread, eggs and snacks. Little by little she advanced adding products until she created her store. In this activity her husband and her oldest daughter help her dividing the work. While she serves clients her husband makes purchases and her daughter helps her to arrange and clean the products.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy basic grains, soft drinks, meat, chicken, and eggs. She also wants to invest by buying clothing, shoes, and cosmetics because during the holiday season the products are of high demand among her customers.

She plans to move her store to a larger place and to add the sales of clothing, perfume, and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, meat, chicken, and eggs for her grocery store

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 27-year-old, married man, and the father of one child. In addition to supporting his wife and child, Jihad had to take full responsibility for supporting his mother, and start working since his father left Lebanon. He is the whole family's sole breadwinner. 

He has been working in a construction business since seven years ago. He is specialized in painting houses and is an expert in his domain. Jihad is a hard worker, who puts much effort into developing his business, to provide his family a better living. Like almost all Palestinian refugees, he doesn't have a wide variety of business opportunities to seize -- that's why he has to develop what's available and improve it to be the best.

Jihad is requesting a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to perform necessary maintenance on his house. He needs to keep it a healthy living place for his beloved family. This is his second cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, and he has a good standing repayment history. His previous loan helped him a lot in his business, by enabling him to renew his working tools. He hopes to stay capable of replying to his big family's needs, as much as he can.

loans.use: To perform necessary maintenance on his house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase furniture and food ingredients, and thus to expand the services of the family restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy Le 1,000,000 worth of soft drinks and Le 2,000,000 worth of alcoholic drinks.

loans.name: Aleksandar

texts.en:
Aleksandar is married lives in a minority community. He is the father of two children. For more than one year now he has owned his own business producing the food for animals such as cows chickens and goats. He uses vitamin corn and wheat for producing the food for these animals. He works from home where he has a shop. 

Currently there is not much or any competition in this business and he is able to sell often and to repeat customers. He sells his product in his area and has a high demand for his product. He is requesting a loan in order to buy components for producing the animal food.The loan will help him to increase his business. His goal is to employ in the future another member of his family.

He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy components for producing animal food

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 45 year old Fatmata. She is married and has 2 children, ages 21 and 17. She has one additional dependent that was adopted from a friend. In 1997, Fatmata established her ladies sandals and slippers business. She began her business because she wants to less budding for her husband and also to be respected among family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy new fashioned ladies sandals and slippers worth Le 4,000,000.She hopes that this loan will help her increase her monthly profit of approximately Le 1,000,000. In the future, Fatmata plans to rent to better conducive business place as she has more customers so as to entertain them well. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy new fashioned ladies sandals and slippers worth Le 4,000,000.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris 26, who lives in the municipality of Mombasa, is a marrried parent with one child.  She has been working very hard in managing her business for the past three years.

Peris has a food stall where she sells African dishes. Some difficulties she faces is the low sales during the rainy season. She makes profits when she sells because of her good interaction with her customers. She is requesting her second loan from Yehu to purchase more flour, sugar, meat, eggs, milk for the business. Her plan for the future is to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, meat, eggs, milk for the business.

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 29 years old. He has owned a boutique for ten months. He sells different merchandise such as soaps, salt, cooking oil and maize flour. 

With the loan, he wants to add more items for sale. The profits from the business will be used buy a house for his residence.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is taking out a new loan to make improvements in her business. Thanks for the previous loan that enabled her to increase stocks in her retail shop. This way she was able to provide a variety of products for her customers. 

Her inventory has gone down, but she does not have enough working capital to rebuild it. This is why she turned to Yehu again to ask for a new loan to add stocks of foodstuffs, basic grains, medicines, and other instant goods.

loans.use: to add stocks of foodstuffs, basic grains, medicines, and other instant goods.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 35 years old and a mixed crop farmer.  He is married to Penninah, who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children, ages 12, nine, and five years.  He has been in the farming business for the past ten years, earning KES 18,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. David will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to export his farm produce and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 26 years old.  She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she wants to add more clothes for sale. 

She plans to use the profits for building a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old and a business lady.  She is a single mother of three children. 

She has been selling second-hand clothes as a primary business and also cake baking for the past nine years, with the monthly income of KES 21,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan term from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Jane will use the loan to buy more stocks of clothes and wheat flour. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy land for farming and dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and wheat flour.

loans.name: Karen Angelica

texts.es:
Karen originaria de Estelí, con 23  años, acompañada, madre de 1 hijo el cual tiene  6 años de edad, de oficio comerciante. Ella Inicio con su tía vendiendo ropa, la cual le ayudo para que se independizara y pusiera su propio negocio con un capital propio que ella había ahorrado y con un pequeño préstamo que hizo. Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella ha logrado  salir adelante con la ayuda de su esposo, ya que este ha sido su único negocio, en el que espera seguir creciendo económicamente para obtener mejores ingresos.
Karen solicita el préstamo para comprar  ropa como, pantalones, camisas, zapatos, etc. Ya que ella considera que al comprar más producto, podrá surtir  su negocio de ropa y asi incrementar sus ganancias, ya que se acerca la temporada navideña, en donde la demanda de sus productos crecen, su deseo es prepararse con los pedidos que le hacen los clientes, sus planes futuro es mejorar sus ventas y poder tener mas producto en inventarios.
texts.en: Karen is a 23 year old woman who is originally from Estelí. She lives with her spouse and is the mother of a 6 year old son. She works in retail. Karen started selling clothing with her aunt, who helped her to become independent and start her own business, raising her own capital by saving and taking a small loan. Since she started selling clothing, she has succeeded in moving ahead with the support of her spouse, and this is their only business. She hopes to continue growing her business and increasing her income. Karen is applying for this loan to purchase clothing such as pants, shirts, shoes, etc. Karen believes that by increasing her inventory, she will be able to stock her business well and increase profits. Because the holiday season is approaching and the demand for her products will grow, she would like to prepare to be able to fulfill her customers' orders. Her future plans are to increase her sales and to be able to have more products in inventory.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as pants, shirts, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Aydibegim

texts.ru: Айдибегиму 29 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. У нее очень трудное экономическое и моральное состояние семьи. Ее муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию как трудовой мигрант, и не помогает Айдибегиму деньгами для обеспечения детей. Айдибегим сама старается обеспечить детей и не надеется на мужа. Она должна купить продукты питания, одежду для себя и для детей, дрова и уголь для зимовки, оплатить за учебу детей и прочие расходы, которые требуют массу средств. Даже ее родители не могут помочь ей, так как их доход не позволяет для этого. Айдибегим сосредоточилась своими идеями и решила организовать свой бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес животноводством, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Айдибегим и ее девочка ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Aydibegim is 29 years old. She is married and raising two children. Her family lives under some very difficult economic and psychological conditions.  Her husband left for the Russian Federation to find employment as a migrant worker but he is not sending any money to help provide for the children.  She therefore tries to support the family by herself, without counting on any help from her husband.  She, alone, buys food, clothes for herself and the children, wood and coal for the winter.  She, alone, also has to pay for the children's school fees and to cover other expenses which require a lot of money.  She doesn't receive any money from her parents either, because their small income does not allow them to help.

After looking at her options, Aydibegim has decided to focus on setting up her own business.  To this end, she enrolled in a course entitled "Achieving Success", organized by the Association of Business Women, and from which she has earned a certificate.  She can now start her business for good and become a successful entrepreneur.  She wants to get involved in animal husbandry, because she has experience in this field.  She will use her earnings to give her children a good education and to ensure that they eat a high-calorie diet.  

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy livestock to start her new business.  Aydibegim and her daughter are awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Khurmo

texts.en:
Khurmo is married and has 3 children who are 3, 6 and 9 years old. She's always wanted to provide them with a good education. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Khurmo decided to start a new business buying and selling chickens in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

She studied the course, ‘To get ahead,' at the women's organization and has enough skills to run this business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy chickens for organizing her new business. Her business earnings will be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy chickens for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Lovette Kinnie's Group

texts.en:
Greetings are coming to you from this group of teachers from the village of Blama. These teachers received a Kiva loan of 5,600,000 Leones, which they have repaid successfully. The 5,600,000 Leones loan has created a significant impact in the lives of these borrowers. Some of them were able to pay school fees for their children, others invested theirs in business, and so on. 

Today, they are requesting a new loan of 18,400,000 Leones in order to further improve their living conditions. Lovette remains the featured leader of this group of teachers. Lovette is going to use her share of this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 35-year-old married woman with no children. She has been working as a hair dresser since June 2011, to increase her family's income and help her husband in making their living. She also seeks to fill her free time in something useful.
Khadija is Al Majmoua borrower for four consecutive cycles, with a good standing paying back history.
All of her previous loans were invested in her business development, and it was revealed when she moved her business from home to a special beauty shop she is proud to have.
Today the requested loan will be used for a different reason, she will pay for her infertility treatment seeking  a child that will fill their life. This artificial insemination costs a lot, but they can't handle not to do it to make their dream come true.
