She hopes that she gets what she wants and to expand her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To pay for her infertility treatment

loans.name: Edouard

texts.en: Edouard is 53 years old. He is married with six children. He sells foodstuffs. He would like to get a loan, for buying more sorghum, and beans for sale. With the profits from the business will reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for two Fresh Life toilets for commercial purposes

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is taking out another loan to expand her tailoring business. She says thanks for the previous loan that helped to increase her sales. She has a good credit reference and therefore can be entrusted with more loans. Nancy is a woman who always utilizes every opportunity it comes across. The new loan will enable her to buy more fabrics to make garments so as to settle the array of orders she currently has. She is sure to increase sales even as we approach the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics to make garments

loans.name: Ferat

texts.en:
Ferat is fifty-two years old, married and has two children, a boy and a girl ages seven and nine years old. Both of them go to school. They all live in a village in northern part of Kosovo. Ferat has been keeping cows for a long time as based on his family tradition. 
He has always sold milk and other dairy products in his area which help him to earn for living. For the first time, Ferat is requesting a loan in order to buy another milk cow. The loan will contribute to his business because he will be able to sell more milk and products in his area. His goal is to expand his farm.
In the future he hopes to have a better life and give children better education.
Ferat thanks Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy another milk cow

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is still engaged in toys and presents trading business. With her previous loan from Kiva Liana added her toy assortment and sold it during Christmas Holydays. She received a good profit which helped her to solve her family needs and to develop her business during this period.    
She is very shining and kind person and that’s way she has her regular customers which prefer to buy toys and presents from Liana’s shop because her goods are ecological clean and safely for their children. Whole working time you can meet a lot of happy children and parents which are choosing toys and presents for them.
Liana asks for Kiva 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy and import a new toy and presents assortment from United Arab Emirates for Christmas and New Year big sales season.

loans.use: To buy and import a new toy and presents assortment from United Arab Emirates for Christmas and New Year big sales season

loans.name: Phillis

texts.en:
Phillis is aged thirty four farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and five children (four of them are in schooling). She has been in farming for over ten years producing cereals and selling them at the local market. She is employed as an additional source of income.

She is requesting for 30,000 KES loan from juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats that will help her earn extra income from selling the milk and hence better standards of living and help in paying for her children's school fees, she aspires to be the best goat milk supplier in her area in the next five years.

Lack of enough capital and poor market are her major challenges in farming.

She likes Juhudi Kilimo for it's faster processing of loans.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Mireille

texts.en: Mireille is aged 29. She is married to a motorist. They have three children who all go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for 10 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more foodstuffs such as beans, cabbages and sweet potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Feime

texts.en:
Feime is 20 years old and an Ashkali woman from the vulnerable ethnic minority community. She is married and has one child, who is four years old. Her husband has worked as an auto mechanic for more than three years.  She is a housewife raising her child. 

They all live under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. Feime’s family owns a small old house, and it has not had any repairs or renovations in the past several years.  Her house has a heat-loss/insulation problem. Every winter it costs a lot of money to buy coal to keep this house warm. During the winter, her house becomes very cold, and her child always gets sick. 

It is very beneficial for her family to live comfortably and to stay warm at home. Now Feime is requesting a loan . After repairing the house, Feime will have better living conditions for the family. Feime appreciates Kiva and promises that she will pay on time.

loans.use: To buy windows and doors to repair her house.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 27 years old. She is married and has two children. 

She sells foodstuffs in her store. She wants a loan to buy rice and maize flour for sale. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: C20013 Inyagaruzi Group

texts.en:
Germain is 36 years old and married, with three children ages between 3 and 8 years old. 

He owns an agriculture business selling rice, which is open from 6  a.m. until 1 p.m. daily, except on the weekend. 

Germain currently employs four people to help him, and he has four years of experience in this work. He is the leader of the group called "C20013 INYAGARUZI" in the local language; he is raising his hand in the photo.

Germain has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to buy more fertilizer for his field and for getting more rice to sell. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for his field and for getting more rice to sell.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en:
Alexandre is 34 years old.  He sells wood and has been in the business for three years. 

With the loan, he wants to buy more timber so he can make more wood for sale. He plans to use the profits to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sale.

loans.name: Momo

texts.en: The desire to get ahead is a dream to most people, including Momo who has been selling clothes for some time. She is an active woman who has all the desired enterprising skills. She also currently runs a restaurant. Both businesses are doing well. She wants to make some improvements in her restaurants but she does not have enough working capital to do so. This loan will enable her to buy ingredients like wheat flour, corn flour, rice, beans etc. This way she will have the needed ingredients in stock to prepare what the customers want.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, corn flour, rice, beans etc.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 58 years old and widowed. She sells sorghum and has been running the business for 8 years. She would like to get the loan to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 35 years old. She sells animals and has been in the business for 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cows for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more cows for sale.

loans.name: Josette

texts.en: Josette aged 28. She is married and has two children, all go to school. She owns a boutique where she sells different items. With the loan, she would like to add salt, rice, and soaps for sale. She plans to use the profits for buying a house.

loans.use: To buy more salt, rice and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is very responsible, clean, and dedicated to doing the best in her job. 

She is applying for another loan so she can renovate her stall. She intends to buy iron sheets and some timbers. This way she is sure to provide a conducive environment for her customers.  

The previous loan helped her to increase sales.She expects to increase sales even more.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and some timbers to renovate her stall.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
The desire to improve is one of Nelson's most important dreams.  He’s an active, enterprising man who is dedicated to his work and who has many goals he wants to reach. He’s working hard to attain a more prosperous future for his family. 

He feels very happy with his business, but knows that he has to make it grow if he’s to rise out of poverty.

He is asking for a new loan to expand his transport business. He will use the loan to repair his tuk-tuk, a three-wheeled motor vehicle. He is grateful for the previous loan, which had great positive impact on his living standards. His goal is to buy a taxi.

loans.use: to repair his tuk-tuk three-wheeler.

loans.name: Jenet

texts.en:
Jenet is 42 years old and a hardworking mother.  She lives at Congo Town with her husband and three children, between
the ages of 12 and 18; all are currently in school. 

For the past five years, she has been selling fish at the community market.  She sells snapper, cassava fish and bonnie fish. She makes profit when she sells because she always have the type of fish her customers love. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business. Her dream for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of raw fish for her business.

loans.name: Advije

texts.en:
Avdije is a hairdresser. She is 34 years old and lives in the Ashkali community in Kosovo. She is married and has four children. 

Until now, she has worked as a hairdresser on call who would travel to the client when she had requests for her service.
 
Advije now is in need of a loan of Euro 2,000 to open her own hair salon in her house. With the loan, she will buy inventory and tables and chairs. The loan will develop her business and increase the number of her clients. She uses her income to support her family. 

She hopes that this loan will improve her business and allow her to attract more clients. In the future, she plans to develop her business more. Her goal is to give her children a better life.

Knowing that is Kiva loan, she wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy inventory, tables, and chairs for her shop

loans.name: Fetije

texts.en:
Fetije is thirty-four years old, married and is the mother of seven children aged between the ages of two and fifteen years old. She is a house-wife and her husband works in a private agriculture company, cultivating potatoes. They have tried several times to save the money but something else more important has always occurred that has caused them to spend the money elsewhere. 

As they have seven children, they have a lot of expenses and they have difficulties in saving money. Fetije is in need of leveling the rooms and isolations. The loan will help improve the living conditions. She hopes in the future to find a job and to increase the income for her family. She and her family want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To do leveling the rooms and isolations

loans.name: Xevera

texts.en: Xevera is 42 years old. She sells different items in a boutique for which she has been running for 4 years. She wants the loan for adding more volume of the sales such as soaps, cooking oil and sugar. The profits that she expects will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: Buy more items for her shop such as cooking oil, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tomatoes and cabbage for selling.

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en: Anjeline is asking for a new loan so that she can expand her business. She wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed for her poultry business. What she started as a trial business has turned out to have tremendous growth. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to send her children to school. She wants to see her business flourish and open new outlets in the future.The previous loan helped her have enough feed and treatments for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy baby cows

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a mother who is very responsible and dedicated to her home, with a great desire to improve in life. She lives in her own house with her family: her husband and their two children.

Rehema works hard selling seasonal fruits and vegetables in the market, where she has done this for many years, growing little by little. Because her needs are now greater, she is requesting a loan from Yehu, with which she can buy a greater variety of seasonal fruits and vegetables wholesale at lower prices and thus make better profits. Rehema has high hopes for this loan as she hopes to improve greatly.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Al-Adl Group

texts.en: This group, called Al-Adl, consists of 4 ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. Antsar is a 25-year-old single woman. She is a clever, and treats people with good humor. She is also a hardworking woman who aims to live a comfortable life. Her portion of the group loan, a youth loan of 40,000 YER, will be used to buy furniture for her house. She hopes  to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: At 40 years old and married with four children, Steven is basically a farmer in a rural western district of Uganda. His is the only source of income for the family. He sells milk as well as ghee from cows to improve his family's welfare. He only has a small piece of land on which he is doing the grazing. This has affected his productivity in terms of yields of milk. Therefore, he wants to add on to his piece of land, so that his now malnourished cows can get more grazing grass. He hopes to get another loan and buy more cows so that he is able to make enough income to pay his children's school fees. He is very hardworking and a social member of the community.

loans.use: to buy land for grazing the cows.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is 28 years old, and a high school graduate. She has three children ages 4, 8, and 10 who are in school and live at home.  She is running a gas station in the area of New Kru town, where she lives. She has had this business for the past seven years, and makes lots of profits since she is the only female who sells gasoline in her community. Her profits are used for rent, feeling, school fees, and to improve her savings account. Some problems Deborah faces in her business are road conditions and the cost of transporting products to her gas station. She started this business with ten gallons of gasoline in her front yard since she lives closed to the road, and the money for it was given to her by her late father, who was also selling gas. Deborah is requesting a loan to buy more gasoline to sell. Her plan is to expand her business by opening another branch.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Mwakame

texts.en:
Mwakame is 32 years old and lives in the rural area of Msambweni. She is married with five children. Mwakame has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for seven months.

Mwakame has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy stock of foodstuffs, detergents and soft drinks. In the future, she hopes to improve her business so she can support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stock of foodstuffs, detergents and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a sociable, patient lady who likes helping other people. She’s widowed and has five children. She lives with her family in her own house in the rural community of Mwambalazi.

She has a clothing-selling business, having started it  to provide for her children. Her income is not enough to provide for a good quality of life. 

This will be her fourth loan through Yehu.  She will use it to buy merchandise such as t-shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, and warmers, among other things, now that the Christmas season is approaching. She wants to take advantage of the season and generate a good income through her sales. 

This will allow her to improve her children’s and family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as t-shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, and warmers, among other things

loans.name: Minever M

texts.en:
Minever, who is 43 years old, resides with her husband and three children at Congo Town.  Her children are between the ages of 8 and 20; two of the children attend school.  She would like to give all her children the best of education, but she lacks financial support. 

She has been involved in her business for the past ten years.  She has a warehouse where she sells coal wholesale and retail in her community. She makes a profit when she sells,  Some difficulties she faces are the rainy season and the transporting of  goods from the bush to Monrovia.

She has requested a loan to purchase more coal in bulk for her business.  She hopes to educate her children and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more coal in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Tusubira Dev't Group-Najjera

texts.en: Alex, age 31 and married, is the only male in a female-dominated group. He joined the group because he believes women are trustworthy and hard-working, so he thought would take a page from their book and improve his livelihood and that of his family. Alex repairs shoes in the outskirts of his city, near a market. He started repairing shoes after realising there were no such services in the area, and yet the shoes bought by the low income earners in that area are not durable and therefore need constant repair. With the income from his repairs, Alex has been able to send two of his children to school. With the loan, he will buy a batch of old shoes, shoe polish and thread to increase his daily income. His dream is to change his business by buying a motorcycle; then if he accumulates enough profits, the motorcycle would help him to buy a plot of land and later build a house for his family. He is hard-working and forward-looking.

loans.use: To buy old shoes, shoe polish and thread for repairing shoes

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 35-year-old farmer in Kitale county, where he lives with his wife and four children, three of whom go to school. He has been in farming for the past five years, producing horticultural crops, milk, and poultry products which he sells locally. He runs a retail shop as an additional source of income. John is requesting 52,000 KES to buy and insure a dairy cow, which will increase his production and hence provide him with more income that will improve his livelihood and help him pay for his children's school fees. He plans to double his production in the next five years. Marketing, drought and the high cost of farm inputs are his greatest business challenges. He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the support.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, 40, is single with three children that are between the ages of 12 and 24, and are in school. 

Hannah has been selling bread at the nearby community school for the past five years. She likes to do this business because she attends to the needs of her children and buys more goods for the business with the profit generated from the business.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar and cooking oil for the business. She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married. She owns a poultry farm – a business which she has been operating for two years. She employs two other people in this business. Her main challenge is the threat of poultry diseases, which can kill a whole batch, and the high cost of feeds. 

Josphine learnt about Milango from an employee who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Josphine is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy chicks and poultry farm equipment. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the standard of living of her family and pay for her children’s fee requirements. Her dream is to see her business grow into a bigger business, so she can be supplying many places – especially the hotels.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry farm equipment.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid has witnessed much growth from the loan he received. His business has expanded and he is now applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to increase his stock of new phones and accessories. The field has now become more lucrative. He believes he can continue to grow his business further.

loans.use: to buy repair tools, mobile phone accessories and a few phones.

loans.name: Ndinda

texts.en:
Ndinda is a resident of the Changamwe area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two school-age children.  

Ndinda owns a retail shop that she has been running for five years. Ndinda began the business with a loan she obtained from a friend. In this shop, she sells sugar, flour, cereals, etc. The family also receives some income from her husband’s income.

She learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and high cost of stock.   

Ndinda is applying for a loan of KES 83,500 to purchase sugar, flour, cereals, etc., for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on her living standards. She aspires to own a wholesale business in future and plan for her children’s education with much security.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, and cereals for sale.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is a hardware owner. His business has been in operation for four years. He is a married father of four school-age children. He joined Milango two years ago to access credit for business expansion. 

He is applying for a loan of KES 41,850 to buy hardware stock, like timber and paints. Besides this business, Anthony is also a plumbing contractor. The main challenges to both businesses are high transportation costs and lack of capital for business expansion. 

Anthony’s future aspiration is to sell the products both retail and wholesale.  He believes he can run the businesses fairly and buy a transportation machine from the additional income obtained from this loan. He is happy over such investment, for he knows this will help him provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy hardware stock, like timber and paints.

loans.name: Edna Margarita

texts.es: Edna de 44 años de edad se dedica a educar niños en un jardín infantil de su propiedad, el cual inició su experiencia desde hace 8 años, cuando termino sus estudios de prescolar y se empleó como docente, pero teniendo la convicción de que algún día tendría su propio jardín infantil y solo hasta el 2009 dio marcha a su idea de negocio, de la cual se siente muy feliz y con el firme propósito de hacerlo crecer. Su actividad la inicia desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la 1:30 de la tarde cuando entrega a los niños a los padres de familia. Su meta mas adelante, es tener una sede propia y por eso se esmera en su trabajo diariamente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual realizará adecuaciones a su planta física, con el fin de hacer mantenimiento a sus instalaciones, comprar estantería y material didáctico para modernizar su jardín y brindarle a los niños, la mejor comodidad y una mayor calidad en su aprendizaje.
texts.en:
Edna is 44 years old. She earns a living teaching children in her own nursery school. Her experience began 8 years ago when she completed her studies in Early Childhood Education and got a teaching job. During this time she maintained the conviction that one day she would have her own nursery school. She put her business idea into action in 2009. This has made her very happy and she is strongly committed to making her nursery grow. She works from 7am until she hands the children over to their parents at 1:30pm. 

Her goal for the future is to have her own locale. In order to do achieve this she puts great effort into her work on a daily basis. She is currently applying for a loan, with which she will modify the floor of the building in order to perform maintenance on its facilities, to buy shelving and teaching material to modernize her nursery and to offer the children greater comfort and a higher quality of learning.

loans.use: to modify the floor of the building in order to perform maintenance on its facilities; to buy shelves and teaching material.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 32-year-old single man who has worked in the construction business for six years. He started his own business in 2011. Khaled is a hardworking Palestinian, and he is devoted to his business in order to expand it and improve his living. He specializes in painting walls and ceilings. He is an expert as his customers describe him.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to complete necessary maintenance on his dream house for the beloved family he is working hard to have.

This is his first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes that it will be an important experience for a future partnership.

He hopes that he will be capable of buying his own house outside the Palestinian refugee camp and develop his business more.

loans.use: to complete necessary maintenance on his house

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi is grateful for the first loan he received. His business grew much, and he plans to capitalize on the limited stock still available from some farmers to sell over the coming festive season. He is therefore applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of cereals for sale. He believes come next year, he can invest in farming.

loans.use: to buy some cereal products for resale

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: The retail shop Magdalene has is improving, giving her the much needed income for the education of her children. She is grateful for the first loan she received since this gave her the impetus to grow the business. She is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenya shillings to purchase additional retail stock like sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, and soft drinks. She believes this will definitely help her children complete their schooling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock of cosmetics and purchase shavers.

loans.name: Muurya

texts.en: Muurya, a businessman in Mombasa, has seen much growth in his business. He is grateful for the link with Milango through the group members who gave him an opportunity to expand his business by accessing loans and increasing his income. Muuryra is applying for a loan of 104,800 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of ladies' accessories like clips, braids, makeup, etc. and targets the customers visiting the town over the festive season. He believes he can repeat and surpass the performance of last year.

loans.use: o purchase additional stock of ladies' accessories like clips, braids, etc.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter de 35 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su conviviente Jakeline,  quien se dedica a la venta de pescado, pero también es su socia  en la actividad que realiza. Tienen 3 hijos a quienes   cuidan,  protege y y esperan poder brindarles una buena educación. El trabajo de Walter consiste en la siembra y cosecha de palma aceitera, se dedica al arado de la tierra, la fertiliza, etc. comenta que cuando sus plantas están en pleno proceso de crecimiento es necesario el riego continuo por el intenso calor que hay en la ciudad. También tiene que cuidarlas de las plagas que atacan a esta especie de palmera.  El lugar donde realiza su trabajo esta a 50 kilómetros de la ciudad en una comunidad conocida como “Neshuya”, aquí tiene 12 hectáreas de terreno los cuales esta cultivando y arando para la siembra.  Se inició en esta actividad  porque la mayoría de personas que viven en esta comunidad se dedican a este trabajo y hay facilidades que da el gobierno para conseguir semilla de esta planta.  Junto a su conviviente y  2 obreros los cuales contrata se dedican a la siembra, cuidado y cosecha de estas plantas. Considera rentable su negocio porque las “Fabricas Aceiteras” están pagando un buen precio por la fruta de esta planta. Antes de comenzar esta actividad  tenía problemas  para generar ingresos económicos y no podía mantener a su familia porque  que no tenia empleo fijo, por eso tomo la decisión de empezar su propia actividad económica y generar sus propios ingresos. Espera en el futuro acrecentar su producción e incrementar sus ganancias económicas. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, tiene muchas ganas de seguir siendo un socio puntual. Además sabe que el grupo que conforma  son personas amables y respetuosas. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles lo utilizará para la compra  de abono, fertilizantes, etc. también comprará herramientas como machete, hacha, entre otros. Y  pagará a los obreros que le ayudan en esta  actividad.
texts.en:
Walter is 35 and lives in his own home with his wife Jakeline, who makes a living by selling fish but is also his partner in his business.  They have 3 children for whom they care, protect and hope to be able to offer a good education.  Walter grows and harvests palm oil.  He plows and fertilizes the land.  He tells us that when his plants are in the process of growing, it's necessary to irrigate them continuously because of the heat in the city.  He also has to protect them from pests that attack this species of palm.  He does his work 50 kilometers from the city in a community known as "Neshuya."  Here he has 12 hectares of land, which he is cultivating and plowing for planting.

He started this business because the majority of people who live in this community do this work.  The government makes it easy to obtain seeds for this plant.  He does this work with his wife and two workers that he hires to plant, care for, and harvest his plants.  Before he started this business, he had problems generating economic income and couldn't support his family because he didn't have a steady job.  This is why he decided to start his own business to generate his own income.  He hopes in the future to increase his production and to increase his economic earnings.  This will be his fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  He wants to keep making his payments on time.  He also knows that the group is made up of friendly and respectful people.  With the 1,500 PEN requested, he will buy manure, fertilizers, and tools like a machete, ax, etc.  And he will pay the workers that help him with his work.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, and tools like a machete and an ax.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has four children and has been farming for 12 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops. The animal on her farm has been given the name "Toto". She says what is most enjoyable about farming is "Gardening!" Her biggest challenge is price fluctuations. Her highest monthly expense is school fees. She will use this loan to buy a chuff cutter to ease the feeding of her dairy cows.

Caroline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Reasonable interest rates." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session.  "How to save for future use." When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?", Caroline replied, "Help pay fees for my children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Caroline owns the following: cow, poultry and bicycle, but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD.

======================================

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 5 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is Dairy farming. Her biggest challenge is, "Feeding the animals." her cow on the farm has been given the name Chemaluk.

Joseline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Because of their efficiency."  She was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "That they want to uplift the farmer."  

She will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked  how this loan will benefit her family, Joseline replied,  "Improved quality of life through provision of basic needs."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Joseline owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a bicycle but does not own a pig, a water pump, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net in the household but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 5 children and has been doing this work for 7 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Animal keeping!" Her biggest challenge is "Dealing with middle men." The animal on the farm have been given the named Telmet. She says the loan will help her increase the number of dairy animals and increase milk production.
Josephine was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "They deal with farmers."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "About the savings culture."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how will this loan benefit her family?, She replied "Improve our lives."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Josephine owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a bicycle. She does not own a pig, a water pump, a motorcycle, or an automobile. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net in the household but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth de  27 años, es una mujer alegre y soñadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Segundo, quien trabaja en un aserradero y también es socio de su negocio. Crían a sus 2 hijos a quienes desea darle una muy buena educación y calidad de vida. El trabajo de Lizbeth consiste en la venta  de productos de panadería como  galletas de naranja, pan de molde, manjares, mermeladas, etc. Compra estos productos de una distribuidora conocida con el  nombre de “Productos Unión”. Realiza la distribución  de su mercadería de puerta en puerta, ofrece a sus familiares, vecinos entre otros. Se inició en esta actividad  porque su  mamá le comento que este negocio era rentable, podía  manejar su  horario de trabajo y  estar con sus hijos. Su esposo le ayuda a distribuir su mercadería, la lleva en su  moto a los distintos lugares donde sus productos son solicitados. Comenta que su negocio es rentable por que si logra vender toda su mercadería gana el 50%. Por ello se esfuerza para repartir  totalmente todos sus productos. Comenta que  antes de empezar su negocio tenia ganas de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos cotidianos, pero no podía, por no contar con un empleo. Pero da gracias a su mamá que la ayudo a emprender en esta actividad que le permite generar ganancias económicas. Espera en el futuro tener  más clientes y contar con una movilidad propia para su  transportarse. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número  2 con la institución MFP, si siente  bien en su grupo, porque  a pesar de ser nueva la gente es amable con ella y la apoyan en lo que necesita. Esta agradecida con la institución porque le brindan un capital de respaldo.
Con el monto solicitado  1000 lo utilizará como capital para comprar  mayor cantidad de productos tales como galletas de naranja, pan de molde, manjares, mermeladas, entre otros. Ya que comprando en mayor volumen le dan a menos precio, entonces incrementará sus ganancias económicas.
texts.en: Lizbeth is 27 years old. She is a dreamer and a very happy woman. She lives in her own home together with her second husband who works in a sawmill and is also her business partner. She is raising two children for whom she hopes to provide a good education and quality of life. Lizbeth works selling baked goods such as orange biscuits, loaves of bread, manjar (a traditional dessert dish similar to pudding), marmalade, etc. She purchases these products from a well-known distributor called Productos Union. She works selling these products door to door, selling them to relatives, neighbors, and others. She got started in this line of work at her mother's suggestion that it was profitable, provided a flexible work schedule, and would allow her to be with her children. Her husband helps her distribute her goods, giving her a ride to the areas where her products are in demand. She notes that her business is indeed profitable because if she manages to sell all her merchandise she earns 50%. For this reason she works hard to get rid of all her goods. She describes how before she got into this line of work she had had a desire to help her husband with the daily expenses, but she was not able to because she didn't have a job. She is thankful for her mother who helped her get started in this work which allows her to earn income. She hopes to build her customer base in the future and to purchase her own vehicle for work. This will be her second loan with MFP. She enjoys working with this group because, despite being new, the people are kind to her and they assist her when she is in need. She is grateful for MFP for the financial support that it provides. The money requested will be used to purchase greater quantities of product such as orange biscuits, loaves of bread, manjar, marmalade, and other items. Because she will be able to purchase in bulk at a lower price, the income she earns will increase.

loans.use: to purchase orange biscuits, loaves of bread, and marmalade.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 10 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops.

She stated that Dairy farming is the most enjoying part of farming for her. Her biggest challenge is, "finding animal feed during the dry season." Her cow on the farm have been given the name White Udder. She has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow.

Esther was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Because they have dairy loans."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "How to do farming as a business."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Esther replied, "More disposable income for the family, thus an improved quality of life."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Esther owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a bicycle but does not own:  a pig, a water pump, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net, electricity, TV, and a DVD player in the household but does not have solar power, running water, or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José tiene 57 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 2 hijos, reside en compañía de su familia en el municipio  de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortes.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la comercialización de maíz y frijoles. En  este momento él continúa con la venta de maíz en menor escala y la recolección y venta de chatarra y productos para reciclaje como: cobre, aluminio, hierro, bronce, cartón y plástico.Su esposa se dedica a la confeccion de prendas de vestir.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,500 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de productos reciclables y la compra de maíz por quintal para su respectiva venta.
El apoyo financiero le servirá para negociar más producto y obtener mayores ganancias que piensa utilizar para mejorar su vivienda y brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old and lives with his common-law wife and their two children. He and his family reside in the town of San Pedro Sula, Department of Cortes.

José previously sold corn and beans. At the moment, he continues to sell corn on a smaller scale, but he also collects and sells scrap metal and recyclable materials such as aluminum, iron, bronze, cardboard, and plastic. His wife devotes her time to making clothes.

José is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 5,500 HNL. He plans to invest in recyclable materials and the purchase of corn by the “quintal” (1 quintal = 46 kg.) that he can sell. This financial support will help supply more products for his business so that he can generate better earnings. He plans to use the profits to improve his home and to provide a better education for his children.

loans.use: to buy corn and recyclable materials such as aluminum, iron, bronze, cardboard, and plastic.

loans.name: Deniza

texts.es:
Deniza de 65 años,  es una mujer alegre y esforzada, esta casada con Regner quien es socio de la actividad a la cual se dedica. Viven en su casa propia y crían a su nieto  el cual esta en la universidad.
El trabajo de Deniza consiste  en la siembra de productos agrícolas tales como limón, mandarina y naranja, asimismo está preparando 2 piscigranjas  para la cría de  peces de la selva tales como, Paiche, Gamitada, Paco entre otros.  El lugar donde realiza  la actividad  de siembra y cosecha de su producto está al frente de  su vivienda, cuenta con 8 hectáreas de terreno para está labor. Lleva 22 años en la siembra y cosecha  de productos cítricos. Se inició  en esta actividad desde muy jovencita cuando contrajo matrimonio decidió ayudar su esposo quien  ya era agricultor y se dedicaba principalmente  a la siembra de productos cítricos. Comenta que  realiza el arado de la tierra,  la siembra, el riego, la cosecha junto a su esposo, su nieto y 2 obreros. Luego junto a su esposo transportan el producto al mercado. Considera rentable  su  labor por la buena producción de distintas especies  de limones que cosecha. Que  son muy solicitados por los clientes. Al iniciarse en este rubro tuvo problemas con la plagas que atacan estas plantas, pero las fue erradicando con buenos insecticidas y cuidado continuo. Espera seguir adelante en este negocio y continuar con buen éxito en sus planes futuros. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número  19 con la institución MFP, tiene muchas ganas de seguir con su grupo ya que tiene buena amistad con todos los socios, quienes se apoyan mutuamente y  tratan de estar puntuales en todas sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado 4000 soles, lo utilizará para comprar abono, fertilizantes y algunos implementos tales como palas, picos, machetes, entre otros. Para un mejor cultivo y cuidado de sus plantas. Y  tener  una mejor y abundante producción.
texts.en:
Deniza is 65 years old; she is a happy and strong woman. She’s married to Regner, who is a partner in the work that she does. They live in their own house and are raising their grandson, who is in college. 

Deniza’s work consists of selling agricultural products, such as limes, mandarins and oranges, as well as preparing 2 fish farms for raising fish from the forest like paiche, gamitada, and paco, among others. The place where she sells and harvests her products is in front of her home; she has 8 hectares of land for this work. 

She’s been growing and harvesting citrus products for 22 years. She started in this work since she was very young; when she got married, she decided to help her spouse, who was already a farmer and mainly worked selling citrus products. She says that she does the plowing of the land, the planting, irrigation, and the harvesting together with her husband, her grandson, and 2 workers. Later, along with her spouse, they transport the product to the market. 

She feels that her work is profitable because of the good production of different species of limes that she harvests, which are very popular among her customers. Upon starting out in this field, she had problems with the pests that attack these plants, but she eradicated them with good insecticides and constant care. 

She hopes to get ahead in this business and continue with great success in her future plans. Therefore, this will be her 19th loan with the organization MFP. She has many hopes of continuing with the group, since she has good friendships with all the members, who mutually support each other and try to be punctual in all their payments. 

With the requested loan of 4000 soles, she will use it to purchase fertilizers and some tools, such as such as shovels, pickaxes, and machetes, among others, for better cultivation and care of her plants, and to have a better and abundant production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and some tools, such as shovels, pickaxes, and machetes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.es:
Cacilda de  48 años, es una mujer  alegre y  emprendedora.  Es viuda, su esposo murió hace 17 años. Vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijos quienes están estudiando en la universidad. 
El trabajo  de Cacilda consiste en confecciones de ropas interiores de damas, caballeros y niños. También  teje bolsones, zapatos, manteles entre otros. Tiene una maquina de coser que es la herramienta principal de su actividad. Su trabajo lo realiza en un local en el interior de su  casa propia. Lleva 2 años confeccionando y le agrada lo que hace, porque tiene tiempo de estar junto a sus seres queridos.  Considera rentable su negocio ya que tiene muchos clientes y siempre la están recomendando por  el buen  trabajo que realiza.Se inició en esta actividad por la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos para apoyar a sus hijos con los gastos en sus estudios, sus hijos le ayudan en la venta y distribución de su producción. Antes de empezar este negocio tenía una pequeña tienda y daba fiado a sus vecinos, los cuales no le pagaron por los productos consumidos “la estafaron”. Perdió su capital  por este suceso. Decidió cambiar de negocio, tuvo la idea  de realizar lo que siempre le gustaba que era confecciona y tejer. No contaba con el dinero necesario, así que vendió alguno de sus  electrodomésticos para tener un capital de respaldo.  Espera tener mayor producción porque tiene un gran número de clientes. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP, esta muy agradecida con la institución porque la ayudan a crecer como microempresaria  y también como persona.
Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles lo invertirá comprando  hilos, telas, blondas  y también para sus gastos de pasaje para la distribución  de su producción.
texts.en:
Cacilda, 48, is a happy and enterprising woman.  She's a widow; her husband died 17 years ago.  She lives in her own house with her two children, who are university students.

Cacilda's job is making underwear for women, men, and children.  She also knits bags, shoes, tablecloths, and other things.  She has a sewing machine, which is the main tool for her job.  She does her work in a place inside her own house.  She has been tailoring for two years and she likes what she does because she has time to be with her loved ones.  She considers her business profitable because she has a lot of customers and they're always recommending her for the good work she does.

She got started in this work because she needed to generate income to support her children with their school expenses.  Her children help her sell and distribute her work.  Before she started this business she had a small store and she gave her neighbors credit.  They didn't pay her for the products they consumed, "they swindled her."  She lost her capital because of this event.

She decided to change businesses, and she had the idea of doing what she always enjoyed, which was sewing and knitting.  She didn't have the necessary money so she sold some of her electrical appliances to have support capital.  She hopes to have greater production because she has a large number of customers.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She's very grateful to the institution because they help her grow as a micro-entrepreneur and also as a person.

With the requested amount of 3000 soles [PEN] she's going to buy thread, fabric, and lace, and also pay for her travel expenses for distributing her production.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, and lace

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny de 40 años, es una mujer amable y alegre, vive con Gabriel quien es su conviviente, él trabaja en las noches de guardian de casas. Tienen vivienda propia, en donde vive a lado de sus 3 hijos que están estudiando en el colegio. El trabajo de Jenny  consiste en la venta de comidas criollas como  guiso de pollo, asado de pollo,  adobo de res, entre otros. Su negocio lo realiza en el frontis de su propia casa. Lleva 12 años en éste trabajo y le va muy bien. Comenta que se inicio en esta actividad por la idea  de una amiga quien le propuso que trabajaran juntas elaborando las deliciosas viandas, entonces decidió unirse en sociedad con su amiga y concretar la idea. Juntas  van al mercado cada tarde a comprar lo necesario como arroz, pollo, verduras, papas, zanahoria, condimentos, para la preparación de sus distintas viandas. Es así que se levantan temprano para cocinar cada día y la comida esté a tiempo para el desayuno y almuerzo.  Considera rentable su negocio porque donde vive hay varios trabajadores. El problema que tenía  al iniciar su negocio era la falta de capital para poder comprar sus mesas, sillas y productos  para la preparación de las distintas comidas. Pero fue juntando su dinero y fue comprando las cosas que necesitaba. Espera poder seguir creciendo y construir un local cómodo para la atención a las personas que acuden a comprar sus deliciosas viandas. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, espera llevarse bien con todos los socios de su grupo ya que es nueva. También cumplir con los pagos a tiempo y acceder a créditos en el futuro. Con el monto solicitado 500 soles lo utilizará abastecer su almacén comprará  arroz, huevos, pollo, papa, entre otros. Para tener lo necesario para preparar sus viandas.
texts.en:
Jenny, age 40, is a friendly and cheerful woman. She lives with her common-law partner Gabriel, who works at night as a security guard. They live in their own home with their three children who attend school. Jenny’s work consists of selling native dishes such as chicken stew, roasted chicken, adobo beef, and other foods. Her business is located in front of her home. Jenny has been in this line of work for 12 years and has done very well. She came up with the idea of starting a business after a friend suggested that they work together preparing a delicious menu of dishes. Soon after, she decided to partner with her friend and pursue this idea. Every afternoon, they go to the market to buy supplies that they need, such as rice, chicken, vegetables, potatoes, carrots, and condiments for preparing their various dishes. Jenny wakes up early each morning so that she can begin cooking and preparing food in time for serving breakfast and lunch. She believes her business is profitable since she lives in an area where there are several workers. The problem she had when she started her business was the lack of capital since she needed to buy tables, chairs, and supplies for preparing different dishes. Once she was able to collect the money she needed, she was able to buy these things. She hopes to continue growing and build a comfortable shop where she can serve her customers who come to buy her delicious dishes.

For this reason, Jenny is requesting her first loan from MFP. She hopes to get along well with the other members of her group since she is new. Jenny also hopes to complete her payments on time so that she can access additional loans in the future. This loan she requested in the amount of 500 PEN will be used to restock her business with rice, eggs, chicken, potatoes, and other supplies so that she will have what she needs to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy rice, eggs, chicken, potatoes, and other supplies.
